Reviews.Title: “A very decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Appreci8life
Reviews.Content: Ok, sometimes some small things, some nice touches really do it for me. So let me tell you about a small detail that really made my day. Once I opened one of the draws I saw a universal adaptor. WOW, I know it's a small thing but it just brought back memories of the times I was overseas and it was such a pain to get a universal adaptor brought to my room, or I had to collect it from reception or pay a deposit for it etc, etc. I found the hotel very decent, very close to Darling Harbour and also the restaurant serving the breakfast was top notch. Plenty of fresh fruits and quite a large variety of them. The room was clean, the staff was great and very helpful with directions and maps and truly helpful. One minor pain is that the parking lot is in a building accross the road from the hotel. Literally you get out of the hotel, you cross the street and you are into the parking building. It's a bit of a pain because you need to waste a minute or two to have your ticket validated (if your room rate includes parking) by the helpful guys from valet. Of course, to avoid this you can pay extra and use their valet parking. The room was clean, not the largest I have stayed in but nevertheless it served us well. The shower had good pressure and everything was working well (air con). There was also an in room safe. Great and comfortable beds as well. All in all I had a pleasant stay at this hotel and I do not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Praks_blr
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to the Four Points Sheraton and my experience was very consistent with my previous visit two years ago. The hotel is a fairly typical business hotel with all the amenities you would look for in the rooms. I did not use many of the other hotel facilities, so not in a position to comment on them. Breakfast options are quite good with the buffet, but pricey like most good hotels in the country. The location is great with Darling Harbour, Queen Victoria Building, Pitt Street Mall and the Grand Central Station all within short walking distance. There are numerous eateries of all kinds surrounding the hotel in each direction; best choice for dinner would be Darling Harbour with its nice views and activity. At the end of the day there is nothing that really strikes you about the hotel but it is an efficiently run, functional and comfortable business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, old hotel. Would avoid unless it were free and you need to be by the harbor.”
Reviews.Author: mtd23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a conference in the convention centre. The room had a nice view of the harbor and the front desk staff were very friendly during check in and check out. They even allowed me to check in a few hours early as my flight landed at 6am. The location is also great for access to downtown Sydney and the Darling Harbor. The room itself was average. The staff were not great about tidying up. I found dirty bath towels given to me and a dirty face towel crumpled up underneath the bedside table while looking for something that had rolled onto the ground. My room had extremely loud pipes going through the room. Everytime my neighbor took a shower, it sounded like a pipe had burst and was flooding into the bathroom. This might not have been a big deal except twice my neighbor got up at about 5AM to shower (jet-lag?). When I called, they told me that no one has ever complained about the noise, and they would have to send someone up to check it out before they could change my room. When the guy showed up, there was no noise at that moment (as neighbor was not showering at that exact moment), and they considered the problem solved. Until 5AM the next morning of course...my last night, so I gave up. My room had barely a wi-fi signal. I PAID for internet service for an hour and about 20 minutes in, the signal died altogether. Awful over-priced hotel, 2.5 star at best...would not recommend to my worst enemy. E

Reviews.Title: “Great location but don't expect anything too glamourous”
Reviews.Author: silkcashmere
Reviews.Content: A very family-conscious hotel, where you pay for location more than luxury. Located at the footsteps of the Darling Harbour and within metres from the main George and Pitt Streets, including the coveted Westfield Tower and shops, it is very convenient. However, nothing exceptional in the rooms and in the level of comfort. For the price, I probably would not be likely to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: hksince2002
Reviews.Content: Room was pretty standard. Clean and comfortable with a reasonably obliging staff. Housekeeping and concierge services were prompt. Location is close enough to Centre Quay and The Rocks and we walked over every day. Beds were a little too soft for my personal liking but were comfortable enough. Darling harbour is a stone's throw away and gets pretty busy on the weekends. Lots of places to eat nearby. Checkout was painless and they offer bus service to the airport every 30 minutes or so[similar price as public transport]. Make sure to book seats in advance though.

Reviews.Title: “First stop in australia”
Reviews.Author: kevinsmeaton
Reviews.Content: Great welcome for weary travellers. Fantastic view from the free upgraded room. Drinks vouchers. Fabulous location for Darling Harbour and walking into the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Justin C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located in Sydney, and close to various sights, ferries etc. The only things that stop me from rating the hotel higher are the various small annoyances that cropped up. For example, the hotel keys are very sensitive to being wiped by being close to a phone or (apparently) credit cards - I went through 3 sets of keys during my 5 day stay. Also - free wireless is available in the lobby, but only paid wired Internet in the room. Other than that, good stay across the board at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pauline P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Easter Saturday, I bought a fantastic deal on Wotif, so my son and his girlfriend came along as well. For $199 per night per room , with breakfast included it was just the best deal ever. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The buffett breakfast was one of the best I have ever had, so much variety to choose from . The location couldn`t have been better, just around the corner from Cockle Bay, where we just walked to for dinner and then to one of the Bars around there for drinks afterwards. So close to walk back to the hotel, where we finished off the night with one last drink from the bar that was still opened at 11pm. Checking out was fast , just the way we like it. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with a very nice location”
Reviews.Author: Yasserradwan
Reviews.Content: i spent there 2 days which was a very nice 3 days , location was very very good , 2 min walk to darling harbor with a special way to it , near to the restaurent there and cruise there , food was very good , staff was very helpful , room was good , bathroom need to develope , warm and cold water

Reviews.Title: “"Average with beautiful location and friendly staff"”
Reviews.Author: edubintx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights. Our flight arrived around 7AM and we were at the hotel before the regular check in time so we waited at the lobby while they were getting the room ready. There is free WiFi service at the lobby and the buffet breakfast was okay. The staff are very friendly. Just a few steps away from the harbour, we had a wonderful morning and evening stroll. We did not pay extra for a harbour view so our room was facing the street but overall it provided the expected amenities this hotel chain is known for. I would stay closer to downtown the next time for convenience to restaurants, shopping and sights.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly good stay”
Reviews.Author: randltrip
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best four points in which' I have stayed as this brand is generally considered at the bottom of the Starwoods group. The hotel is a little pricey but in fairness I did not compare other prices as I stayed there as it was the best located hotel in the SPG in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, some good staff but overall not great...”
Reviews.Author: markandphilippa
Reviews.Content: Darling Harbour is a great location to stay in and with a harbour view room the hotel comes into its own. Overall my stay here was average and after several disappointments will leave knowing I won't return. If it weren't for the early check-in and friendly / helpful concierge team my feedback and memories of this hotel would be far worse.. Breakfast service was poor on both mornings, queues and taking 15 minutes for a fried egg to accompany your breakfast is far from ideal when you are away on business. I had to have my room key reactivated twice whilst I was there - given I have been away for three weeks and this has not happened in any other hotel it leads me to think it is Four Points problem and not me - though of course the reception staff pointed the blame squarely in my court. If you do stay here then a walk up to George St is worth the time and the Coast restaurant just five minutes walk away has a good menu and great location.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: HappyOzDayz
Reviews.Content: We had requested a high floor in the Harbour view room. We stayed on the 8th floor overlooking the harbour, it was so worth the extra expense. Lying in bed looking at the view of Darling Harbour was a view to die for. Our room had a balcony taking in a panoramic site. The down side to this was if you looked down from the balcony it was a extremely busy road even so we couldn't hear any traffic noise,especially at rush hour,and there was no seating or table, which would have been fabulous on a warm evening as the views day or night are spectacular, I guess this could have been for safety reasons. The room was a good size and clean. It had all the usual things to make your stay comfortable,fabulous big bed,desk,alarm clock,safe,kettle,mini bar,air-conditioning, hair-dryer, miniature items in the bathroom,shampoo etc. The bathroom was small but adequate and clean. In the corridor area was a ice machine, We opted to stay at the hotel for breakfast which was $35 each.approximately Â£22 each,very expensive. But on the whole Sydney is very expensive. The quality and quantity was outstanding. Coffee is already on your table as you are seated. I would request tea as not a coffee drinker and tea would be swapped in its place. Also freshly cooked eggs are ordered as you sit down. The items are to endless to list,but cooked items,fruit,breads cereal,continental etc.Unusually there was a honey comb on the counter. We didnt stay in the hotel for the evening meal as there are many places around darling harbour to eat. We found a Resturant around the corner from the hotel on Sussex street, Tony Romas,Steak Ribs and Seafood. Unfortunately for us it was our last night, Good price and lovely food. So wish we had found it before hand. Also a great convenience store facing the hotel, great for milk, snacks etc. Word of warning for many if not all of the Restaurants charged a $5 surcharge each on a Sunday. Ouch! for large parties. The hotel has two computers you can use for free in the reception area which was useful to contact home,and comfortable sofas while watching TV. The concierge was extremely helpful,we had booked a trip,which our pick up hadn't turned up, and he rang them for us,problem solved. They were always friendly,and polite. Check in/out was efficient. I would definitely go back to Four Points by Sheraton. It isn't the cheapest but the service in all areas was outstanding, nothing was overlooked. The down side is Sydney on the whole is very expensive,money doesn't go far.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: TonyD62
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a great location and is reasonably priced for a four to 4.5 star .

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: DavidWatt25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent two nights here (a Friday and Saturday night). We booked a deal on the hotel website that included both buffet breakfast and parking, so straight off the bat, the value was excellent. This was our first stay at the Four Points. From the moment we arrived, the service was well above par. Every staff member we spoke to or walked passed were so very friendly and helpful and really made us feel welcome, and not just "another customer". This was very refreshing and a very nice touch. It put a smile on our faces, and was one of the highlights of the hotel. We booked a Harbour View room, having seen some photos of the views from these rooms on the internet. We were not disappointed. We were given a room on the 7th floor. The views of Darling Harbour were fantastic and well worth the few extra $. The room itself was a good size with pretty much everything we needed. The king size bed was extremely comfortable and a nice luxury. There was a nice big tv, with a decent range of channels available. The decor was neat and clean, though some of the brown furniture could do with updating/modernising (if I'm being picky). The minibar had a good variety of drinks and snacks. My one complaint here is the cost of room service. We found it to be extremely expensive. Probably more so than our stays in the Hilton and Westin. For example, we ordered two cups of tea, which ended up costing us $16.50 (including a $6.50 delivery fee). The bathroom was clean and functional. If I HAD to be picky, the "shower in the bath" was the only thing I could say wasn't quite up to par with other hotels in this price range, and it was a little on the small side and the decor possibly a "little" outdated. But this is being very picky, and neither myself or my wife had any problems with it at all. The hotel provided lotions, mouthwash, comb etc were a nice touch and came in handy. The hotel's location is fantastic. A 5 minute stroll takes your into the heart of Darling Harbour and the endless bars, restaurants, museums and other attractions. And there's always a taxi sitting out front ready to take you elsewhere in the city. The buffet breakfast - wow! Such a massive selection! Fruit, cereal, cooked food (eggs, bacon, sausage etc), breads, cold meats, fruit juices, tea, coffee. There really is something for everyone. And it's all so fresh and tasty. We both thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and will definitely return, and would recommend the hotel to anyone. Thank you for a very enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in a hotel for years”
Reviews.Author: NaliniS461
Reviews.Content: Great service, awesome rooms, very accomodating staff

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful view, spacious and clean room and above all, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AureliaBalestra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the most wonderful time in Sydney and just loved out hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly, even though we arrived nearly 2 hours before official check in started they had no problem with us checking in. The room was spacey, comfortable and clean with a beautiful view over Darling Harbour, we were so excited to be able to see the fireworks from our hotel on Saturday but ended up down at Darling Harbour enjoying the atmosphere between all the people instead. We absolutely loved every aspect of staying at the Four Points by Sheraton and the location of the hotel is unbeatable. It's close to restaurants, shops and attractions as well as public transport. We would definitely stay there again and will no doubt recommend the hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Why do people complain about this place?”
Reviews.Author: gchuang101
Reviews.Content: Td be honest, I do not have the slightest clue. This hotel is located right in the darling harbour which is on the edge of the greater downtown business area. It is walking distance to everything. The hotel staff are very helpful, polite. You get a sense of genuine willingness to help which is quite refreshing. People complain about breakfast and the price. Well, I have to say that I do not see any problem. It has australian flavor to it. Lots of choices. I enjoyed the food with local infusion to it. That is why I travel. I do not want to go to a different country and expect locals fit my way of living in America. As far as price, yes, it is very expensive but so is everything else in Sydney. I do not see they are more expensive when compared to everything else in Sydney unless you eat in McDonald or burger kings. even McDonald is more expensive than In USA. The rooms are clean and classic to Four Points anywhere. The parking is 45 AUS dollars which is cross street from the hotel. You need to speak to bell person to get the ticket. They will give you the ticket which will allow you come in and out. Sydney publici transportation is very convenient. However, if you are rush for time, you maybe better off by getting on taxi. It actually make sense to use taxi the cost of the taxi is probably less than renting a car. Car rental is very expensive since your credit card does not cover the liability. You will have to pay extra to cover it. There are shuttles to take you to the door of your hotel. The cost is exactly the same as you take public transportation from airport. I have no clue why. Figure that one for me? It costed us about 90 dollars per day to rent a car not to mention that you need to pay tolls, parking and very expensive gas. however, we were able to go far away to hunter valley which is their wine country and to blue mountain which is a must when you go to Sydney. After all, we had a unforgettable time in Sydney and rest of Australia. Never felling upset when it is time to go but this time, my throat is a lilttle tight when the plane took off. Thank you Australia for a memorable time. You have got a friend here cross the pond forever.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Sydney overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: klevakiwi
Reviews.Content: The Bride and I chose to stay overnight at the four points by Sheraton to celebrate an anniversary recently. We chose the Sheraton as it is conveniently located a 2 minute walk to Darling Harbour and is on the City side of Darling Harbour. There is also a public car park opposite which has all day weekend parking for $10.00.per day, a great deal in a city like sydney.We booked using Expedia, although the same deal could be had on the Sheratons Web Site. We chose a Darling Harbour Superior room Which gave us Darling Harbour Views.For an overnight stay the room was fine, the bed was comfortable, it was quiet with no city noise, and heavy curtains meant the light didnt get in ,so a sleep in was possible.We didnt have breakfast in the Hotel. It is never good value, a 15 minute walk to the Rocks provides cafes where a full breakfast can be had for $15, including Espresso coffee, On balance the Hotel was fine, it was just overnight and is on a par with many other city Hotels.For us location and parking were the determining factor.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here a lot but no more”
Reviews.Author: Biff3ridge
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a lot. I used to rave about it but over the last 2 years it's steadily gone downmarket and the experience has steadily worsened. The check in is particularly unpleasant. My room was minuscule and not what I'd seen in the online pics. I went back down to the front desk only to have to wait half an hour there while they dug out evidence that I was wrong and they were right. Fair enough. But not endearing the way they did it - pretty blunt actually. They couldn't / wouldn't move me (last time I paid for a room upgrade just to get to a double bed) and was stuck with 2 narrow singles (which I pushed together). Room service was glacial. They said 20 minutes (which is pretty standard but took over an hour). And - the bath was dirty and the lamp didn't work. But I just wasn't interested in facing the front desk again to deal with these. And finally - I slept with ear plugs because of the noise of the air-con, left them beside the bed overnight - and they threw the away. it was good while it lasted guys but I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great views but average room”
Reviews.Author: M C
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed there for just one night. We booked a Deluxe Harbour View Room, but it wasn't quite 'deluxe'. The room was shockinly small. The website says the room is supposed to be approx 30m2, but it is nowhere near it, it more feels like 15m2 to me. And don't believe the photos on their website, they are totally photoshoped. The furniture was old, the carpet was old, the TV was old, it was like going back in time to the late 1990's. The view however was great and the location was so convenient. The hotel was right beside darling harbour and just 5mins walk to the shopping areas. All in all, if you think the view and location is more important than the room itself, you may find staying there is a great choice, otherwise stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: JMTrinidad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two-nights during a business trip in Sydney. I stayed here primarily for its location and that it is part of the SPG network of hotels. Location It is located in the beautiful area of Darling Harbour and, if you get a harbour view, gives a grand view of Darling Harbour. The rooms on the other side of the hotel will have views of buildings across the street. It is walking distance to Townhall Station and George Street shops. From townhall station, you can pretty much go everywhere in Sydney. So the location is very convenient. Amenities I have to say that I was disappointed with the amenities. First off, the carpet looks old and worn out. I don't know if its simply the shade and pattern of the carpet but it gives of a weary look. The wooden furniture are very dated and could stand to be upgraded. The bathroom still uses white square tiles that reminds me of old houses. The worst is the shower/bath tub combination. I'm 5'10, so I'm neither short nor am I overly tall. The space is so cramped that I've banged my elbows twice and even hit my head on the wall once while taking a shower. The bed and the TV was decent. If not for the great location, I would have scored them lower due to their amenities that, in my opinion, badly needs an upgrade. Service Service was average, nothing note-worthy. Front desk staff were nice and check-in and check-out were relatively easy.

Reviews.Title: “nice and smooth”
Reviews.Author: MauiMelmo
Reviews.Content: We found this deal on hotels.com and so glad we did. We were able to stay right in the middle of the harbor and felt very 'special'. Everyone took care of us and it was very easy to get a round. We spent less time traveling about and more time doing or just enjoying the area! The room was nice and the free wifi in the lobby was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Wanderers_222
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay here. The service was outstanding from arrival till we fully used our late check out. Walk to Darling Harbour and all the attractions. A complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolates delivered to our room for my husband's birthday was a delightful surprise. The room was spacious and clean, bed was very comfortable and the view across the water amazing. We will definitely return and stay longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Close to lots of restaurants and city centre”
Reviews.Author: rainydaytoast
Reviews.Content: We got a room on the 1st level which was fine, no road noise at all. Nice clean rooms, appreciated an actual hair dryer in the bath room! I found on the hotels website with the best deal including buffet breakfast which was amazing. Haven't stayed in Sydney city before so not sure how this hotel compare's

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but awful front desk and billing”
Reviews.Author: _Prashant_KD
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is good, but apart from that there isn't much to write about this hotel. The rooms are small and the hotel looks very old. Worst experience was having stayed on a room rate which included breakfast and a bottle of water, i was charged for bottle of water, after having checked out from the hotel. They just charged my credit card and sent an updated invoice. I sent 2-3 emails to the hotel inquiring about this, and no one even bothered to reply. Being an SPG gold, i think this was my worst experience at an SPG property.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable 3 days stay”
Reviews.Author: Christine C
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are friendly and courteous. Special thanks to Victoria, who has patiently replied my email queries before my stay. I am particularly impressed with the security. On my 2nd day of stay, I hang a "do not disturb" card outside my door as I do not require room cleaning since I have only checked-in the day before. Then I go out in the morning and return only at night, I realise that there's a card left underneath the door by the housekeeping to indicate that they have come but do not manage to clean my room. Shortly after, 2 security guys knock on my room door. They ask if I am alright and if I need any toiletries and beverages to be replenished in my room. Considering that it's already at night, I feel safe to stay in this hotel. The room has a beautiful harbour view and is spacious. I understand that the hotel will be renovating its bathroom soon. It will be good to install a shower hose instead of a fixed shower head. Location wise, it's just opposite Darling Harbour but is quite a distance from Circular Quay and Chinatown area. Though the room is rather expensive, it's worth it for the exceptional service displayed by the staff and the well-kept room.

Reviews.Title: “great views on a high floor”
Reviews.Author: mossvale
Reviews.Content: bit of hassel sydney is a nightmare for traffic one way streets play a part in that but we arrived ,there is no valet parking so check inn first than go and park car across the road check-inn fine requested a high floor as reading trip advisor thats all everyone pretty much said but there was none so went to room on the 3rd floor room 303 even though they do have views of darlinging harbour it's not as good as a high floor the suite itself is of good size has microwave which is handy needs a little refurb just a bit old looking but still of good size you have a choice of dinner buffet or full menu we stayed 2 nights so the first night tried the buffett which is your norm hot&cold meal we had a bit of a winge to waiter that we would of liked a higher floor about 10 minutes later the night manager asked if we would like to move to a higher floor,and the room would be ready after dinner fantastic service so moved to 12th floor,just stunning views room 1215 although didn't have a balcony the room is much bigger 2nd night ate at the pub just outside which the meals come from the motel but at half the price on saturday nights at 9pm thay have fire works in the harbour great views from your room lots to see &do will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Dahrling Harbour & Shopping in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: amgmhg
Reviews.Content: We travelled in AU for 35 days and really had our fill of hotels. After a cruise to NZ we docked at Dahrling Harbor - but this is FAR away from this hotel - you still need a taxi for 10 minutes. The Hotel is great. Rooms are large, amenities are excellent and much better than we find at a Four Points in the USA. Only drawback, if any, was the walk up a hill to get to main shopping area in Sydney. Do that a few times after being on a cruise, and you'll lose the extra you might have gained. Location is great. Walk over the footbridge to beautiful Dahling Harbor in the evening. We stayed at the Rocks upon arrival and here after the cruise - 2 totally different experiences. Would highly recommend both options as they are so different. When staying at the Rocks, you don't know Dahrling even exists. So be sure to try this too. Aside from a walk up the hill to downtown shopping - this was a really great location and great hotel for the $$

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: JumpRiver
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days on a business trip and found the hotel to be quite adequate. The pro's: â€¢ Location: it's right on the harbor and everything you need is within walking distance â€¢ Staff: the staff is very helpful and will go out of their way to help â€¢ The breakfast buffet is huge (everything from lox to bacon/eggs to fresh fruit and pastries) so if you're offered a rate that includes it I'd go for it The cons: â€¢ They only have wired internet in the guest rooms but do have free internet access in the lobby. I was successful in creating my own wireless "hot spot" by plugging the ethernet cable into my mac and using the "sharing" capability so I could also use my iPad and iPhone. â€¢ The internet is slow (but workable) and is expensive (AUD 20 per day). I was offered a rate that included internet but I saw what the charges would have been. â€¢ The rooms are clean but show age a bit. I would put it at a Hilton or Marriott level. Nothing major here but if you're expecting a luxury hotel with lavish rooms, this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “This has been our best stay at ahotel in a long time”
Reviews.Author: Walleroobie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a four night stay - the first three nights were covered by a client through their corporate account and we enjoyed the stay so much we decided to stay on for an extra night - Saturday night. Whilst making the booking at the reception of the hotel for the extra night I explained that we had decided to stay on because it was my wife's birthday. It seems that the alert receptionist made a note of this because on Saturday evening, after spending a marvellous day with family, we arrived back in the room to find a bottle of champagne on ice and a birthday card from the staff and management - signed by a number of individuals with smiley faces, etc. There is not a single issue in this hotel to complain about. The buffett food is simply the best and on one night with two guests we tried the buffett wine...also outstanding. The staff especially clearly understand that their task is to please guests and I cannot recall one single staff member who did not offer assistance without a genuine smile. There was outstanding enthusiasm and attitude exhibited by every single staff member. These people really know what they are about. Our extra night was an upgraded room with an amazing view of Darling Harbour and as we drank the champagne we encountered an unexpected sight - fireworks on Darling Harbour! Thank you for a perfect evening and truly outstanding service. On a scale of 'delight' for our stay - I cannot give them less than 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kimmmmmm
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly for work. Most times has been great although once I had a super noisy air conditioner. City view rooms look into a carpark. Harbour view is great

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Concierge - very attentive & helpful”
Reviews.Author: TravelfreakAustralia
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at Four Points by Sheraton Darling Harbour and was very impressed with the concierge. One of them rushed to open the door of the airport shuttle bus I was in and then had my luggage in hand by the time I had got out of the bus. He then took me to the check in counter - it was fabulous. The rooms were clean, neat and well kept. The harbour view was lovely at night with all of the lights but not so great during the day as the window overlooked nearby roofing. The location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Delivers what I expected from Four Points.”
Reviews.Author: Hatebeinghome
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at Four Points whilst attending a conference at Sydney Convention and Exhibition Centre. I could not fault the service from beginning to end. My taxi was met on arrival and the porter had my bag out of the boot before I could pay, handed me a ticket noting the cab details, directed me to check in and asked if I would like my bag brought up to my room. Check in was efficient and I was upgraded to a Harbour view room. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated but are compact. There is a large working desk but lighting was limited to one downlight and a couple of lamps. The bathroom is small. The shower is over the bathtub which was quite narrow. Amenities included mouth wash which was a nice touch! Bath gel would be nice. Housekeeping was seamless and bathroom amenitites were replenished daily. The hotel is very quiet and I slept well. The hotel is only five minute walk up Market St to QVB, Town hall station and the Westfield shopping centre. It is about 25 minute walk to the Rocks and Circular Quay. This hotel was perfectly located for the Convention centre. A path alongside the hotel leads to a bridge over the road and stairs down to the Aquarium and Captain Cook Cruises office right on Darling Harbour. It was a relaxing 10 minute stroll around Darling Harbour to the conference each morning. There are a lot of restaurants around Darling Harbour, a Starbucks, Gelato shop and an IMAX theatre. On check out in the morning I was greeted by a porter at the lift lobby who asked if I needed to store my luggage. Check out was efficient. Service in Australia is sometimes lacking. This hotel managed to impress me as I could not find fault. I would chose to stay here again if attending an event at the Exhibition Centre and would consider this hotel for leisure. However, I would recommend Circular Quay area for international tourists if a comparable room rate can be found. Free wifi in the lobby and ice machine on each floor.

Reviews.Title: “Average for this type of large hotel”
Reviews.Author: ggillespie
Reviews.Content: Everyone says the location can not be beaten but I'm not so sure. True, Darling Harbour (and the view onto it from the rooms) is great but for the same price you can stay in a similar hotel in Circular Quay and for anyone who hasn't been to Sydney before I would recommend staying there rather than Darling Harbour. The hotel itself was good, but pretty average for the price and and for this type of large hotel. It was clean, tidy, well furnished and had comfortable beds. I don't want this to sound like a bad review because its not. But i'd have to say if you stay here you won't be disappointed but similarly you won't be amazed.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: johnac001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very convenient location and I have stayed there on numerous occasions. However, it is a very large and busy hotel so don't expect much personal service or attention. The rooms are a reasonable size with a good desk for work. Amenities are fine. This hotel Is all about location - being wedged between Darling Harbour and CBD business/shopping is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: countrymumWesternNsw
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I travelled to Sydney to attend a concert and were keen to fit some shopping and eating experiences in. Front desk staff extremely helpful, room not the most modern I've stayed in, but more than adequate. We walked the short distance to the new Westfield Centre, where we found both brilliant shopping and food. Easy walk to the Entertainment Centre for the concert and then a stop off on the way home to enjoy Chinese. The buffet breakfast was, without doubt, the best my daughter and I have experienced in our many stays at Sydney hotels. Room was not cheap, but was definitely value for money. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for leisure and business”
Reviews.Author: arapuni
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel on numerous occasions, both for business and leisure. Business because it is close to my office, and leisure if I need to be late in the city for an opera or concert, or dinner. I am often upgraded to a harbour view room, and occasionally to a suite. Breakfast is very good, and generally reasonably priced. Service an be a bit snappy (and I don't mean snappy as in fast), and a bit curt. No free wifi. However everything happens very efficiently, and I will continue to stay in this hotel for its convenient location for me, and the efficiency and cleanliness makes up for the odd grumpy check in person.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A449
Reviews.Content: I had a four nights booked in this hotel. When I got there, the hotel said they had upgraded me to a harbour view room but that it had twin beds. Not the end of the world but there was just something about the way the message was delivered that worried me. Turned out the twin beds were singles - and what looked like very small singles. Neither was a bed that I was going to be happy in after travelling half way around the world. So I called down said that I'd like another room. View wasn't an issue - a decent bed was the only thing I wanted. I got a resounding 'no'. So I said I appreciated the that the property was full, and that I'd move to another hotel (there are other Starwood properties in Sydney). That was greeted by possibly the worse customer service I've ever had in a hotel. The person on the phone insisted that I'd booked a twin bed room and that if I left, they would still charge me for the night. It was incredible. I have the top tier in the Starwood loyalty scheme, and this person was telling me it was all my problem and it was this room or nothing. I asked to speak to the General Manager but was immediately stonewalled. So I didnâ€™t even get the chance to escalate the issue. The interaction with this person left me in no doubt that this was not a hotel I wanted to stay in under any circumstances. So I went to the Font Desk, where a very well meaning Front Desk Manager tried everything in his gift to make me happy - including finding me a room with a king bed. But the damage had been done, and I left for the Sydney Hilton, which is a truly excellent hotel. As to the condition of the room - tired and in need of attention. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: DABJILL
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in January 2012 on a room only basis overlooking Darling Harbour. Overall we could not fault the hotel, room or the hotel housekeeping.One thing I would say is that we were there on Australia Day and to see the Darling Harbour fireworks from the comfort of your room was a great bonus. To the right of the hotel their is a short cut which will take you on to the harbour with all its bars and restaurants and the ferry to Circular Quay. Sydney Harbour Bridge. the Opera House and Circular Quay is about 25 mins if you don't mind walking. The "Free Walking Tour" of Sydney is 6 mins from the hotel and is an ideal way of getting to know the city. Opposite the hotel there is a small convienance store for any drinks or snacks you might one to purchase during your stay. Would I stay here again. YES

Reviews.Title: “Get a harbour view if you can”
Reviews.Author: Riglara
Reviews.Content: We arrived after 1030 at night with friends who had just arrived from Singapore, the bar and restaurant were closing by the time we had checked in, but the bar staff were great and organised some bar food (great club sandwiches) for us as we didnâ€™t want to traipse around the streets looking for a restaurant at that time. The room was good size, plenty of space, storage and good bathroom, which you should expect from this hotel chain. Very quiet, given that the hotel seemed full and there were always guests coming and going but you didnâ€™t hear them! The staff, from the bell boys to the concierge were all very attentive and helpful with directions etc, although the check in desk could have been more efficient; they were very slow and couldnâ€™t get the two rooms sorted out. The hotel is just back from Darling Harbour, we booked harbour view rooms which had balconies and although you can open the doors, you canâ€™t sit out which was disappointing. However the view over the Aquarium to the Naval museum was terrific and great to watch the thunder storm on Sunday night. Good location for walking to the ferries to catch a boat into town and a great selection of eateries nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Roluke
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a central location of Sydney. It is a 10 minute walk from the Town Hall stop. The hotel is pretty big so check in lines can be long but they move very quickly. The rooms are fine and serve its purpose. Nothing negative or positive sticks out. There is free wifi in the hotel lobby. The lobby is basic and sometimes, seating is at a premium if you go down to use the wifi. The hotel staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location in a great city”
Reviews.Author: DLCB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July 2011. We needed 2 rooms for the family. The location is wonderful and great for families. There are alot of dining options around the harbor and an IMAX theatre. We truly enjoyed our time in Sydney and our stay at the Sheraton. Would highly recommend this hoted for anyone staying in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Service Service Service”
Reviews.Author: Melbfamof4
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the hotel for their hospitable, considered and efficient service, whilst staying there in Sydney for business. The check in was effortless and I was up graded to a higher floor with wonderful views. Beds and bathroom amenities are top rate. The rooms are smallish but desk size impressive. There is no real space, except for desk, to boil the kettle! Overall I commend the staff and manager for the efforts in what is a busy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in touristy area”
Reviews.Author: ozanita
Reviews.Content: Darling Harbour is for tourists no doubt but with that comes a string of not so great, overpriced restaurants and bars. The pub just outside the hotel one of the better deals that even Sydneysiders frequent. One can still walk to the domain and NSW National Gallery, Opera House etc. if not too pooped from walking all day! Great bed and bedding. No frills in this hotel - cheap namelss toiletries, cheap little radio, instant cofee (only in Australia!) No perks such as bathrobes, Ipod stations and Internet access $12/hr or $24 a day. Recommend harbour view over city. Nicy to have privacy on higher floor with curtains open!

Reviews.Title: “3.5 star masquerading as 4 star”
Reviews.Author: jackbilly44
Reviews.Content: Great location, plenty of good eateries but rooms ate pretty average. One most concerning practice is the lack of top sheet on the bed, just a doona. Service is pretty good. You have to pay $40 for parking per day for the privilege of the location. Food on the restaurant is average.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dara58
Reviews.Content: Just returned back home to Melbourne after spending a couple of days in Sydney. We chose the Four Points Sheraton Hotel due to being a new member of Starwoods, also the position of this hotel is great. Close to everything. Directly across the street is a convience store which sells everything. Check in was a bit slow due to an "upgrade" so was not a real problem. We had a Harbour View Suite, large room, separate lounge, bedroom huge bathroom. Very nice. Our only complaint was that a couple of the power points did not work. No big deal. We found others that did. Breakfast was included with our stay and I must say was excellant. Huge selection of everything you could want. Ten out of Ten.... Monorail is close by as well as Paddy's Market be aware its not opened on but not on Mondays or Tuesdays. All Staff that we encounted were very friendly & helpful. Housekeeping are spot on. Overall a wonderful hotel which we would definetly return to when we visit Sydney again. On a different note, if you decide on using the shuttle transfers from the airport to your hotel, think again, better to grab a cab, (cheaper and quicker) or use the train. The shuttle took forever and there was not organisation.

Reviews.Title: “Four Points Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: OHaras4
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and decor was your standard Sheraton. Although in saying that it didn't somehow live up to their usual standard - so I thought it was expensive with that in mind. Can't say much about the view as mine as on the carpark across the road. Service was very good, friendly staff always willing to help. Parking very expensive at $40 per night. Was a great location for restaurants at Cockle Bay/Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Visit the Dundee Arms Pub while you're there.”
Reviews.Author: onero
Reviews.Content: Once upon a time, Sussex Street in Sydney was lined with little old terrace houses built in the late 1800s and full of history and character. In the 1980s, the New South Wales government formed the Darling Harbour Authority, which was tasked with modernising the area. Most of the old stone houses were demolished, to make way for modern roads, hotels and restaurants clustered around the new entertainment precinct of Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay. The biggest of these modern hotels became the Four Points by Sheraton Darling Harbour. It's actually a grand hotel - the biggest in Sydney - and its 630 rooms and suites offer you either Cityside or Harbour Views. I've stayed at the Four Points many times, and I recommend you book a Harbour View room or suite. They're a little more expensive, but their view of Darling Harbour (and the ferries and boats constantly coming and going on it) is worth the price. Plus you can see the fireworks in Cockle Bay on Saturday night. I like the staff at the Four Points. They're apparently trained to put the guest first, and it shows in their courtesy and their willingness to help. I like the rooms: they're clean and well-appointed. I like the food in the restaurant, and room service is also fast. Most of all, I like the cute and historic Dundee Arms Hotel ... one of Sydney's earliest pubs, which is right beside the hotel entrance. This historic building went from being a pub in the 1800s to being the office of the family business of Sir William McMahon (who later became Prime Minister of Australia) to being the studio of Australia's greatest tonal impressionist painter Graeme Inson and his life partner Ivy Shore. Prime ministers and governor generals, captains of industry, prominent judges and entertainers like Barry Humphries had come here to have their portraits painted by Inson or Shore; and portraits by both artisis now hang in the National Portrait Gallery in Canberra. When the Darling Harbour Authority pulled down most of the other old historic buildings in Sussex Street, it forced these two award-winning Australian artists out. But happily, the Sheraton Group treasured the artistic connection with this historic old building. When they converted it back into a pub, they gave it a distinct atmosphere and a unique selling point by placing portraits, paintings and historic documents belonging to Ivy Shore and Graeme Inson on its walls. You must visit the Dundee Arms, not just for its full bar and its excellent menu, but also for its artistic heritage: you can both read and see that on its walls. The pub even has its own ghost (and details of her are also in newspaper cuttings on the walls!). For me and for many others, this gives the Four Points a uniqueness amongst all Sydney hotels. In addition to history, the Four Points is also handy to the trains and busses and ferries, and the shops and restaurants of Sydney city and Darling Harbour. It's an ideal place to stay. I only have two quibbles about this otherwise excellent hotel: First, flying in the face of best international service, the Four Points by Sheraton Darling Harbour still does not offer free wifi in its rooms. Instead, it charges a fee for this, but does offer free wifi in the lobby if you're prepared to bring your laptop and sit there while you conduct your e-business. Second, the Four Points has just started charging guests a fee for paying by credit card. Again, this flies in the face of best international hotel practice. Pity, because I love everything else about the Four Points ... especially the arty heritage atmosphere of its unique Dundee Arms Pub.

Reviews.Title: “very very average”
Reviews.Author: Njp530
Reviews.Content: I very recently stayed at the four points by sheriton darling harbour, we arrived about 3:30pm and after check in we proceeded to our room, on arrival to our floor (the tenth) and heading to our room we were greeted with empty lunch trays outside 3 rooms on our floor. Not a very good greeting to a 5 star hotel. The next morning when we were packing up and getting ready to leave we realised our "king size" bed was infact two beds joined together. On checking out we paid the $40 for parking across the road, when we got to the boomgate the card we were supplied didn't work saying the card is jammed, on pressing the intercom we waited and waited and waited when finally someone answered so they could let us out. The best thing about this hotel is the location and the view of darling harbour, apart from that it leaves a bad taste for a 5 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service at reception and concierge”
Reviews.Author: maltesesun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a few nights between Christmas and New year and was immediately positively impressed by the warm welcome of the door men, friendly porters who were always ready to help and efficient check-in process. Room was nice and clean and bed comfortable. Unfortunately I didn't use the dining facilities as I preferred to dine out as hotel is ideally located close to all the great spots Sydney has to offer. Parking is a bit pricey at $40 per day but I guess that is the norm in similar cities...so no fault of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Four Point Darling Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, great staff and room overlooking Darling Harbor was very nice. Wifi in the hotel is an issue. You can only access it in the lobby area. However, there is no charge for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: jogti811
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here and it was amazing, we paid for a city side view but were upgraded to a harbour view upon arrival to our amazement. The views were absolutely stunning overlooking the entire Darling Harbour. The service was also fantastic with super quick check in and checkout and very friendly counter staff and concierge. We also got a free bottle of champagne upon arrival as it was our anniversary, WOW!! The only thing that is holding this hotel back from getting 5 stars from me was the rooms were a little outdated. A little more effort in terms of upgrading the furniture can go a long way and make guests feel much more comfortable. Thanks for a great stay and will definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always gets Better”
Reviews.Author: SPG-41640084489
Reviews.Content: This is always one of my first choice hotels when staying in Sydney, the rooms are pleasant and the view amazing. So close to all amenities and they will always do there best to make sure every stay is one to remember. This is one of the only hotels in Sydney i can say i have never had a bad stay and as a SPG preferred member i will also say they have some of the friendliest staff in the entire hotel chain. Every time I stay here it reminds me the way people should act, how a simple smile and cheerful tone can change the entire rest of your day, how a friendly, easy and accommodating check in process can make such an impact on your stay. Great job guys I will always return when I get the chance. Kindest regards Matt

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowMak
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently in this hotel in a city view room. Contributors advising careful selection of rooms could well be right. For us the hotel is OK but nothing special

Reviews.Title: “perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: LuMatos
Reviews.Content: It's a top hotel,close to everything and with the best view from Harbour! and the restaurant is great too!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Price, and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: KGetaway
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in other locations around Darling Harbour, I was wanting a change to see if I could find better service. For $235 for a night we enjoyed: * a Starwood Preferred Guest floor having been encouraged to sign up by the friendly staff at the time of booking * Breakfast for two at the Corn Exchange - which had an impressive quality and service for a buffet style breakfast and certainly worth the add on. * Coffee and fruit pie for two in the lobby bar (yum yum). * Exemplary service (though compared to overseas hotels you still get that feeling with some staff that they are not 100% happy to be there, such as putting a plate down on the side of the table for you to move instead of in-front of you). * Location on Darling Harbour and close to Powerhouse Museum (reason for trip) * Friendly knowledgeable staff * Complimentary late checkout provided at arrival We also enjoyed a lunch meal for the $15 lunch and drink special at the Dundee Arms historic pub which was easy, quick and enjoyable meal before heading off to the airport. Travel to the airport was made much easier with the use of the Hire Car. At a flat rate of $50 it was also the most economical method for us. The driver was friendly, a safe driver, and happy to point out landmarks to us. The car was comfortable, clean, and the most relaxing way to the airport. I can't thank the driver enough for his exemplary service and fantastic personality. In terms of cons, the list is small, and feedback was able to be easily provided to the hotel through use of there comments card. *The rooms only had a blanket on the beds,I am assuming this is the summer arrangement, however Sydney was cold this summer for those from further North. No extra blankets were in the cupboard. *The toiletry range was not the best quality, particularly the shampoo and conditioner were very low quality. *The bath towels need an update as they were small, thin, and rough. *The bathroom exhaust/vent was not very powerful and even with a standard shower the room fogged up *The complimentary late check-out was confirmed with check-in staff that morning, but was this was not passed on to the cleaners; so a clean had been started with one of the towels removed, a little annoying for getting ready to leave. *The bathrooms could do with a touch of an update in the coming year or so (older toilets that are hard to flush/ older fittings) But all in all with so many pro's the con's seemed like barely a glitch. I will certainly be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Best for Darling Harbour Views and good value Seafood Buffet”
Reviews.Author: lozmum
Reviews.Content: After staying here last August, it was a must to watch the fireworks over Cockle bay on Australia day. We enjoyed the light and sound show from the comfort of our room (in pyjamas!), watching through the floor to ceiling windows. Very comfortable beds & pillows, and a good value seafood buffet at $45 for guests (mind you there were other dishes too). A short stroll to nice bars and restaurants for eating out or late night drink. As in most hotels, breakfast was a bit expensive, but with so many nice places to brunch around Darling Harbour, not important. Definitely will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Position, value”
Reviews.Author: Serene_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Four Points By Sheraton Darling Harbour. Upgraded to a Darling Harbour Suite, and it was just fine. The suite was a good size, and generally well set out, although the furniture will be due for replacement in a couple of years. There were two TVs, essential for any married couple. Bathroom was a good size, and the bed was extra-comfy. The view over Darling harbour. was wonderful, We were undisturbed by noise when at rest Check in was as smooth as, although our suite was not ready when we arrived. We arrived early, but had advised the hotel of this. But luggage was taken and we wandered off to see the Harry Potter exhibition so I could buy a Voldemort wand with which to curse enemy golfers. I had thoughtfully told the hotel that it was our wedding anniversary, and they thoughtfully gave us a bottle of bubbly. Nice touch. The hotel is central to just about everything. Directly behind the Darling Harbour aquarium, and the ferry wharves, it is no more than a 15 minute walk to anywhere in the harbour complex. The staff are unobtrusive, and efficient. It was a pleasant experience, and we'll stay there again. It is worth paying for a suite upgrade. There are always, it seems, deals. On the downside, WiFi at $25 per day is just a rip-off. It is apparently available in the lobby for free. If you have an iPad, just get a sim card. Saves heaps and reception is fine. At $35 per head brekky is exorbitant. Never mind, there are dozens of cheaper alternatives within a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Room. Will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: thedancinglemur
Reviews.Content: I was here with my sister over Christmas last year. The location is great! It is very convenient; there is a 24hour mart right across the street. If you head out the main lobby, turn to you right, you will see an overhead bridge which will lead you to the mall across the harbor. Awesome view while you cross. Wildlife park and aquarium just around the corner too. Everything is walk-able! The monorail is close by, Sydney Tower is about 10mins walk away. Paddy's market is about 15-20mins walk away, or you could just take the monorail down to Chinatown. It is bright and safe to walk around the area at night. The rooms are clean. Fresh towels everyday. Lobby has free Wifi and the connection is pretty decent. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. We'll definitely be back again! :)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for both business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: lancashirelass002
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 weeks on business and this was an excellent location for both business and pleasure. I found all the staff friendly and the place was always spotless. The gym was well equipped and there was lots to do in the area. Tony the concierge was excellent and he brightened up my morning daily!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goldenwords
Reviews.Content: Having arrived from an overnight flight from Singapore and be able to check in and also offered an upgrade to a Maritime Studio we were very impressed by the service offered. As the previous review has said the views are very good, the room offered everything you could wish for. Service in the restaurant both at breakfast and evening time was very good. Good variety of food catering for all tastes, the evening buffet was excellent value even oysters in the choice. Concierge also was very good pointing you to the best places. The situation of the hotel is ideal for Darling Harbour and also the ferries to Circular Quay and being able to walk to George Street the main thoroughfare. A very good hotel which offers everything and good staff always helpful and service with a smile, should we go back to Sydney will return to this hotel with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ime B
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a night but will definitely come back again. Staffs are nice and helpful. Clean room and bathroom. Buffet breakfast was great. Very close to Darling Harbour. Wi-fi is very good in reception area but not in the rooms though.

Reviews.Title: “A decent business stay”
Reviews.Author: Jonker_Jan
Reviews.Content: A pretty non-descript business hotel. Well appointed rooms, reasonable price for down town Sydney. Breakfast not cheap, but the buffet has a larger than normal selection of breakfast choices. all in all pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good value.”
Reviews.Author: sydneyshopgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Points Darling Harbour this weekend for a bit of a weekend getaway in our home city. It was a relaxing CBD stay and good value. Pros: - large 24 hour gym with good range of equipment - well priced parking option across the road - complimentary take away coffee and juice counter in the lobby (mornings) - spacious room - very comfortable bed - convenience store and newsagent within minutes of the hotel - quick access (on foot) to George St and its shops as well as Darling Harbour. Cons: - lobby is crowded and congested - check in a little slow due to low staff ratios - no free in room wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: JacsDumbarton
Reviews.Content: The room andante bathroom was clean, huge plasma screen tv which I didn't use but it's there if you need one. to be honest I didn't use much else of the facilities so cannot comment on breakfast/food etc. There is wifi in the reception area but not in the rooms. Location is 5 minutes from darling harbour with by access from the stairs or by walking round the road towards, a little longer but if the stairs are a problem then this is the way to go. Staff were always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean”
Reviews.Author: bongoey
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights here on a business trip in Nov 2011 and enjoyed it, walking distance from the great food at Darling Harbour. Also only a 10min walk to Pitt St and George St so didn't have to worry about getting a taxi if you were headed into the heart of the city. Closest station was Wynyard but that was about a 15min brisk walk. Room was very clean, nice and new. Beds were also comfy. If you're lucky enough to get the rooms facing the harbour then you're in for a treat. Spacious and the room was well furnished with a strong oak desk. Service was okay, staff seemed friendly. The breakfast menu was good but nothing mind-blowing, typical continental breakfast with sausage, mushrooms, egg and bacon plus more. Muesli was a bit of a let down, one morning they didn't have any and the next morning I could tell it was a bit of a cheap brand. But they were always well-stocked for fruit, and also appreciated guava juice, where a lot of hotels only have orange or apple juice on hand. Overall good hotel but might not be worth it for the price unless it's paid for by someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Australia day weekend in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Heron2
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for three nights to celebrate Australia Day. We chose this hotel because of its location being close to Darling Harbour. The location is the best thing about this hotel as it is only a minutes walk to cockle bay restauarants and the shops of Darling Harbour. We booked a Deluxe harbour view room which came with a small balcony overlooking the waterfront. We had booked a restaurant for diinner on Australia Day that offered seating outside on a balcony to enjoy the activities on the water followed by the traditional fireworks at 9pm. The hotel room itself was reasonably large and had all the amenities one could ask for. I was pleasantly surprised by the efficiency and easy confidence that the front desk displayed on check in and also on check out. The hotel does not have its own car parking but does have a contract with a car park across the road from the entrance which worked just fine. We used room service on one occasion and were happy with the quality offered. We also took advantage of the lunch time buffet in the Corn Exchange restaurant on the ground floor which provided a myriad of dishes from around the world to savour. Being close to plenty of restaurant options at Darling Harbour provided lots of opportunity to dine outside the hotel which is what we did for breakast each day. It is easy to get around the popular areas of Sydney from this hotel as the ferry to Circular Quay is available from King St Wharf two minutes from the hotel. We enjoyed our stay here and would recomend this hotel to anyone who is contemplating a visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: the_dudeAuckland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights on a business trip. Staff were great friendly and always ready to help Food at the inhouse restaurant was fantastic Overall fantastic place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Stay thanks to my hubby and the wonderful team”
Reviews.Author: koullka
Reviews.Content: Let me preface by saying i have very high expectations, so if your not usually particular about decor, service, don't read too much into my points. My hubby booked our tenth wedding anniversary as a surprise getaway. He chose Sheraton Fourpoints, as we had been there for work previously, and because of its great location. I was happy enough, because of the beautiful view, close proximity to darling harbor and previous experiences. When we checked into our suite (normally $500, but we got 3 nights for price of 2) I was pretty happy with the room and view - although it did seem a very slightly dated and the bath was a little lack old. I called, mentioned my slight dissapointment with the bathroom (cracked bath). The lovely receptionist couldnt move me (fully booked) but offered complimentary breakfast for our stay as a goodwill gesture. I was very appreciative and continued on with our romantic anniversary weekend. I had no clue my husband organised the MOST ROMANTIC EVENT EVER!!! The absolutely lovely staff members (Flavia, Sarah and YAMMI) helped my hubby pull off a private dinner for two on the rooftop - with a fully personalised menu from the CHEF and access to the best view of the fireworks. We were treated like royalty, and with a $1000 minimum spend, I expect to be - but YAMMI was wonderful and made us feel even more special than she had to. This helped make the night SOOO MEMORABLE! I would suggest in the future the events team have the little "extras" my hubby organised himself eg. FAIRY LIGHTS in the trees, heaps of candles (even use his idea of a pathway to the table) romantic italian music, a private open air cinema etc etc.. The only hiccup is that we were told we could view the fireworks from the balcony closest to the waterfront, and the security officer was very cold and standoffish and told us off - which was a big DOWNER after being treated so magically. Yammi was AMAZING - thank you for taking so many precious pictures xx The next day we were called by the HOTEL manager, Steve, who offered us an upgrade to the GOVERNER SUITE - retailing for $2k a night. He met and escorted us to the room, and warmly wished us the best anniversary weekend. Throughout our stay, we were often spoilt, and even at breakfast, we were delivered two mimosas in celebration of our anniversary. I really believe the service goes above and beyond any experience to date (I am an event manager and have had my share of hospitality experiences). Overall a five star score for an amazing peronalised experience, great service, perfect location and stunning views. Thank you to the entire team - Steve, YAMMI, Flavia & Sarah!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in the heart of Sydney!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zyclop
Reviews.Content: I and my girlfriend stayed at Four points for 2 nights. The hotel made us feel really happy and not disappoint to choose this hotel. First of all, i and my GF arrived to hotel so early, we knew we could not check in at that time. I asked for leave our luggage and would come back. But F/O staff said hotel had room available for us. I can say only WOW!!! Its fantastic for early check in which never happened to us before. Moreover, when we had to check out my GF asked for late check out, we got 1 more hour extend without charge. it make her very happy. Only 1 thing which us not too satisfy is breakfast. I cant give Full points to taste and quality of the ingredients.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyhols043
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this great hotel for 5 nights 5th-11th jan, we had a harbour view room on the 8th floor the room was very spacious and modern. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom was big and decorated lovely. Our veiw onto darling harbour was wonderful looking right out onto the aqurium and we could see the whole harbour. All the staff in the hotel were very friendly and the concierge staff were very helpful, we stayed b&b and found the breakfast food exellent with plenty of variety. The hotel was very central for the city shops & chinatown just 5 mins down the road, i would not hesitate to book this wonderful hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “You cannot beat Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnMac1947
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip of 5 days so I decided that I would take my wife and stay in the city rather than North Sydney. What an inspired move that was, almost as inspired as staying at the Four Points in Darling Harbour. Room was excellent, good size, great view over Darling Harbour even from the 3rd floor, bed was very comfortable, air con worked a treat (just as well with huge glass windows catching the afternoon sun). Unfortunately the bathrooms, while a good size and well equipped with amenitites suffered form my pet hate, showers over a bath and shower curtains. Bonus that almost made up for it was an ice machine just down the hall which we made good use of during our stay. Being surrounded by a myriad of Darling Harbour restaurants meant that we didn't eat in the hotel at all so I have no comments on the food & service from the F&B team but was very happy with the service from all the other hotel staff we dealt with. My wife managed to find her way to the shops and back again easily (even with a bundle of shopping bags each day it seemed) so once again as the real estate people say... location location. We would stay there again, in fact I have booked there in march to attend a family wedding in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and quality.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug_83Sydney
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times for business and leisure and it has always been a consistent high standard with rooms clean and modern. Service is great with everyone being helpful and informative. We were even lucky enough to be given a bottle of champers and treats for our anniversary stay. A very special touch for a memorable stay. Location is ideal, walking distance to the heart of the city and Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in Sydeny”
Reviews.Author: TianStar
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in a perfect situation... close to darling Harbour, restaurants and nice entry and lobby... rooms were a bit smaller than what I expected but fine..bathrooms also need some updating.. but for a downtown hotel was fine.. Wifi should have been complimentary considering the rates..But overall cant complain had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but average service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: anita70
Reviews.Content: We booked the rooms 5 months in advance because we were staying for New YearÂ´s Eve and we needed connecting rooms (we have small children, and there are no rooms with two king or queen beds were we could stay all together). My husband is a SPG Platinum member and we expected some pampering too. But when we arrived, no connecting or even adjacent rooms were blocked for us. No complimentary breakfast, no fruit plate nor even room with a view of Darling Harbour. We complained but only after we had hanged all our clothes, they called us to say they had two rooms ready with great view, adjacent but not connecting. It was nice that they made the effort, but the magic was gone and weÂ´d already got the feeling that they didnÂ´t really care if we were Platinum or not. The bathrooms are very basic, the rooms are OK. The location is the best thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: N3wygirl
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in Sydney at the Four Points. The concierge staff were wonderful and very welcoming. Unfortunately one of the girls at the desk was less than pleasant when we checked out. She didn't even ask how our room or stay was, which was a bit of a downer after all the other friendly staff! It would also be better if the parking was explained somewhere, or somehow more clearly. It was a simple instruction in the end, after we spoke to three different staff. The hotel was in a convenient location, a short walk to Pyrmont Bridge and to the main streets of the city, including Westfield. We had an okay view from the second floor, although next time I would request a room higher. The breakfast was ok, but very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfy stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: laurenmccartney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Points by Sheraton on the 14th of January this year for business This hotel is very basic, no pool ect. its great if you're just sleeping there, but there isnt much atmosphere. The location is brilliant ! very good proximity to surrounding restaurants and the harbour

Reviews.Title: “Directly across from the Aquarium”
Reviews.Author: Susan36384
Reviews.Content: The Four Points is a very nice, clean hotel with a great, friendly staff. They can call an aiport shuttle bus to get you to the airport ($16 pp). It is about a mile away from the Circular Quay where you can take a ferry over to the zoo, Manly Beach, etc. We took the hop on, hop off bus, and saw the entire city and the Bondi Beach area. It was a great way to view Sydney in its entirety.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pete K
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that isn't in the top price bracket, though is in a brilliant location if you plan on exploring all of Sydney and Darling Harbour, then this is a great choice. We booked in to a Darling Harbour view room and the view is wonderful. Not many hotels have unobstructed views when you are in a city and for the price, it is brilliant not to have any obstruction to the view what so ever. The rooms are comfortable, though our air conditioning was a little loud making sleeping a little awkward during the night. The pillows also weren't to our liking with the choice of either a feather pillow which had no body, or a hard pillow that was too tough. Breakfast is of a good standard you would expect from a nice hotel and the staff are pleasant. From a perspective of location, view and price, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “review of my recent stay at Sheraton four points-Sydney, Australia”
Reviews.Author: rforreider
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a excellent facility for business or leisure stay, as it is well staffed, with professional employees, and it is clean, near the harbor, and central business district, and within easy walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Location good but average quality”
Reviews.Author: OliverPerth_WA
Reviews.Content: Good location just 5 minutes walk from the Aquarium, Maritime Museum and other attractions around Darling Harbour via a walkway across the freeway (one star). Kids loved the 3-minute proximity of Tony Roma's too! Check-in process was efficient but especially friendly. Adjoining (but not linked) rooms were only average with great view over car park (do ask for harbour view if available)!! New Year's Eve buffet at $85 per head (for both adults and children) was frankly ridiculous for what was a limited and not very good quality buffet. It was a rip-off - did they think the cheap party hats and hooters would make up for it? Don't go there for New Year! The proximity of the single restaurant to the front door/concierge desk means you get a food smell every time you enter the hotel and it all feels very cramped. Breakfast was no more than minimum needed (eg no fresh juices and they tasted like the cheapest they could lay their hands on). I'd prefer (with a bit of extra time) to go into the harbour area and have breakfast there - cheaper and higher quality. All in all a very average experience but I will end on a mild high. When we returned to Sydney off a cruise two weeks later the concierge did allow us to store our cases for the part of the day until we had to leave for our flight in the evening (second star). But unless you have no choice I'd tend to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler M
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect location. Darling Harbour is central to Sydney and a short taxi ride or walk to most attractions. The downside is that a double room is really twin beds- like when you were 10 years old twin beds. The breakfast buffet is thorough and has something for everyone but not a big hot selection (no omelette bar, pancakes, waffles, etc) but good enough considering it's free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgent34
Reviews.Content: We have small children so we need connecting rooms. I email the reservations department 2 times to request. But when we arrived no connecting or even adjacent rooms were blocked for us. As a gold memeber I would expect that the reservations agent could communicate to the reception to block our rooms. So, we had to pack up and move on the 2nd day. Got upgraded to a suite which was not ready until after 5pm so it was inconvenient for us to say the least. Just a basic hotel but nice to be right at Darling Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “High hopes met by low standards”
Reviews.Author: Ben D
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for a surprise getaway with my significant other for an overnight stay on a Saturday night. Upon booking, we were informed that check-in was 3pm ad we told them we expected to arrive at 4pm. We ended up arriving at 4:30 and were told our room wasn't ready, so we had to wait in the lobby for another 55 minutes for them to clean and prepare our room. When we finally walked in the door of our room, we found it had been cleaned quite haphazardly and the aging decor was in poor repair. Wee tried to make the most of it and unpacked and ended up wearing thongs in the shower-over-bath because it was so grubby. The room service food was overpriced (as most places are), but the quality was really lacking. We ordered a full breakfast for 2 people which cost us $70 and for that we received a slice of budget (non-rasher) bacon, toast, fruit (the best part of this meal), longlife orange juice and what tasted like powdered eggs. Not exactly gourmet.. Would have been much better off heading to a cafe on Darling Harbour for a $20 per person big breakfast. We tried connecting to wi-fi, but there wasn't any and they didn't have a pool. I'm not sure how they earned a 4.5 star rating, because I har stayed in much nicer 3 star places that didn't cost anywhere near as much. We stayed in one of the most expensive suites available and would have been disappointed if it was half the price. I will never stay at the hotel again and if I overhear anyone talking about staying there in future, I will share with them my experience in the hope that they do themselves a favour and stay somewhere else. My weekend escape was ruined by Four Points by Sheraton and I hope nobody makes the same mistakes as me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - OK room”
Reviews.Author: ordflyer
