Reviews.Content: Located on Darling Harbour, the Four Points has a great location but the rooms are not quite as nice as the location. I have stayed in other Sydney hotels in Central Business District (read my review on the Westin) including the Hilton, Westin, Four Seasons. Clearly when one stays at a Four Points, they should be expecting a slightly lower level of service and amenities than these other brands. However, I have stayed at other Four Points and although more â€œplain and simpleâ€� they are still very good properties. The room we had was ok, and the bathroom had a slightly dated feel about it. There is no Wi-Fi in the room â€“ something that should exist (in my opinion). The bed is reasonably comfortable. A Taxi to the airport will run you approximately AU$35 to $40 and take about 25 minutes. For those with SPG Platinum status, there are no amenities for the Platinum members â€“ no lounge, no free breakfast, etc. A OK hotel for an overnight stay or two, if you are looking for more comfort and the Westin or Hilton are only 0% -25% more expensive than the Four Points, I would recommend those hotels over the Four Points, unless you really want this specific location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location - hotel pleasant but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: morewindOZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights in December while I was attending a conference in Sydney. It was a very convenient location. I had a city view room - work was paying so went for the cheaper option! It was a little disconcerting to see how close the workers appeared in the offices across the road - make sure the curtains are drawn!! My room was a long trek from the lifts, but it was quite adequate for my needs. Nothing to distinguish it from lot of other places I've stayed - could have been anywhere. I didn't try the dining facilities as these were part of my conference, but they looked interesting, especially the old Corn Exchange. I understand they don't have wi-fi in the rooms, but I always use my own so this was not a problem. Staff were very helpful and friendly and cabs were always on hand. Very handy for the shops, Darling Harbour and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: GarryONewJersey
Reviews.Content: After reading the revues on trip advisor we were not totally sure what to expect but since the majority indicated it was a good place to try we decided to try it. The room cost was very welcome, well within reason especially since we were visiting over the Christmas/New Years holiday and the rates in most hotels were just WAY out of our reach. So this hotel proved to be well worth the money, quite comfortable, large firm bed which we love, grew view, request harbor view for sure. Also the room was a good size, didn't feel cramped at all. Certainly you can stay in much fancier (highly expensive) hotels but this is a great value and a nice place to stay for sure. Also well within walking distance of China town and fantastic food at the Golden Century. We only ate breakfast but the buffet was good for sure, we didn't try dinner or any other meals so can't comment. We would recommend this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Trading on its location but doesn't meet Sheraton standards.”
Reviews.Author: bronte4
Reviews.Content: I stayed on and off here for five or so years- mainly when I lived in Sydney and wanted a place to stay after seeing a show without the hassles of driving, parking and driving home. Mind you, I've always regarded it as a "convention hotel". This trip was to be special: "mother-daughter time" together, at the sales, visit the new Westfield, the re-vamped Pitt Street Mall and visit Jamie Oliver's new restaurant and those in the re-vamped Star Casino before daughter left for work abroad. Check-in. Wonderful. Friendly and delightful. Parking: do it yourself across the road at extra cost (complicated if one wants to extend stay). *Not* acceptable. Obvious this is a "car less" convention hotel. I'm a member of the Sheraton chain. Room upgraded (nice one). Room: large but the doors separating living space from sleeping space are broken and remain so for our stay. Ditto bed side lamps despite repeated calls to house keeping. Bathroom and dressing room spacious. View of ANZAC Bridge does not qualify as a "Harbour room" in my opinion. Non-opening windows for obvious reasons. Air con freezing. Without, stifling. Fridge not up to keeping David Jones' goodies chilled (surprise!). Buffet breakfast was included in our "deal". Bain marie's don't do it for me. Skipped it and went elsewhere (Chinatown). Wanted a club sandwich and salad or similar to share for lunch. No luck. Went elsewhere. Ordered steak (as I've done each visit) for room service dinner. Knew from previous experience, to order a steak knife (and I have my steak "blue"). No steak knife provided. Steak served medium-rare and impossible to cut with a regular knife. Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and great value”
Reviews.Author: Vic_Huss
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have both arrived at the hotel from Western Australia today and found the staff to very welcoming and friendly. The room, overlooking the harbour, (8th floor), is very nicely appointed, clean and has a great view. Restaurants are very close by. My wife and I are very pleased that we chose hwre after reading the revues on TripAdvisor. We will definitely stay here again and recommend the hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect but seriously, no wifi?”
Reviews.Author: MrMatthew
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, definitely opt for a harbor view room if you can, the view is spectacular. Hotel staff are helpful, air-conditioning works well in rooms (which is critical in summer) and the location is perfect for everything you will want to do in Sydney. My only complaint is that they have no wifi in rooms. Seriously, it is 2012, not 1999. Many laptops, smartphone and tablets don't have Ethernet points and no wifi in room is a major oversight for both business and leisure travelers. Otherwise I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect, in every way”
Reviews.Author: Feldy1647
Reviews.Content: The location was just perfect, 5 min walk to darling harbour, and that pretty much means access to all of Sydney by ferry. The room was excellent, the food was delivered fast and was excellent quality, very tasty! The staff were very polite and helpful. Recommend this hotel to anyone who can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing was a problem!! (A Novel)”
Reviews.Author: paradisetravellers
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2nd visit to Sydney within a matter of a couple of weeks or so. This time although to attend a funeral time this time around, however i was still looking forward to our visit with Sheraton. I had also mentioned for no other reason, except I was asked, why were we returning, mentioning that it was an emotional journey to sydney this visit. Enough said .. we were upgraded to a suite on the 15th floor, looking directly over the harbour. It was delightful. Our favorite waiter PAT was still there to also look after us at meals especially my husband, and most staff bent over backwards to make our stay as pleasant and smooth as possible. I do have one complaint (oh dear!) That is whilstsitting at the Dundee arms enjoying a bevy or two (outside), the music was considerably and I feel unneccsarily loud. I approached the bar person, who by the way had an attitude and smiling problem, if he could turn the music down slightly, to which he answered that it was set on standard control well that's a newby! Standard control!!! Okay I thought so be it standard hum bug and walked off. However the next day (we stayed for 3 days) we went and had a coffee and took it outside and guess what punters - the volume was down, new bar person so i was inquisitive and asked what was the go? Standard control through the day and night pulling my hair out I couldn't get my head around the stupidity of an excuse of how loud the THE BAR STAFF WANTED IT! I maybe a blonde but rooollly please bar people... apart from that hiccup our stay was yet again fantastic and we were made to feel at home without the staff being to intrusive or inept. I would highly recommend this property and even joining the starwood group, as we had been with Accor for many years and when we ran into the most ignorant executive chef at the sofitel who not only argued with the waitress and the maitre De, but a guest (me) about a special dietary requirement for my husband advising all of us in no particular terms that he did not want toto do it for my husband because it would ruin his food. Oh gosh red flag waved in face, no triole red flag so i went directly to the manager as one would do, complained very strongly and commenced to pack our bags to leave. However we were asked to stay on with the sofitel compliments(this was really not the outcome we wanted but admittedly it did help at the time). Needless to say as soon as we arrived home cancelled our Accor and haven't looked backwards as yet with starwood. Starwoods rewards vouchers are a great incentive also, just like Accor use to be, but they as a chain have become to frugal and hiring staff who should be employed to feed zoo animals with their attitudes. Well now I have had my vent - and will certainly return to four points again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: faymen
Reviews.Content: Perfect location facing the darling harbour. We stayed in the delux harbour facing room. We saw the new yr eve fireworks at the darling harbour from our balcony.Breakfast and service was good.lots of restaurant located near the harbour.monorail station and ferry service very close the hotel.Overall good stay and would recommend thus hotel. Cons- There is no hotel parking available. There is paid parking in front of hotel.parking is expensive. Room lighting is low. Room definetely requires more lights No swim pool in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: waywayway
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed here over the Chrismas period, and from the moment we stepped out of the taxi we knew we had made the right choice, Everyone smiled and greeted us, The room was a good size with a great view over Darling Harbour. The Restaurant was first class, we could not fault the breakfast spread, and would like to say how helpful the staff were, a special mention to Shin Ching, We will be back the next time we head over to Sydney from the UK Keep up the great work Freddie

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Moullie
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night in a harbour view room so we could view the fireworks from our room. I was travelling with a disable person so viewing the fireworks from our room was ideal. I was given a room on the 2nd floor with a tree right outside our window and another on the left. I was not happy with this considering it was $525 for the night for harbour views. Upon speaking to the assist manager on duty he adivised there was no other rooms available and I could still view the fireworks in the sky and perhaps not down into darling harbour. I was more irritated at 9pm when the first fireworks started and we couldn't view all fireworks in the sky because the balcony for the room above obstructed the fireworks sky view. I was totally ripped off! When I rang and made the booking I was reassured I was getting a room that would have full view of the fireworks. The room I was given should have not been given to anyone on NYE as a harbour view room. What a disapointing night!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Cynicor
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the end of September in a harbour view room. Overall the stay was pleasant enough; nothing went wrong and a convenient location. Check-in was pleasant and efficient and we were able to get early access to our room with absolutely no hassles. In fact, all the staff we encountered were excellent. The breakfast was better than I expected with quite a large selection but doesn't seem quite as fresh as the higher rated hotel. The bedroom was nothing special although serviceable, but the bathroom felt quite dated and in need of refurbishment. We visited the lobby lounge and had some snacks. Service and drinks were good but it was quite full as it is very small. We didn't have any other meals and didn't try the pool/gym (if any) or use the concierge. Location is convenient for Darling Harbour and CBD and we were easily able to walk around most of Sydney. Not sure what it is like for public transport access. Overall we would probably stay here again, at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Cph4
Reviews.Content: Just not impressed with the overall experience. The room was very expensive and it was just not that great. Furniture was plain and run down. Location and view was the only thing going for this place. Left and went to the Westin after the first night for 20 AUD a night more and it was gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Tammy F
Reviews.Content: The Four Points Sheraton is in a perfect location, walking distance to all the attractions at Darling Harbour, Circular Quay and shopping in the CBD. Upon arrival we got upgraded to a harbour view room, a fantastic view! The room price was very reasonable for Sydney, but like others have commented, the restaurant in the hotel is pricey. This didn't bother us as there are plenty of eating options a short walk away., I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Seafood Buffet!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy V
Reviews.Content: Worth the walk down to Cockle Bay to the Four Points by Sheraton 'Corn Exchange Restaurant' to indulge in the Seafood buffet! We were staying at the Westin but they had a huge function downstairs which made it impossible to enjoy dinner so we ventured further a field. We were met by employees Kate who, along with Joshua, were very attentive to our table of four. Further, on being asked, Joshua recommended a fantastic wine from the extensive list. The food was fresh, well-presented and replenished constantly. A remarkable, varied selection which caters well for vegetarians and the non-seafood lover. Oh, the desserts were yummy too!! Well done Sheraton! Sandy

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - Location makes up for all else !”
Reviews.Author: jomer
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean and service was great. The rooms are a little small but well maintained. Bathroom is small but clean and functional... Breakfast is over priced for what it is. in general perfect if you are looking for some where close to stay with great views and not planning on spending too much time in the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and outdated”
Reviews.Author: H C
Reviews.Content: The location is the only positive and it is not enough to overcome the many negatives. Staff ranged from surly to uninterested, the requested early check in resulted in a check in time later than advertised regularly, parking lot view in a room with flooding bathroom issues. Outdated decor and having stayed at quite a few four points and starwoods hotels around the world I am surprised that either company remains affiliated with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Convinced”
Reviews.Author: Champagne4everyone
Reviews.Content: As SPG gold members who choose to stay at Starwood properties for holidays, we are lucky to stay n some of the best hotels n offer in Australia, NZ and around the world, Four Points Darling Harbour has more to do before it gets a good rating or review from us. On arrival at the hotel it looks very clean and well presented, we were served by a young lass that needs to learn about customer relations ensuring she makes the guest feel welcome. We booked a harbour view suite which on the website says have these rooms have private balconies and floor to ceiling windows, please make sure you check with hotel direct when booking this room category as only 50% of the suites have these features. The decor is tired but reasonably maintained and housekeeping do an excellent job at cleaning, Rooms are very clean! The views are spectacular as is the service from the front office manager, Nigel- huge asset to the hotel and he dealt with our concers both professionally and courteously and should be commended for his high level of service, the service in which we are used to receiving from Starwood properties. The bathrooms do not match the aesthetics of the rooms with all room/suite categories having shower over bath, something clearly directed at the Japanese market 10 years ago but in most Asian pacific hotels of this standard are now moving towards separate bath/shower configurations. The same bathroom amenities are also used in suites as in the lower category rooms, this s definitely something the hotel could improve n and the towels small and are like sand paper, not good quality at all. The king bed was very comfortable but again the linen needs replacing. The hotel is in a great location with the harbour at the doorstep and it's million dollar views. The concierge staff are fantastic, very helpful as are the management team. We had an issue with the room service food but this was promptly rectified. In summery this is an average-good 4 star property with the potential to be a fantastic property and I feel we just had a few things go wrong all at once. We have been informed that this property is due for a significant refurb in the new year and we look forward to returning there when these refurbs are completed. I have added some photos for other readers to have a look at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & king- size beds”
Reviews.Author: Ready2Go2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location and (not so common in Australia) king-size beds. We had a room on the river side with a fabulous view of the harbor. There is not enough light in the room to read at night except in the bathrooms. The breakfast buffet was way overpriced. The evening seafood buffet had great shell fish but all the main courses for those who don't want shell fish (fish, beef, chicken) were poorly cooked. There is free wi-fi, but only in the lobby. There are plenty of places to eat either along the harbor (2 minute walk) or in China town (5 minute walk.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. OKAY as a 5-starry accommodation”
Reviews.Author: KittyKatze
Reviews.Content: Location-wise.... GREAT!!! Accessible to most stuff you may wanna see in parts of Sydney. Beauty of Darling Harbour, maritime Museum, Aquarium, Chinatown, fish market.... pretty nice.... As a hotel, they meet your basics. Decent room, on-time cleaning up.... Good to meet the basics of the business travelling party.... It was OKAY... comfy... that's about it!

Reviews.Title: “Not so good this time”
Reviews.Author: Biff3ridge
Reviews.Content: Paying premium rates at this place and teh rooms are really small. Paid for an upgrade but herds of noisy scholars running around teh halls. Still a good place but get an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, needs an update. Just okay”
Reviews.Author: Harry1Melbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night but my partner stays regularly as location to work is good. Had a suite which was big but dark and poor views. Room was next to a board room and was woken by very noisy meeting, even though we had requested a quiet room. Even though we are gold members of star points we were not offered an upgrade nor late checkout. Had to ask for these to happen, the staff didn't appear aware. Very poor service in the bar. Would stay here again for convience only.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Jan J
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent and the service generally very good and the reception staff were particularly helpful, although the waiter assigned to my table in the resturant was not very attentive and I needed to go and find someone else to help. The buffet although convenient would become boring if you ate here more than 2 nights as it did not really change much. Although I realise mine was a last minute booking in a busy season I was disappointed with the size of the room and could barely find enough room between the beds to close the curtains. However the bed was extremly comfortable and the room was well appointed and cosy.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Jason526
Reviews.Content: We paid over $700 for 3 nights in Fours Points. Just not worth the money. I guess it is in Sydney. No doubt about the location, close to everything. Very nice hotel staff!! Just the hotel room is just average. The size of it is just too small. The bed is even smaller than a single bed. So tiny small. Can't even turn over on it. Bathroom is ok. Room service is ok. Just an average hotel, not worth some high season rates. Total not matching the name under Sheraton. Carpet is not clean, water stain left on it. Can't even imagine what was on it. ewwww

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nurs0149
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June 2011. It's about 15-20min walk to Circular Quay, 10-15 min to the Queen's shopping area, <5 min to the pedestrain (Pyrmont) bridge over Darling Harbor, adn 10min walk to the train station. The room was spacious, comfortable, and I had an amazing view of Darling Harbor (not Sydney Harbor, but still gorgeous). The front desk was very friendly and helpful (a Texan). The concierge also helped me several times--spa treatment at another Sheraton nearby, reservations for the airport bus, directions. The restaurant and bar were good but expensive (normal for Sydney). It might have been nice to be a little closer to Circular Quay but it would have been more expensive. This was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuxusTravel
Reviews.Content: Average Rooms, great location, nice staff. The rooms are rather plain for the price point. No exec lounge, and a rather simple pool. Location is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “The great location”
Reviews.Author: CalvinHobbes111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located close to main Sydney attractions. It is just a walking distance to an Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay, Sydney Convention & Exhibition Centre and city centre etc. The room was really basic and a bit tired but clean. The bed was really comfortable. Soundproofing was not the best one, bathroom noises (shower etc.) from the neighboring guest rooms were quite loud. Wi-fi connection was free in the lobby, but not in the room. These days it should be free everywhere. The fitness room with a view to the Darling Harbour was functional. The staff was very friendly and helpful, all requests were complied with promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but bad bad breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: chapel8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November 2011 for a trade show at Syd convention centre. Considering it's a starwood hotel I gave it a first priorty over other darling harbour hotels despite it being about 20% more dearer. Overall the hotel location, service from staff and hotel amenities, cleanness is very good! My only complaint is their crappy breakfast buffet. It was soggy, over/under cooked and lacking freshness in general. Darling harbour has plenty of cafes which serves excellent variety of fresh breakfast at cheaper prices so if you are to stay at Four Points by Sheraton ! Then my recommendation is to book it WITHOUT breakfast and save some money!

Reviews.Title: “Location, but thats about all!”
Reviews.Author: Eamovet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Location is fantastic! Very impersonable Hotel- seem to be treated as a number as opposed to a valued customer. Very expensive also. Got a massive shock at checkout when I was charged 130dollars for a phone call to Ireland that lasted just over 10mins. Now I know I should have checked before I phoned but I presumed(incorrectly) that international phone rates would be the same as in most hotels! Unfortunately I was wrong. 13dollars per minute is nothing short of extortinate!! When i queried this with staff I was told this was just hotel policy!!! Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jloPerth
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at Four Points, this time in a Darling Harbour Suite. The room is spacious and clean and the bed is really comfortable. The views over Darling Harbour were lovely, however the noise coming from the harbour on a Saturday night is very noticeable and is worth noting as the Suite on the city side on 15th floor was really quiet. There is also a major road running between the hotel and harbour and the noise from this is also really noticable. It is not worth opening the balcony door as the noise is really bad. The hotel is so well located to Darling Harbour and easy walking distance to shopping on George St and trains. The staff are all lovely and we always had a smile and greeting from the housekeeping staff. We had dinner at the Dundee Arms attached to the hotel as we had eaten here a few times on last visit. It took over an hour for the food to come as they had lost the order and we had to follow up twice which was disspapointing. A great breakfast / lunch option is Waldemere's which is a few steps along Sussex St. Much better pricing, atmosphere and food that Darling Harbour. Another great stay and I would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ansh9899
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with family - wife and a teenage son after having checked out of IBIS hotel. Great hotel, lives upto the reputation of Sheraton. The location is the best one can think of in Sydney. It is right at Darling Harbour, very close to Wynyard Railway station, walking distance to Opera House and Harbour Bridge, Curcular Quay and City Centre. The best locations that Sydney can offer. The room I got was overlooking the Darling Harbour and most of the times, we were just sitting next to the large window the room had and sipped our tea looking at the sights of the Darling Harbour. The staff is very courteous and helpful. Many of our requests were complied with promptly. The check-in and check out was a breeze. The rooms were very decent size and had comfortable beds, good choice of cofee and tea in the room as well as toileteries. The bathroom too was spacious and offered comfortable bath. The breakfast spreads were very good, even for strictly vegetarians like us. That was one meal my family looked forward to. The only problem was the wifi conncetivity in the rooms. Free wifi was available in the lobby and we would see most guest with their laptops in the lobby making use of the free wifi. The internet was available in the rooms but at steep charge of AUD 24.9/day or AUD12/hr !! It beats me, if free net could be provided in the lobby, why not the rooms?? Barring this, I would strongly suggest this room for all business travellers as well as people travelling with family on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Large characterless”
Reviews.Author: shound1030
Reviews.Content: Beware of rooms not facing darling harbour Food and bev operation for such a large and well located hotel is dissapointing. One large buffet style restaurant and small noisy house bar.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: caehlan
Reviews.Content: Car parking is across the street in a public lot though the hotel offers you a deal (by Sydney standards) of $48 per day. Traffic in Sydney at certain times can be quite painful and I would recommend avoiding driving if at all possible. Inside the hotel, the lobby is quite nice. Check-in was very fast. Wait for the elevators to your room most of the time was not too bad. The hallways at least on our floor, look like they could use a bit of a renovation. The room itself is clean and comfortable, though nothing special. The bathroom could also use a bit of a renovation. The location is convenient for getting to Darling Harbour, though if you are a tourist and it's your first time in Sydney.. let's face it you are probably there for the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.. you will be better served staying in the Rocks or Circular Quay. Next time I might try staying at the Westin instead and see how it compares.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: MooshAKL
Reviews.Content: Attentitive F&B staff, clean rooms, fantastic view, walking distance to everything Sydney has to offer. Perhaps review parking procedure on website to avoid confusion.

Reviews.Title: “Second To None.”
Reviews.Author: Teresa B
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Four Points for two nights with my daughter to celebrate her finishing school. Upon arrival at the beautiful hotel, we were given a room upgrade to a harbour view. Thank you Four Points. The service by all staff was truly wonderful and very helpful. Location was fabulous. Apart from the taxi from the airport (which was a rip off) we had no reason to take public transport. We were able to walk everywhere, from Darling Harbour, to the city, Circular Quay, theatre Royal. I highly reccommend that you make the choice to stay at Four Points. I am going back to Sydney in a few months and will not hesitate to book accommodation at this hotel. Here's a tip for free... If you take a taxi from the airport, don't tell them you are a visitor. Better still, arrange for a transfer. It is half the cost of a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Some Amazing Staffs, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: Damonhakim
Reviews.Content: Im both a business traveller and family traveller. If you want to read directly to the tips, go to the end of this review for some of mine. Location wise, this hotel is perfect. As you can see from other reviewers. Its very close to darling harbor and definitely saves you cab money. Here are the things you'll be happy about by staying here: 1. Some staff (not all) are tremendously friendly and helpful. I was handled by Jessica at the reception and she made our day. We asked for an early check in after a tiring overnight flight, and in less than 10 minutes, we're given the card and ready to go to our room. Thanks Jessica :). The luggage handlers / bell boys are extremely friendly. 2. Location is almost perfect. Its very close to darling harbor. But a bit not impressed with the followings: 1. Room Size. For a price like this, the room is a bit too small. The furnishings are a bit old and just below our expectation of a hotel this scale and grade. Bathroom size is also a bit small. The ceilings of the rooms are a bit low 2. Cleanliness Yes its clean in general, but some small details are missed. In the drawers you can see some stains (not disgusting stains) just not perfectly spotless. But beds, sheets, pillows and towels are clean, don't worry. Just the details if you're a super-clean person like my wife. 3. Design I think the design of the lobby and rooms including some part of the hotels can be improved by adding details like better paintings, furnitures, lighting, color accents, etc, which should provide one certain signature theme for the hotel. With attention to detail for the design, I think guests would mind less about the price :) TIPS #1: Pick higher floors to avoid noise from traffic from the streets. TIPS #2: If you don't mind paying extra 100 AUS per night, get the harbor view. TIPS #3: Book online to their website as they re most likely provide the best offer TIPS #4: For city views, ask for the highest possible floor or your view will be obstructed by the building across. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location at great price”
Reviews.Author: tassie7
Reviews.Content: awesomely situated hotel right in the centre of sydney, 2 minutes walk from trains, darling harbour, queen victoria building, center point and train ride or nice stroll to circular quay and opera house. Awesome gym for working off the beautiful cuisine offered by sydney. Our room was spacious and had uninterrupted views of darling harbour. We had fireworks outside our window of an evening at about 9pm which was a fantastic explosion to end the night. Room decor is a little tired, bathroom old and could do with a makeover but the total experience makes it all worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel location, with not so good value”
Reviews.Author: petiteld
Reviews.Content: Central location, quite nice view from the room overlooking the harbour. Concierges were helpful regarding addresses and transportation advice. Breakfast is good (with nice and strong espresso). Negative points : Breakfast is not included in the room price and is expensive. For a hotel targeting business travellers, I do not understand that you have to pay for getting internet in the room (at a very hefty price for 24 hours, I have to say). Free wifi is offered in the lobby, however it is not so nice to sit there in between cold draughts, with all tables and chairs very close to one another (not allowing for giving phone calls while using internet). Overall, nice hotel in a very good location for business travellers, where unfortunately extras on top of the room price finally represent too much. We really had the feeling that one customers were there, they were ripe for fleeced. It may some offensive way to put it out that way, but this was realy my feeling. If / when we go back to Sydney, I will definitely look out for other better value options.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: D700
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located short walk to Darling Harbour,China Town and CBD. Recoment you pay the extra and get darling Harbour room view

Reviews.Title: “Four points about Four Points”
Reviews.Author: indecisive123
Reviews.Content: Point 1. Customer Service was second to none, we arrived at a very busy time, our room wasn't ready unfortunately, however a free drinks voucher was given and we were more than happy to sit in the bar whilst we waited. The room still wasn't available after we had finished our drink but reception were very quick in finding us an alternate room. Point 2. Location! Location! Location, central to all things Darling Harbour, we stayed in a Harbour Deluxe so enjoyed beautiful views. A short walk down the steps at the side of the hotel brought you straight into the harbour and the City Tour bus stop was on the left of these stairs and the mono rail stop was close by. Point 3. Great concierge service, only had to ask nothing was any trouble and there were always lots of people on hand to help out. There was one guy think his name was Alfred who was a stand out and was very helpful. Point 4. Lovely clean, spacious rooms, comfortable bed, great pillows, good nights sleep. Seeing as the room overlooks a busy harbour that also has two main roads running in front there was no external noise when the windows to the balcony were shut. I have stayed in many hotels and never sleep fully due to other noises that disturb me through the night, I didn't hear any noise from any other room during our stay and as the hotel was very busy this was amazing. Highly recommend, pay the extra and get the harbour view it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Maitheng
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 5 days but it was great. The room was somewhat on the smallish side (compared to other similar hotels in Asia) but adequate and clean. The staff were very helpful and friendly especially Elodie, a lovely French waitress who was dedicated and helpful to customers at Breakfast time. The breakfast spread is good and plentiful...but the coffee is left to be desired. It comes in a pot and it tastes more like colored water. So we called for cappuccino or latte or long flat instead which was not a problem. I have noticed that there must be a coffee shop every 50 meters in Australia and yet their normal coffee is just so light you can hardly get the taste of the beans. Maybe this is an Australian thing. We were able to use their complimentary access to the internet for guests at the lobby, in the room, one had to pay for access. The concierges were very helpful in directing us to everything. The location is fantastic with loads of restaurants to chose from and it's only a short walking distance away. We would definitely go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Some issued for the price”
Reviews.Author: chetz7
Reviews.Content: Rooms were basic. the bathroom had no segregation. shower water thrrefore spilt onto the rest of bathroom. city view faces car parks. other than this great service and location with the biggest variety brekky ever. could be slightly better value for money otherwise its v.g.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VIEW ON DARLING HARBOUR”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Didier
Reviews.Content: The Four Points at Darling Harbour is greatly located with easy access to Darling Harbour and China Town. It is also very close to the city Shopping Centre. The room was well appointed, clean and had a great view on Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: cahayapagi
Reviews.Content: Simply love the hotel location. Short walk to Darling Harbour, Aquarium, Wildlife World & city center. Very convenient. We were welcomed by beautiful firework display from the harbour. Spectacular! We stayed at City Side Suite for 4 nights. The room is spacious, complete with kitchenette, comfortable size of sitting area with study table in the corner, separated bedroom, walk in closet & spacious bathroom. Friendly & helpful staffs. Housekeeping always did a good job. There are couple things, the air-cond in our sitting area tend to make loud noise, sounded like a boat noise. Quite disturbing when we were sleeping. We thought the noise came from the wharf. I also tend to agree with 1 reviewer here, that we could hear the next door guests very clearly as if they were talking & laughing in the same room with us. However, overall experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cutelebgal
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband came and stayed in october we had a very good time. All staff are very nice and rooms clean. I really liked the location of this hotel. Right in the city. Very nice. I enjoyed Darling Harbour so beautiful. Can walk to everything. My next trip to Sydney I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to City and Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: wendy9145
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this stay. Room was well appointed. Check-in, restaurant and concierge staff all courteous. Room could have been a touch cleaner such as door handles and underside of taps. But good value for city hotel. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “four points”
Reviews.Author: robyn J
Reviews.Content: We booked Four Points Hotel online. On arrival greeted by friendly staff who took our cases while booking in. When we got to our room our cases arrived at the same time and we were given an information book about Sydney sights and asked if we needed any further information to ask. Our room was very clean and bed comfortable. View over Darling Harbour was good. Breakfast was also very good with a great variety. Definitely stay again. Convenient location

Reviews.Title: “The problem with the Australian tourism industry, look no further!”
Reviews.Author: thantrav11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in September on a business trip and did not enjoy my stay. The walls are paper thin and I was woken by late night antics in room next door before being woken by the occupant of the room on the other side and their departure at 0500. Small rooms, very casual service and reluctance to provide a tax invoice on departure were also a problem. I would rate this hotel as 3 stars and advise those wanting better value in Darling Harbour to look elsewhere. The cab driver warned me when dropping me off but I didn't take his advice.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ichigosan
Reviews.Content: good value, great location, nice breakfast selection

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: svkkin
Reviews.Content: It was very good hotel and the facilities were also great. however, it lacks vegetarian food or indian. however the italian food is great. you can enjoy a walk on the banks of the darling harbour and a wonderful evenings

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: JoJoSunshineCoast
Reviews.Content: Although my husband and I have stayed at this hotel previously for both personal and business trips, we were placed here by Qantas on 30.10.11 after arriving from LA on route to Brisbane, following the grounding of all flights. When we arrived the front desk staff were initially unaware of the situation regarding the Qantas allocation of accommodation but quickly got onto the job and put us in touch with Steve (sorry Steve, I didn't get your second name) who immediately took charge of the situation and started the ball rolling. The hotel was at 100% capacity from the weekend so we had to wait a little while before we could be allocated a room, which was not a problem. However, as we had come off a 14hr flight we really wanted to have a shower/freshen up and as a room was not available Steve arranged for us to use the facilities in the gym area allowing us to feel a bit more human. We were then given access to the buffet breakfast which was most welcome before heading off out for a couple of hours when we returned to find a room ready and waiting for us. I think the staff of the hotel were really thrown in at the deep end with this whole situation yet they handled it promptly and efficiently. It helped make a nightmare situation for us (and many others) more manageable and we are extremely grateful to all concerned. Hopefully our next visit will not be too far away and will be under more pleasureable circumstances. Thanks again everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Kenneybee
Reviews.Content: We were very please with this choice of hotel. We arrived very early in the morning and they had a room we could check into (thank you!). It has a great loaction, easily within walking distance of anything in downtown Sydney and close to metro stations as well. The view from our room looking over Darling Harbor was great. We used a hotel suggested service to the airport the following day, wouldn't do that again. We were the first picked up and spent the next hour going from hotel to hotel picking up other people (boring!), just use the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy rooms, tiny beds and little sound insulation”
Reviews.Author: davidevil
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and good and friendly staff but the rooms are noisy with little soundproofing. I was woken every morning at 7am with adjacent doors slamming, guests talking outside my room and even hearing my neigbour take a shower. I have stayed in loads of hotels and can not see why management has not done something about this. I stayed in a room with single beds, these were tiny and moved everytime you turned over. These may be suitable for kids, but not for adults. The hotel also promised free water and coffee with an email prior to arrival - not of these materialised. I spent two nights at the Westin Sydney, and although slightly more expensive, was a far better hotel. Four Points Darling harbour comes accross as a budget business hotel, not some place to relax in, with no pool. I would look at others!!!

Reviews.Title: “4P Darling Harbour - excellent location and biz hotel”
Reviews.Author: RalphSingapore
Reviews.Content: In terms of location in SYD CBD, i think 4P wins hands down. From Kingsford airport, its around a 25min drive via shuttle bus ($14 per tix), much cheaper than taxis. It is just at the harbour and very near to Maritime museum and beachfront eating/bar places. A short $5 ferry ride will take you to the Sydney Opera House Entering the hotel, lobby was elegant and had a good feel to it, hotel has 15 floors and i was lucky to be upgraded to a room suite on the top floor which had a separate living study area and bedroom, so that was a nice touch Room decor was kinda plain and do need some re-work. In-room internet was also quite pricey at AUD$24.50 per 24hrs. in the Lobby the hotel has free Wi-Fi but connection was slow. Bed was extra soft and surprising very good to sleep, thus it gave good rest quality Breakfast was not too bad with the usual continental stuff and hot food and costs $35 per head Overall, a very pleasant stay and if I am back to SYD, I will stay at 4P again

Reviews.Title: “This is great hotel, that is well located”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi P
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Sheraton 4 points in sydney at least 15 times per year. It is a great hotle for its location right next to Darling Harbour and for the service from the staff. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the beds are excellent. The buffet, if you love seafood is very nice albeit on the expensive side at $60 I dont eat breakfast at the hotel instead preferring one of the many cafes near by. We also bring our kids here and a suite with a connecting room gives us a load of space. the local pub (The dundee arms) is part of the hotel and its food is excellent. well done Starwood, this places works and is a nice place from which to explore sydney.

Reviews.Title: “You should enjoy a nice stay here”
Reviews.Author: filo_o1
Reviews.Content: Room clean, bathroom clean, breakfast good, close to Darling harbour, plenty of staff to assist you. If you want a pleasant trouble free stay, this should suit

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: JAS888GoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Hi, Firstly if your looking for location this would be without a doubt the best by far, 5 min walk to the middle of the city and overlooking darling harbour....we stayed in a harbour view suite and was an amazing view ( TIP.. if you stay here i believe its a must to stay in a room with Harbour views ) Buffet breakfast was definately a winner and all the staff were lovely....only had 2 negative things to say about this hotel...bathrooms need updating, shower over the bath a little old and the biggest thing was internet no wi fi in rooms although there was ethernet cable for internet and the internet they did have in the lobby was a joke how slow it was( Third world stuff ) would definately stay here again though......

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Peter W
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6, (2 adults, 4kids aged under8) spent four nights here and had a great experience. The hotel staff were friendly all the time, excellent help and knowledge of Sydney. we had an interconnecting suite/ bedroom on the 15th floor, beautiful views of Darling Harbour and it was quiet and dark which helped kids sleep. A bit expensive but worth it, a small family could get away with a bedroom suite and reduce the cost. Would definately stay again,

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: suzy888
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel... We stayed in one of the suites at the Sheraton. The views were amazing and room lovely and clean. The staff were very helpful. The only thing that we thought they needed to look at was no Internet in the rooms. Especially when you are paying good money for the rooms. I would have thought in this day and age it would have had wi fi, especially for the business people. Thought they would have had separate shower in the bathroom, not over the bath. Breakfast was lovely and plenty to choose from. Would stay here again as the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “A buffet breakfast to beat all breakfasts!!!”
Reviews.Author: Muffinman84
Reviews.Content: All very positive, only criticism would be slightly dated rooms and 'queen bed' meant two singles pushed together. Classy setting, easy access to everything in Sydney, friendly staff and great litle bar/beer garden out the front. Generous buffet breakfast-Everything you could ever want, very impressive. All in all great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Australia”
Reviews.Author: Debi B
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent and compared to other hotels I've stayed at in Australia, this one is the closest to anything North American you will find (if you want that). Many hotel rooms in Oz are quite sparsely furnished and rather cold, but these are similar to a Sheraton in North America. There are enough different things to see around Sydney and it's nice to return to comfort and familiarity at the end of a day. I am picky and I've stayed at many hotels around the world and I've chosen to stay at this one again this month. I stayed here in March after checking out of another nearby hotel I had booked online (Citigate). No Wifi in the room was a drag, but free wifi in the lobby helped. I wasn't crazy over the restaurant, but the pub was ok and Darling Harbour is within walking distance with great restaurant selection. The fact that I am going back again says it all. It's pricey, but everything downunder is. Harbour view is spectacular and Starbucks is not too far way. Bring your Via ready brew. There is a kettle in the room.

Reviews.Title: “nice view”
Reviews.Author: morehu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a stay over after a company dinner in the city. had a Harbour view room which was nice .Room was clean and had eveyrthing we needed not too flash the king bed and pillows comfortable. location excellent and we enjoyed the hot buffet Breakfast. The reception desk were very efficient and both check in and check out ran smoothly. Special mention to housekeeping who were great at giving us excellent service thank you1

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: TonyT5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on business October 2011, excellent location right in Darling Harbour approx 30 second walk overthe little path at the back of the hotel. Your smack bang in the harbour with a 15 minute comfortable walk to the Harbour bridge or take one of the many ferries or water taxis. Reception and Resteraunt are clean and tidy and have a pleasant feel to them. The room was a little bit tired some marks on the walls and and furniture was a bit beet up ! City side view that I had is cheaper than harbour view but none the less was as you would expect. Generally good value for money and excellent location. Beware of lunchtime cost $60 ! But food was excellent, overall well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Really good for the price & location”
Reviews.Author: karc0n
Reviews.Content: We're really picky and normally prefer boutique hotels, but the options in Sydney were outrageous so we opted for a good location and hoped for the best. We were upgraded to a harbor view which I'm sure made a big difference as the "city view" just looks out to a boring building and busy street. Our room was great, very clean and with all the standard amenities and we secured a fantastic rate ($145/night), so were quite happy. There is free wifi in the lobby areas, but the only downside was there wasn't any wifi available in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: Essar71
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, bang on Darling Harbour directly connected to Sydney Aquarium. Other major attractions all within walking distance. Rooms are good, decent sized. Seven Eleven store just opposite which takes care of all provisions that you may need at short notice. Breakfast is also good.

Reviews.Title: “Move along ... Nothing here to see ...”
Reviews.Author: vagabiztravlr
Reviews.Content: Very very average. This hotel is certainly showing its wear/tear ... and lack of recent major upkeep/renovation. The rooms are small and ... average. The food buffet was ... average. The attention to detail was ... average. Darling Harbor is a nice area to visit. But this hotel's proximity doesn't make the visit. I won't be returning. I'm sure there are other hotels that are above average.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: Carlz06
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the four points by Sheraton Darling Harbour for 3 days on business. On checkin in they advised I had been given a twin room. Asked to be changed to a double as per what was booked but they advised they were at full capacity so no chance. Rooms was comfortable & cleaned everyday. I had a city view rooms which overlooked a car park & gym! Had breakfast at the restaurant each day & they stuffed the order up 2 mornings in a row, however we had a lovely waitperson who gave us a free coffee & a few other goodies while we waited. Also had dinner at the restaurant twice. Meals were nice but it is very pricey. During my stay there seemed to only be 2 lifts working so the wait to get to & from your level was a bit ridiculous, especially in the morning & evening. Hope this was a temporary issue & has been resolved. Good location in relation to the shops & Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Good locations; rooms in need of an overhaul. And where's the Internet?”
Reviews.Author: drflet11
Reviews.Content: Seriously, in 2011, not having ANY Internet access in the rooms is unacceptable. The location of the hotel is good, though it's a bit of a hike to get over to the Opera House area. Not much food in the neighbood either (resist the temptation to go to Tony Roma's next door - not worth it) but Darling Harbor is right out the back. Rooms are large enough but in need of some love - you can see the track marks in the carpet from where the pattern wore away. There are worse choice, but I suspect there are better ones for the price. Make up for it a bit with the service, which is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service and awseome views”
Reviews.Author: gasman
Reviews.Content: I thought I had experienced other "perfect" locations in Sydney, but this one tops them all. Just steps away from all the attractions and restaurants of Darling Harbour, and only a few minutes walk to the nucleus of the Sydney shopping district. The main waterfront/Sydney harbour is only about 15 minutes walk away. The view from the reasonably appointed harbourside rooms is wonderful, and the hotel breakfast is very good. The beds are of above average comfort for a hotel. I really wanted to give this property an 'excellent' rating - but a few things pulled it back. - internet in rooms is $25 per day (I abhor this), and no wi-fi. - room fittings and fixtures are starting to look slightly tired; a refirb will be required within a couple of years. - the standard rooms are very small. Don't even consider trying to accommodate more than 2 people. - I have stayed twice during the last month; in neither room did the airconditioning work properly. However for the location, views, ambience and service I would have no hesitation in staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: jackykk
Reviews.Content: Location is also great. Close to many good restaurants at the harbour side and the LG IMAX cinema. Very convenient to the fish market across the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chelenjeff
Reviews.Content: Location is great - so close to Darling Harbour and within walking distance to Opera house. Just on the cusp of China Town offering many very affordable restaurant options. Hotel has a couple of computers in the lobby you can use to access the internet which is helpful although there is usually a wait. We faced the harbour and were there for Australia Day allowing us to see the fireworks and fextivities from our balcony. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Would recommend. Only complaint was the price of food in the restaurants was quite expensive so we ate out all the time - mostly in Chinatown as it was very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed but good location”
Reviews.Author: pk666au1
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small and not too clean. Shower over bath with curtain!!!! May have been white when first installed. Have stayed at better places for same price range. No Radisson or Hilton. Noisy on Harbour view side with traffic. Noisy when others shower or flush toilets. Will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Bendigo Community Bank Conference”
Reviews.Author: Will1954Georgetown
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and well appointed. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The staff made the hotel different from others I have stayed in. Great staff training.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but no valet parking”
Reviews.Author: Kelvin A
Reviews.Content: I am reasonably used to the Sheraton chain for business travel, so the first shock was to jump out of the car and find that I had no valet parking. It wasn't that much, but I was running late for a meeting, and this made me another 20 minutes late again. I had prebooked parking so I had assumed that, like other Sheratons, there would be a valet service. Apart from that, very functional as most Sheratons are.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: dprebble
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night for my birthday and couldn't have picked a more perfect spot to stay in Sydney. The exceptional services started with the concierge who was friendly, helpful and welcoming. As we arrived in a car the concierge was able to direct us to the parking and take up our bags. On checking in we were upgraded to the top floor and a beautiful 1 bedroom apartment. Once again the reception staff were terrific. The location is the best asset with close proximity to Darling Harbour, Queen Victoria Building and even a short walk to Circular Quay. Really is the best location if you want to see all the sites in Sydney. The room was clean, spacious and had all the amenities needed. Air conditioning was perfect and quiet. Bathrooms were large and water pressure great. The room had a large working desk which would be great if on a business trip. The gym was large with modern fitness equipment. The only downside was no pool. The breakfast was good with a wide range of foods. All food was regularly kept fresh and warm. The only downside was some of the fruit was out of season a little (hard melon) and the waiters forgot my hot drink but in saying that they were exceptionally busy. We will be staying here again. We booked via the website (SPG) and paid $225 incl parking till 6pm the next day and buffet breakfast. GREAT DEAL. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in everything.”
Reviews.Author: nikhiljain22
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in Sydney. Situated just along darling harbour, provides an excellent view at night. Staff is too helpful. Buffet breakfast was excellent. The ambience is just right for the person to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, great views, great service, lousy internet”
Reviews.Author: Robert P
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch hotel. Excellent Darling Harbour location overseeing the harbor. Sevice is excellent and always available. Two minor shortcomings: The laundry service is grossly overpriced. Internet service in the room is overpriced ($ 25 /day) and wired only. Lobby has wireless service but it is spotty. Unless you are paying your own internet or laundry, this is an excellent hotel. I plan on staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Central place to stay in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: AliD78
Reviews.Content: Check in efficient and staff friendly. Room good size and very clean. Had fantastic view over darling harbour. Comfy bed and really good shower head. Breakfast buffet is great. Location near darling harbor and 5 mins walk to CBD and shopping. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, cleanliness, but room is small and dinner buffet is disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Joshua N
Reviews.Content: As the title said, location is its best. Room service and customer service is similar to other lux hotels. Restaurant is pricy and so so. Would recommend the hotel but not its restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: 2worldtravelersnj
Reviews.Content: Stayed a full week here wiht some colleagues for work and a bit of pleasure. The location is and was ideal for me, right on the harbor and close to transit and the main sights downtown such as Chinatown and the various shopping area's and parks. Overall, standard Four Points style property, lobby grand and clean. Stayed on 14th Floor with room facing harbor, believe it was a suite as it had 2 seperate rooms, plus nice little microwave and fridge area. Fairly clean, not 100% up to my personal standards but worked, bed was comfortable for sure. Bathroom was on the dated side but more than sufficent for the stay. The 1 major gripe about this property that I found was the internet, wifi was not available in room only downstairs and the ethernet connection was SLOOOOW! I called down numerous times but nothing helped, it was just horrible and frustrating. Breakfast buffet was unreal! I have never in my life seen such an amazing buffet, love it! Gym was decent, functional for sure, few treamills, bikes, elypticals and rack of dumbells and a universal machine. Concierge and front desk staff were all super nice, helpful and welcoming. Really enjoed the stay here and will stay again if I make trip here.

Reviews.Title: “wished had a better room”
Reviews.Author: vicious743
Reviews.Content: the hotel is good, perfect location. had a few problems with noisy door, dead batteries for the safe. table top glass chipped. with that we hit our had on the edge of the broken glass that was very close to the very small single bed. The problem was solved. They switched the glass around...lol Internet was very, very slow. Free wifi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great position”
Reviews.Author: BeaSamDad
Reviews.Content: I've just spent 12 nights at the Four Points Sydney. It was a good hotel - though the food was quite expensive - but it's forte is the fact that its just off Darling Harbour. Ensure you get a harbour view room, as it makes a huge difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: espeesh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for visiting Sydney. Located in Darling Harbour and only steps away from main shopping areas, the aquarium and many restaurants and pubs and transportation to other Sydney hotspots. The hotel was very nice, clean with friendly and helpful staff. The concierge was very helpful with everything from good places to eat to organizing transportation and everything in between. The rooms were a good size, very clean and had comfortable beds. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Was very happy here.”
Reviews.Author: AmbroseSoFoPo
Reviews.Content: My room wasn't large but the picture windows looked out over the harbor, so it felt like one whole wall of the room was the view. I really enjoyed that, and the comfy bed, clean, upscale bathroom, and the friendly concierge(s) who were always helpful when I ventured out. The only thing I would change is that I was charged for internet in my room- if I wanted free wifi I had to sit down in the lobby. In my travels I have noticed the nicer the hotel, the more likely they are to charge for internet, and I find that exasperating. But other than that I loved it- the location was fantastic- an easy walk to all sorts of attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for our 1st stop in Australia”
Reviews.Author: samoWales
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights after arriving from a long haul flight from the UK. Before we left i contacted the hotel and asked if there was any chance we could check in slightly earlier than there published check in time. Has an email back saying they would see what they could do. Arrived at 9:30 am after 30hr journey, room was already ready such a wonderful start to our 4 weeks in Australia. We were able to change & shower and felt much better & were able to explore Sydney.Great location for us directly on Darling Harbour (boat show on when we were there.) We found the walk to circular quay & central station was not a problem. Didn't eat in the hotel but did use the adjacent pub, room excellent with great views of the harbour. Front desk very helpful & a big thanks for the bottle of bubbly in the room to celebrate my very special birthday.

Reviews.Title: “6 star service”
Reviews.Author: DemApples
Reviews.Content: Never before experienced such wonderful, attentive and premptive service by all levels of staff in this delightful hotel. Will be opting for Starwoods where possible from now on!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel perfectly located for exploring Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: Reachforthesky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights at the beginning of August and found the location of the hotel perfect. Darling Harbour has lots of bars, restaurants and shops and can be accessed via a staircase from the hotel. We also found it easy to get around the city from the hotel, both on foot and on ferries and buses. The rooms are compact, with plenty of storage and the beds are very comfy. We slept well throughout our stay. Our room rate included breakfast and this was brilliant. The buffet had everything you could possibly wish for at breakfast time, including a range of hot dishes. The fresh fruit selection was particularly good. The buffet gets very busy at the weekends, but dishes are quickly replenished. On check in, we received a very warm welcome from Kris, who really should be commended for his customer service skills. The upgrade to a Harbour View room was a nice touch and we enjoyed the view for the 9 nights of our stay. Concierge are also very helpful, advising us about bus numbers and making restaurant reservations for us. The bar staff seemed a little surly at times, however the bar was busy and they seemed a little stretched to be fair. The hotel provides free wifi in the bar and restaurant, plus a couple of free terminals with internet access; very handy for keeping in touch with home. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - my (now) preferred Sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: Biff3ridge
Reviews.Content: I used to stay a lot at other properties but now prefer The Four Points. Getting a room upgrade on my last trip is also a help. Reliable service and standards, good treadmills in the gym, prompt room service. Also - good firm pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for tourists, nice upgrades”
Reviews.Author: othatsapo
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be in a great location - right along Darling Harbor where there are tons of bars and restaurants and attractions. They even have fireworks on Saturday night over the harbor! The hotel itself was pleasant - clean and modern looking. Staff was very friendly and breakfast - while pricey - was the best of all the places we stayed. We signed up as a Starwoods Preferred Member (recommend doing this if you're going to book) and we received a free room up great (to a City View suite!) and a discount on breakfast. The hotel staff was also very helpful in providing recommendations, directions, travel to the airport, etc. We would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great for darling harbour a bit of a walk from circular quay”
Reviews.Author: catmad11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of our honeymoon and were really chuffed that the hotel knowing this upgraded up to a harbour view room. We were also very lucky that there was a fireworks display in the harbour while we were staying there so we got to enjoy it from the comfort of our room. I used the gym which was perfectly adequate and very quiet (only me in there) they provide tvâ€™s, towels and water as well as a shower / changing area in the gym which are all nice. We didnâ€™t eat at the hotel because it was $35 for breakfast and $75 for an evening meal!!!! The room was spacious and clean and provided a proper hair dryer, tv with plenty of channels, toilettries, iron and board etc etc that you would expect. We were happy with the location because we donâ€™t mind walking around, its great for darling harbour but a good 15 minutes (at least) walk to the circular quay. A taxi to the main station was $14 which compared to some other things in Sydney, seemed pretty reasonable to us. Great hotel, just a general comment though, be prepared to remortage your home if you want to stay in Sydney for any more than a couple of nights, the price of everything is utterly ridiculous!!!!

Reviews.Title: “does not live up to the reputation”
Reviews.Author: CanberraMujer
Reviews.Content: We were staying here to celebrate our ten year wedding anniversary, and had been told good things about the Sheraton hotels. Good points: * The location and proximity to Darling Harbour was great. * The bed was really comfortable Bad points: * No onsite parking was a pain *no directions on how to get to our room * The sliding door to our balcony was jammed shut, so couldn't access our "harbour view" that we paid extra for * The walls must be very thin, we could hear every time next door was in their bathroom, which was quite frequent. * Breakfast staff were appalling, I asked for a coffee about 5 different times and it didn't get there until we were finished and about to leave and it was terrible This is just a few things, but overall it just did not live up to our expectations, considering other hotels in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, would love to go back soon”
Reviews.Author: Sheiladavo
Reviews.Content: Harbour view room was lovely and hotel has such a good location. Room was good size, clean and neat. Staff very friendly and breakfast was delicious, though menu didn't change at all. Overall would recommend it to anyone wanting a good hotel, in a great central location in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very very ordinary”
Reviews.Author: trunkitraveller
Reviews.Content: This ws my first stay at Four Points, normally stay at regular Sheratons, maybe my expectations were too high. Pros: great location if your meetings are around Sussex St, Kent St, Wynyard, George St. Cons: Rooms with city views (read car park views and some red light district shop - hideous). Others: This hotel really didn't seem to have any personality. Everything was just, yes, as title says, ordinary. Amenities below average, size of room def quite small, bathroom that you would find in 2-3 star hotels, furniture quite old, TV at the other end of the room from the beds. If Four Points claim to be an upper 4 star hotel ranking, then my stay would equal, sorry to say, to 2.5 stars, maybe 3 stars in a developping countries, but not in Sydney! If you need to stay at this hotel due to location then by all means do, it provides acceptable beds, but if you want a holiday experience, look elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: iliketravel99
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times, but no more than 1 week at a time. Great location in Darling Harbour....can also have a nice walk to city core or Opera House. Place is nicely maintained, clean beds, bathroom, etc. Restaurant is a bit overpriced, but only there for convenience. Recommend staying in a serviced apartment if staying longer than 1 week.

Reviews.Title: “My 3rd stay in this hotel.. Need to say more?”
Reviews.Author: Ngelencer
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay in this hotel, all of them were for business. Room is spacious, well maintained. Check in is pretty fast. Location is right in the biz center, close to tourist area as well and lots of nice place to eat in the surrounding. That's why I never take breakfast in the hotel coz I know I'll find better deal outside! I don't mind staying there for my next visit - pretty reliable!

Reviews.Title: “Not really our scene but comfortable and good for public transport.”
Reviews.Author: travellinaround
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went down to Sydney to see a band and wanted someone close to different types of transport so that we could have a good look around at the city while we were there. We looked around online for weeks and couldn't settle on anything in our price range and then happened to see a 'stay 2 nights, get the 3rd free' deal that made the Sheraton cheaper than most of the other options (including a private room at a YHA). We'd never stayed at a Sheraton and thought we might feel a little out of place but it was great. Nice clean, room and a giant, comfortable bed, very pleasant staff and the location is excellent for getting around Sydney. There are multiple bus and train stops within less than 500m walk and Darling Harbour ferry station is about the same. I still don't think we're the Sheraton-staying types but I'm very glad we picked that one for that trip.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beth527blue
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel in a good central location. Good sized rooms and comfortable bed. Very helpful and accomodating staff. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location with harbour views and access”
Reviews.Author: Elthamites
Reviews.Content: We are SPG members and normally stay at the Westin or Sheraton on the Park. We tried the Four Points on this trip and while the location was great; harbour view fantastic and access to Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay most convenient - it is pretty obvious why this ranks third in the Sydney/Sheraton group. Foyer in need of a major tidy up/carpet stains unbelievable. Had booked one night by SPG/internet and wanted to add an additional night when we arrived - had to check out and book in again to achieve this! Weird! Access and nearby restaurants made up for any disappointments.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: donna255060
Reviews.Content: stayed here for work conference , beautiful and comfortable , staff very helpful went we need icepack for a bad knee, food was excellent with a good variety, close to darling harbour and sydney cbd

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location but bar service was lacking”
Reviews.Author: Peterjules
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention at the Convention Centre and a bit of R&R. The deluxe harbour view was great as far as space (had a sofa). The views of Darling Harbour are exceptional. Things that let the hotel down however were (a) the lack of bar staff creating a long wait between drinks (b) tried to ring for breakfast as per the hotel directory and kept receiving a busy tone so therefore gave up (c) the wait for breakfast on Sunday morning (gave that a miss too because the queue was too long to get in) (d) only two towels available for the pair of us . Superb as far as location as you can walk to the monorail for cheap transportation (went to Chinatown) and also the many restaurants on the harbour. Not a bad place if you want to eat out of house and avoid queues.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Canteloff
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sydney early morning with nowhere to stay. Thge airport accomodation desk was unhelpful. We walked into the hotel - no bags as they were still in London! A very helpful receptionist advised us of options and prices. A B & B deal in a room overlooking the harnbour was attractive and we really enjoyed our stay. Great views in a very comfortable room . The only downside was a rather disappointing dinner on our last night.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and going backwards”
Reviews.Author: WJW61
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on numerous occassions over the past 3 years for business and leisure. As a gold SPG member I did not expect the rooms to be as tired and the breakfast was very disappointing. Notwithstanding you don't stay at a hotel for the breakfast you do expect a certain quality when you do indulge. On a positive the staff continue to be friendly and helpfull. There are a lot better quality hotels for the same price on offer. I stayed at an alterantive hotel for the same price during my trip and the latter hotel blitzed the Four Points in every area.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel by Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: SÃ¶ren
Reviews.Content: The stay started off nice at check in when I got a complementary upgrade to a City Side Suite. The room itself was very nice and spacious. The location near Darling Harbour is just phenomenal, everything you can ask for is within walking distance. I must recommend eating at the Food & Wine Company in DH, fantastic! The breakfast buffe' in the hotel was the only dissapointment, not very fresh and greasy. The gym was OK, but with a great view of DH.

Reviews.Title: “Glad that I stayed here...”
Reviews.Author: DavidinYVR
Reviews.Content: I arrived late evening, exhausted from the long journey, and the warm reception I received made me feel so welcome. The young Canadian fellow at registration was so enthusiastic about his new home (Sydney); I couldn't help but feel enthusiastic about my pending visit. I was there 4 nights, and everyone I dealt with at this hotel was polite, professional, and welcoming - from the concierge to housekeeping, and the front desk people of course. My room was very nice and always spotless. Even though it was close to the street, it was very quiet. The negatives are few: 1. It is not as convenient to public transport as I might have liked. It is a short (10 minute) walk to the trains and buses. But if you have luggage, I recommend a taxi or shuttle 2.The breakfast buffet was deliciious, but a bit overpriced. Again, there are a lot of alternatives just a short walk away. The only improvement I would recommend would be better information in the rooms about the hotel and its services. There was a pub, but I never figured out when it was open. I guess there was a coffee bar somewhere (?) but I never found it. And there is a walkway that wraps around the hotel to Darling Harbour, but I didn't find that until my 3rd day. Overall my experience here was wonderful and I would recommend it heartily.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position and most staff helpful.”
Reviews.Author: wmwsussex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two periods during February through to May totalling some 8 weeks for business. Upper floor Harbour view rooms have excellent view. Comfortable but carpeting, etc. looking very tired and in need of renewal. Reception staff not helpful and when requested extension of stay made me feel as if I was doing them a favour by staying there. If it hadn't been for the hassle of packing up, I would have moved elsewhere. All other staff were great - helpful and friendly. The gym was excellent but did wish there had been a roof terrace or similar where possible to sit outside to relax. Would have been good to have coffee shop or similar in lobby where could get takeaway coffee in the morning but expect this was probably more important to me as I was working and not on vacation. Excellent position for visiting all the attractions of Sydney - no need for transport, everything within walking distance, including CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, especially for families travelling with young children”
Reviews.Author: JandKFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during our recent visit to Sydney in mid-June. We stayed in the same hotel eight years ago and it left us good impression, hence we decided to stay here again this time. My hubbyâ€™s SPG gold member status was recognized and we were upgraded to a harbour view room during first check in and a deluxe harbour view room the second check in. Both rooms have beautiful harbour view, the difference is deluxe room is slightly bigger in size and it has a balcony.
