Our 2.5 year old son really enjoyed the view and he could sit behind the window for half an hour to watch the monorails, helicopters and airplanes and those boats in the harbour and was always happy and excited. One surprise was the firework show in Saturday evening; nobody informed us that there is firework show on weekend evening. We were just lucky to be at our room at that time and had a perfect view just sitting inside our room. We also watched the helicopter rescue show performed in front of maritime museum from our room. Really pleasant surprises! What we liked most about the hotel is its prime location; it is just beside darling harbour, and just 3 minutesâ€™ walk to Sydney Aquarium and Wildlife World. If you travel with children and plan to go to the above 2 places, I strongly advise you to get the combo tickets from the hotel concierge. The price is the same as what you can get from the ticket counter, but the concierge have some free photo vouchers that entitles you to take a photo with Koala in the Wildlife World which is worth AUD$19.90 each. We went for a whale watching tour and went to the Taronga Zoo, both boats departs right from Darling harbour. This can save you a lot of trouble than going to circular quay and take boat from there, especially when you are travelling with young children. There are a lot of fine restaurants in the nearby cockle bay wharf too that offer you plenty of dining options. For our second stay, we booked theâ€� Four Good Reasonsâ€� package directly from the hotel website, which includes breakfast, 4 drinks (Australian wine or beer or soft drinks or coffee), late check-out at 4pm and double SPG points. We think it is a good deal at that rate. The only problem is it has been 3 weeks after we checked out and my hubbyâ€™s double points are still not in yet. Now the downsideâ€¦ The room is a bit small and dated, especially the bathroom which is really cramp and there is no separate shower and bath, even for deluxe harbour view room. We later stayed at Sheraton by the park, and the room there is very big and with a huge and beautiful bathroom. We tried the seafood buffet dinner at Corn Exchange once and we found the selection is quite limited comparing with many other Starwoods properties, such as Le Meridien Kuala Lumpur or Sheraton ShenZhen. Having said that, we still enjoyed our stay in this hotel and we will stay here again should we visit Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed, great location”
Reviews.Author: PeonyThailand
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with a balcony overlooking the harbor. The room is nice and spacious with the most comfortable bed ever. It took a lot of willpower to get out of that bed! The beddings are of high quality and the bed was soft, yet firm. Watching the sunset from the roomâ€™s balcony was magical and highly recommended. Wish the balcony was furnished with at least a simple chair to sit on, however. The hotel is in a good location with good restaurants within a short walk. The hotel is huge and, from what I can see, serves quite a lot of tour groups as well. As a result, the lobby can be quite busy at certain times of the day. And probably because itâ€™s a big hotel, I had to queue up for about 5 minutes during the check-in process, which could be off-putting if one just arrived from a long plane ride. Overall, Iâ€™m very pleased with this hotel especially with their bed! Will stay here again for my next visits to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: gypsy49
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for three nights recently, thoroughly enjoying the location for its ease to Darling Harbour restaurants, shopping in the CBD, and easy walking distance to Circular Quay and ferries. I changed our room to harbour view and so glad l did. For the $50.00 upgrade the view was stunning, especially at dusk. Saturday night fireworks were a spectacular unexpected treat viewed from our balcony. Each morning we strolled over the bridge to the array of D H restaurants serving hearty breakfast at very reasonable prices. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view from the VERY comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: VivoOra
Reviews.Content: Before we'd even arrived we were looking forward to our trip. Welcoming emails in the days leading up to our trip were a nice touch. We had a harbor side room and the view was fantastic, so good in fact we didn't even have to get out of the bed to enjoy it. And the bed was sooo comfy. We ate breakfast in the hotel's restaurant and were pleased to see how attentive the staff were. The breakfast spread was also good value. The hotel is in great location; right on the doorstep of Darling Harbour, super close to the monorail & the train only a couple of blocks away. We would definitely consider staying here again on our next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good king bed & ironing facilities”
Reviews.Author: MrsRocket
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Friday night while husband on Conference, great staff allowed me in on producing ID. Good size room with king bed, very comfy, views to Darling Harbour. Great iron & ironing board in room for guest use (as good as home) for ironing business shirts etc. Cleaning staff/service very polite & helpful to wife staying while husband working. Would certainly recommend for business stay. Great location near Nick's Seafood Restaurant and QVBuilding Trains etc

Reviews.Title: “Busy hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: rojaan1
Reviews.Content: Have stayed before, and this time had a suite upgrade. Nice large room with a good view of Darling Harbour. AC too cold and I tried to get it warmer but unsuccessful ! Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit worn now though”
Reviews.Author: DadTravelOrganiser
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, and the location is excellent - right on Darling Harbour within easy walking distance of main city area. Getting in and out of location on Sussex Street in peak hour can be annoying. As for the views - almost all floors on the harbour side get great views, all rooms on city side effectively get none other than other buildings. Breakfast OK, and nice that you can sit outside if you like.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Austral1a
Reviews.Content: After arriving late into this hotel after a significantly delayed flight, the front desk and room service representatives could not have been more accommodating and helpful. The hotel breakfast was excellent, and if you're looking for a drink - the pub to the left of the hotel entrance is part of the hotel for chargeback etc. The meals at the pub are also very economical. The accommodations were of a recently renovated, standard 4 star quality with excellent views from the higher floors on the Darling Harbour side. I requested a quiet room, and don't recall any hallway or 'next door' noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, average room”
Reviews.Author: sarahannspain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, and the hotel itself was lovely but our room was very average. The service was excellent though and the room service food was nice and a generous size. Overall we had a nice stay here and the gym facilities were good, and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “super location and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: suruchisethia
Reviews.Content: was very pleased to stay at this hotel.we got upgraded and had beautiful harbour facing rooms.the breakfast spread was really nice with loads to choose from for us vegetarians.room service and other services were first class.we had a really early morning flight so these lovely people packed so many boxes of continental bfast and gave it to us at 4 in the morning.superrr.so sweet of them. the best part about this hotel is the location.there is a 24 hour supermarket bang opposite,the shopping areas are a 5 min walk. if u walk a few steps and down the staircase u reach the harbour and the aquarium.wow, what a locaton.would heartily recomend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Stan14
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for two nights this time. The staff were very helpful and we felt very welcome. The breakfast and dinner buffet were good with a range of delicious food at both.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: SACSTYLE916
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points in Darling Harbour our first 3 nights in Australia. What a fabulous location! We really enjoyed the sights and it was right near everything - easy walking distance to so many things. The service was fantastic and the breakfast buffet was amazing! A short cab ride away was the Opera House, Sydney Bridge and other shopping and restaurants. So much to see! Would definitely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great position”
Reviews.Author: Penesloppy
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here with my daughter whilst attending a concert in the city. This hotel has great service and a to die for buffet breakfast. Rooms are clean, spacious and everything works like it should. Darling Harbour is a footbridge away. I've stayed at this hotel several times now, and it has always been a rewarding experience.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable vacation at Four Points”
Reviews.Author: Martha808
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay at Four Points. From the time we arrived and checked in your staff was friendly and helpful. I payed the extra to upgrade to a view of the harbour and it was worth well worth it. It was helpful to see what kinda weather the day was going to be like and it overlooked many of the harbour attractions below and across. If you are there during the weekend go and see the fireworks show at 8:30pm at the docks. It was fabulous and then you can eat dessert and have a drink at the mall after the show. The only thing bothered me there was I requested for the morning paper and out of 4 days there I got it on the last day. I wasn't sure if someone was taking the ones left outside or not but I had to request for it daily. Other than that the stay was excellent, clean room, excellent staff, and good location, easy access the public transportation. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small room, but great location”
Reviews.Author: Peak_Performer
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel more than 15 years ago, it was great to come back here to experience it yet again. It was just how I remembered it. The rooms have all of the facilities that you need as a business traveller. When I arrived, the gentleman at the front door was polite and assisted me to where I could park my car and offered to help me with my bags. After checking in (which was a pleasant experience) I dropped my things in my room and went out to park the car. This was the only dissapointment of the stay. The hotel doesnt offer any valet parking, so you have to park your car in the carpark opposite the hotel which means driving half way around the block, catching a lift and crossing the road. The downside to this hotel is that the bar is situated just below the dining area, so the smells of the food drift down to where you are trying to enjoy a drink. This just didnt work for me so I went out to a local watering hole to enjoy a beer. Overall the stay here, and its location to Darling Harbour and Sydney city is great. Definately a place to stay if you are visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: osubuckeye415
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful location. Walking distance to Opera House, The Rocks, Darling Harbor. Wonderful Hotel with great amenities, cleanliness. Would highly recommend to anyone travelling to Sydney

Reviews.Title: “keep looking”
Reviews.Author: emmzie25
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and the hotel was great a letting us check in earlier, we did have to hang around the lobby but free internet made up for that, plus we got an upgrade to a studio room. The room it self was clean but the carpet did have funny stains all over the floor. The bathroom was a shower/bath combo, myself I'm not a fan of. The bath was all scuffed and looked dirty. From about 4pm to 10pm there was this outrageous thumping techno music. The bed on the other hand was very nice! The buffet for dinner was lacking in imagination food wise and for $50 each (if you are a hotel guest) I didn't think that we got our moneys worth. After this we choose to skip breakfast. Check out was late a 11am but I guess someone forgot to tell housekeeping who knocked at our door at 9.30am.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service, best value!”
Reviews.Author: RnDdept
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. It is a 4 stars hotel so can't compare its amenities with Four Seasons or Westin, but our room is facing the habour, very clean and well maintained and it certainly gives you the best value. The location is right in front of the Darling Harbor and it is an easy walk to QVB, Paddy's Market, China Town. We even walked across the bridge to the Fish Market. There's a stop of the free Sydney bus route 555 in front of QVB which can take you further to Opera House/Quary. But what impressed me most is the constant excellent services of the hotel staffs - from front door, concierge, housekeeping to restaurant, and that made me give it a perfect 5.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Craigtown
Reviews.Content: Got a deal directly with the hotel for one free night when you book three, this brought the rate down to something which I would consider decent value for money. Check in staff were friendly and got us in to our room earlier than check in time, which was certainly appreciated after a long flight. Our room had a lovely view of Darling Harbour, although without the view there was nothing spectacular about it. The location was convenient for public transport with monorail and ferries on the doorstep and a 5-10 min walk to the Town Hall metro stop. Free wi fi in the lobby was a nice touch as well. My main issue with our stay was that despite our package being prepaid, the hotel failed to take payment unitl after we had checked out and when I contacted them to see if this was a duplicate I was informed that neither payment had been received and that they were requesting a further payment. At the end of the day the matter was resolved and the bill was settled however the inconvenience caused was enough to make my rating an average 3/5 rather than good 4/5

Reviews.Title: “Definatelty stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Aussiepilot
Reviews.Content: Four Points by Sheraton Darling Harbour - Excellent!! We have stayed at many hotels in Sydney and have experienced what they have to offer, let me tell you about the Four points by Sheraton at Darling Harbour. What a hotel!! We have stayed here now over 3 times. Our first stays were satisfactory for what we wanted, these guys excel at making you feel right at home from hello, to check-in, and the rest, we were actually up-graded from our room choice to the governors suite!! As if we would decline!! The staff were incredibility friendly and nothing was a bother, the duty manager, â€œByronâ€� was brilliant as was â€œChrisâ€� who checked us in. Of course, special mention must be made to these guys, as they were our second point of contact and they were very professional and more than courteous which we feel this must be passed on to management as these are the kind of staff that very often lack the significant recognition they deserve. Also, the house keeping and room service staff are exceptional from our experience, a very special thank you to you guys also, and we sincerely hope that your special efforts do not go unrecognized by upper management. As for the catering, well, we have eaten at five star hotels all over the world, but these guys keep Sydney in play, as far as the food goes! OK, we only had in-room dining, but for the most part, from what we had, our advice is, to stay with the hotel! Do not venture too far for the best tucker, what you may find around Darling Harbour might be twice as much as what you may get at the hotel, the difference is, â€œin my opinion,â€� the hotel does it better and at about half the price!! I must say even though we have stayed here previously, we only stay here when we have IT exams. This time it was my internet security exam, so a good nightâ€™s sleep was essential, but, thanks to Chris and Byron we were upgraded to the Governorâ€™s suite which made our stay even more exhilarating. A very special thank you to these guys and all the staff that more than fulfilled our expectation for a one night stay, we will be back and thank you so much!! First point of contact was the concierge/bag boy, (sorry I donâ€™t get names) but these guys were brilliant and very warming, (please pass on to management) as was Chris at front desk. Byron was very professional in welcoming us and offering any additional services, I must say the professionalism, politeness and efficiency of the staff was exceptional. A special mention about the food, some blogs have refuted how good it is, I donâ€™t know where they are from or what kind of â€œsilver-spoon upbringingâ€� they have, but let me tell you from a world traveller, the food here is first class!! We had in-room dining and it was nothing but exceptional, by all means please try their in-room dinning menu. I would actually suggest dinning in rather than dinning out even though Darling Harbor has many food options. Many Thanks guys, and please keep up the good work :) Mr IT professinal :)

Reviews.Title: “perfect location. great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellKing2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while visiting friends in Sydney last year. Greatest location ever in Sydney and the hotel staff great. The Sheraton never disappoints! Only drawback was that breakfast wasn't included in my rate.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL SERVICE AND PERFECT VIEWS.”
Reviews.Author: micha1_9
Reviews.Content: From the second we drove in the driveway, i knew it was going to be a good stay. Bags collected and parking process explained, We walked in the doors greeted by smiles and even the floor cleaner at midnight had a greeting and smile for us. Our room was stunning. We stayed on 14th floor with uninterrupted views of Darling Harbour. Our package included dinner and breakfast and both my husband and I enjoyed the food. The hotel is in a perfect spot for both nightlife and shopping with the Queen Victoria Building a 5 minute walk away and the new Westfields a further 5 minutes walk. Thank you to the staff, particularly the check in staff, who made us feel special...We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: thespooks1967
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on a business trip and we enjoyed our 3 night/4 day stay with Sheraton 4 Points Darling Harbour very much. The location was excellent, an easy walk to great shopping on Pitt and George Street, and close to the Cockle Bay and King Street Wharf restaurants - highly recommend The Meat & Wine Company! We only dined in the restaurant for breakfast - we tried the menu and the buffet during our stay, both we very good. Our harbour view room on the 9th floor was spacious enough with a deck overlooking Darling Harbour - the late afternoon sun streamed in. Our room was very clean and the daily service was of the same high standard each day - it was so nice to come back to after a hard day shopping! And last but not least, the friendly courteous service we received from every staff member we came across was excellent - a special thank you to the Concierge, Tony. We would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay again on our next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel in a good location to explore SYD”
Reviews.Author: amadeusgalileosabre
Reviews.Content: * friendly staff, helpful and very apologetic in resolving the internet issue that happened in the hotel, always keeping u updated about the situation. *a nice clean room. bathroom size is average:wear and tear are shown in room (Darling Harbour View) *had a good rate from hotel; STAY 4 PAY 3 promo

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Snufl
Reviews.Content: To David Fraser I was going to write to you personally but decided to do it here. Over the years I've been fortunate enough to stay at some of the best Starwood hotels in the world. I want to let you know that your staff is up there with the best of them. There are a number of reasons your hotel is now my favourite in Sydney, including value for money, but the number one reason is the friendly and helpful attitude of your team. Please pass on my thanks.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: isobelmalloy
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel Helpful staff and areally extensive breakfast menu.A negative is a strong food smell on arrival into the hotel foyer. Would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit special and good value.”
Reviews.Author: Oldandnew
Reviews.Content: Service for our entire stay was excellent. We arrived very early in the day for a seminar on Darling Harbour and were able to leave our bags at hotel, safely park our car and then take the short walk to our conference centre. When we returned in the afternoon our room was ready & our bags were waiting in our room. Every staff member we dealt with was very friendly and helpful. Our room was comfortable with a good view. Dinner in restaurant was delicious. All round good value & excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “OK, just don't eat there”
Reviews.Author: flooch
Reviews.Content: Great location for first trip to Sydney and average somewhat dated room made this an OK choice for weekend break if can get good deal on price. Staff were all helpful and cheerful. If looking to eat out every night then fine, but if want nice meal after a tiring day in the hotel then look elsewhere... It was not a good sign, when on checking in, a handful of coupons were given to us. Coupons are not exactly classy and not what you expect of a 4* Sheraton. They are also an insult to people's intelligence. Why give everyone a coupon so that they can get the breakfast for $25 instead of $35? Am I meant to think that the receptionist chose me specially and I have got some amazing deal? It is utter nonsense. The dinner is either a la carte or buffet. You also get a coupon reducing the buffet from $80 each to $50 each if you are staying at the hotel. Who in their right mind would walk in off the street and pay $80 for a buffet...especially one as bad as this. The restaurant itself is basically in the hotel lobby. This is fine for breakfast, but not exactly nice for dinner. I don't want dinner among the conveyor belt of people walking in and out. The atmosphere is more akin to having dinner in an airport than a nice restaurant. We were at the back where it was gloomy and dark looking out into a disused adjoining room. The food consists of a good selection of seafood, soup of the day, hot selection, deserts, ice cream, cheese and biscuits. At first sight it looks a good selection, but is just incredibly ill thought through. Quality is poor, not one dish would be acceptable in any restaurant in Darling Harbour. It seemed like everything was based around keeping cost down and convenience. First up, cauliflower soup. Cauliflower and water liquidised with added salt. Taseteless, watery, no invention. Next up beef stroganoff...wait til you hear about this. Up until then, my experience of stroganoff had also been beef in a rich creamy sauce with mushrooms. This consisted of half beef, half gherkins in dark gravy (no cream detected)! The alternative was roast neck of pork. I have never seen this on a menu before and thought this cheapest of cuts was only ever used for kebabs. However, assume for one moment that someone enjoyed eating fat, you could have it with desiree potatoes (ones that were cooked properly were nice)....and now for some vegetables. The ony vegetables were chinese vegetables (bok choi and yellow beans) next to the rice. All very strange, all not very nice. This was some of the worst food I have eaten in a hotel, may be the a la carte was better. For a large hotel the restaurant was fairly small and only half full over Easter weekend when it was at full capacity. I think this says it all as most obviously ate out, however it would be nice to have the choice of eating in at the end of a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay, we will stay here again and recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Member16_10
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is close to everything, has a lot of entertainment within walking distance, the shopping, the beautifull restaurant the entertaiment, shopping, ferries to other beautifull places, etc. etc., the price was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy with a good location.”
Reviews.Author: TheCameleer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while on business in Sydney. It was great being close to Darling harbour, plenty of places to eat/drink after work and a short stroll to QEB, the strand, Meyers etc for some shopping. Check in/out was quick and friendly, and the concierge was very helpful. The rooms were a little on the small side (city side room) however, perfectly reasonable for a solo business traveller. The bed was comfortable and I had a great nights sleep. So a big tick for convinience (I prefered staying here over circular quay) and no complaints about the service or amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding personable staff!”
Reviews.Author: JandK_11
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Sheraton! Made our time in Sydney all the better. Incredibly friendly front desk staff and excellent knowledgable concierge services. We had a problem trying to confirm further travel arrangements and Kris and his colleague at the front desk went out of their way to help us. Cannot say enough about the attentive service! Free wifi in the entire lobby area is a bonus. Great location right across from the Aquarium and walking distance to heaps of great shopping and eating options. Oh, and the room? Well appointed with a lovely view of Darling Harbour!

Reviews.Title: “No real complaints”
Reviews.Author: PerthiteOZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights to attend a conference which turned out to be a 10 minute easy walk from hotel. Upgraded to King Harbour view on arrival. Although did not have much time to enjoy, much nicer to view the water than the multi storey car park opposite. Bed was comfortable. The varying types of pillows was good. Shower had great water pressure and everything was clean. Only 2 things don''t get the gold star. No shower wash/liquid soap provided and I left my soap at home as so used to this being provided. Second was the noise of the running water in adjoining rooms. Very loud especially when someone is showering at 3.00am. Had room service on 1 night and food was excellent, a very large serving delivered promptly. Internet access was easy and quick. Free in the lobby area but it is hard to work in such a busy location so paid the $24.50 for 24 hours room access fee a couple of times. With some good planning,managed to get away with 2 days internet costs for 4 days coverage. Cost is about the norm for most Australian hotels but still expensive IMO. Lifts were always timely, even in peak periods. Good location for walking to restaurants in King Street & Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Vehement anti-smoker”
Reviews.Author: robertdafforn
Reviews.Content: First the good news about this Hotel. The beds were good, the room was attractive and well laid out, and the view of Darling Harbour was stunning. The staff were pleasant and efficient. Then the bad news.... The balcony which we paid extra for had no chairs to sit on, and was 30 metres from multiple dual carriageway city roads. A bit difficult to â€™enjoy and unwind on your private balconyâ€™ as quoted in the holiday brochure we had, with traffic roaring past. The breakfast cost Au$35, but the coffee and cooked items were ALWAYS lukewarm. No effort made to keep the bacon and eggs at a reasonable temperature made so far as I experienced. The real downer was the attitude of the management towards my â€˜smokerâ€™ wife â€“ we paid extra for a balcony in August 2010 for a balcony so that she could sit outside and smoke without incurring the hotel in any possible disadvantage to their room, (a position I readily accept), and the hotel went non-smoking in February 2011. The Hotel management (arrogant shower) feel entitled to levy a â€˜fineâ€™ of Au$200 for a so-called cleaning charge for the room even if you smoke on your balcony with the door to the balcony closed. Now, you may abhor a smoker, many do, but from a logical standpoint this was an unreasonable imposition not made by any of the other completely â€˜non smokerâ€™ hotels we are using in Australia and USA. Sheraton hotels are definitely off our list.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm - wasnt impressed”
Reviews.Author: CherieClenick
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights for a work event, staff at check whilst quick and efficient were clearly bored and had no interest in even raising their eyes above the computer to say hi. Stayed in a city view room which was run down, tired and the bathroom reminded me of being in an asian country hotel. Whilst i spent very little time in the room when i did have to go to and from the room i had to trek a good 10mins from the lifts to my room at the back of the hotel. Room was nice and quiet, and nice and clean as you would expect. I wouldnt stay here again if i have the choice. To me was more of a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mackajo9025
Reviews.Content: The portion of out holiday spent at this hotel was EXCELLENT! I would highly recommend this location to anyone traveling and staying in Sydney. I was somewhat concerned with some of the reviews left about this hotel when booking, but after our stay I cannot complain about anything. The breakfast was very expensive but a large selection of items were available...not a problem though since many sidewalk cafes are located nearby. The staff was wonderful, very friendly, extra helpful and accommodating. The room was very comfortable and clean. Plenty of towels available, and anything extra we asked for was immediately brought up to the room. Upgrade to the harbor view room...it will be nicer...Two thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: shanvarghese
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room no 942 on the 9th floor which was a harbor view room . We had easy access to all of the harbor including IMAX and lindt! 15 min walk to circular quay and brilliant views made our anniversary day special. Muchos gracias!

Reviews.Title: “In need of some updating”
Reviews.Author: beautytravelerLondon
Reviews.Content: I normally very much like the Sheraton chain but this isn't one of their finest. The best thing is the location in 5mins walking disctance from Darling harbour. However, my room on the 7th floor was small, tired-looking and damp-smelling. Bed and flat-screen TV were the better aspects, as was the breakfast buffet. It's not professional enough for business travelers, and not nice enoygh for leisure. Average 3 star in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but check your bill”
Reviews.Author: bizmanau
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and service. The front desk staff were very polite and the concierge called my room soon after arrival introducing himself and asking if I wanted anything. I stayed in one of the more expensive rooms, the harbour facing one with a balcony. The room was clean but worn. The carpet especially was old. The in-room Internet was not free and was wired not wireless. When I got the bill there was a 1 dollar donation to some charity which I did not authorise. A week after returning from my business trip an additional $10 fee came through on my credit card even though I did not use any minibar, on-demand movies etc. There was a quick checkout service that promised to email me a copy of my invoice but I never received it. However I continue to receive their spam so clearly my correct email is in their system. My overall recommendation would be to stay here, but not use the quick checkout service, and manually collect and carefully read a printed invoice.

Reviews.Title: “Forget Tony Danza, the 4 Points is the boss!”
Reviews.Author: Lunarboogie
Reviews.Content: Great service, location, cleanliness and comfort. How is that for four points! But wait. There's more. Super comfy beds, excellent gym, free wifi in the lobby and the most amazing breakfast buffet spread I've seen in a while. It was pure indulgence. It even had freshly squeezed beetroot juice which is not something you find every day. Put simply, the 4 points is Sheraton quality and attention to detail without the price. We stayed in a city view standard room that faced Sussex Street. It was small but well appointed. The clincher for us was the price. We scored a room for AUD180 a night on wotif, including breakfast, which made it the best deal in town. It is a very busy place and caters to the conference market. That said, the service still seemed very personal and I didn't ever feel I was just one of the Joneses. I will definitely stay there again, if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Droplet5
Reviews.Content: The room was very outdated and run down... along with the rest of the hotel. Carpets were damp and felt dirty to walk on. The room was really in desperate need of a clean. Old TV... actually everything was just old and dirty. View was ok (we were sort of facing Darling Harbour) and location was great (short stroll over the bridge to Darling Harbour).

Reviews.Title: “They couldn't help me more unless they spoon fed and dressed me!”
Reviews.Author: Whirled_Travell3r
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here at the Sheraton Four Points twice now for business conferences, and what amazed me both times was the staff - in particular the super conscientious concierge staff at the front door. Unlike any other hotel I have stayed at around the world, they seem to have a system where there are 2 dedicated staff that stand in the foyer and look to proactively assist guests wherever they can. I would come down from my room and wait in the foyer to meet colleagues before going out to a meeting, and these staff would come staight over, and politely ask if there is anything they could do for me, orgnanise a taxi, recommend somewhere to eat, get me a newspaper... and I wouldn't be surprised if they offered me a foot massage if I was standing around waiting too long!

Reviews.Title: “A great find for SYD”
Reviews.Author: ZiggyNZ
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3-night business trip and needed a hotel close to our office in Kent St. First impressions were very good - check-in was very quick, agent was great (7.30pm on a Tuesday evening). Room was a harbour suite which was massive - must be one of the largest rooms in it's class in the CBD with a great balcony overlooking Darling Harbour. Being at the end of the corridor I found it very quiet with no noise at all during my stay. Great to LCD screens in both the living and bedrroms, shame about the ancient digital system they have (DOCOMO is technology living in the nineties, and this is after an upgrade). Only comment on the room service was they did not put the ironing borad and iron away - a minor thing really. Food service to the room was quick and quality good. Onyl complaint was my colleague was trying to call my room on the first evening and was on hold for 15+ minutes to be transferred. When I raised this with the operator she said she was the only one on shift (this is in a property of 400+ rooms) and also dealing with guest calls! So i would strongly suggest increasing headcount in the evenings to cater to demand. Breakfast was great, good selection at the buffet. Location superb, and in summary a very good stay, I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: graydudes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice. First time I dropped a key on floor when hanging some trousers. Rang soon after checking out to try & retrieve. My number was taken however nobody called back. Key gone. 3 nights at c$262 per night. Friend staying at same time paid $200. Second visit. 2 nights at $275 per night. Was allocated a disabled room after being told it just didn't have a bath. No problem until I discovered it's a wet room that results in the entire bathroom floor becoming wet. I nearly become disabled after slipping in the floor. I'm sure it's designed well for the disabled but everything was low (bathroom sink) except for the toilet which was an elevated throne. The room itself smelt musty, probably as a result wet wheelchair wheels rolling out from the flooded bathroom. To top it off, I got the shitz after eating a caesar salad downstairs & spent more time in the manky bathroom than expected on a 2 night business trip. Oh, & the key card had to be re-coded after failing just as I was doing the bolt back to that manky bathroom. Not a happy camper here. The hoards of conference partied seem to like this property. They can have it. Second stay

Reviews.Title: “Go for the harbour view as city view has you staring into an office building. No pool or spa or sauna”
Reviews.Author: Bozz56
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms as we had international guests with us. Rooms were of reasonably generous proportions. City view was that of an office building. Concierge very knowledgable. All staff very freindly and eager to please. Buffet breakfast fantastic. Makes up for the sparse amenities provided in the bathroom.TV picture doesnt fit into the screen and subtitles cannot be read properly. The TV system needs to be upgraded to full digital. Great flower arrangements in the foyer. Taxis easy to obtain out the front. Monorail station is reasonably easy to get to. Darling Harbour very accessable via a walkway in the hotel grounds. Only 3 blocks to the city centre & QVB, an easy walk. Internet fee excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: ag88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the King Harbour view suite, what an amazing view!. Our room was superb, Very spacious and very comfortable bed. The staff at hotel were efficient and friendly being from reception, conceirge and including housekeeping. The breakfast had a lot of variety though very busy. Free internet in the lobby came in very handy. A great location, central enough to walk to alot of the sights but not so central for it to be crowded and noisy. Overall a great hotel. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: scartissue
Reviews.Content: staff very friendly and helpful. perfect location. we got a free upgrade, king harbour view room champagne and chocolates as celebrating our 1st wedding anniversary. will definatley stay again in the near future. large clean rooms and great price for sydney hotels

Reviews.Title: “I'm so glad to have discovered four points”
Reviews.Author: cinnamoncin
Reviews.Content: A last minute booking but the call centre were able to meet and better a 'wotif.com' offer. We booked a city suite so that we could use the living room after our 3year old went to bed. As star wood members we were upgraded the harbour view - and wow was that worth it! The rollaway bed fit into the bedroom comfortably and our son was delighted by the view of water and boats and the bridge, and we even saw fireworks two nights in a row. The location is great, just a short walk to the Powerhouse museum where there is a great kids area, paddys market, Chinatown and more. Try 'home' restaurant for awesome Thai food. We even took a light rail tram from the other side of the bridge to the new pirrama park where there is an extensive playground with sandpit, water features, climbing net. All in all a great time for us with our son. It did get quite noisy on Saturday night. I guess the music was coming from Dundee arms, the pub right next to the hotel. Door, door music while we were trying to sleep but didn't notice it too much once I fell asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but would check room before staying”
Reviews.Author: gct1
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly. The room smelled very musty. We called the front desk and they brought up an "air purifier" which actually did nothing. We were afraid our clothes were going to smell. At check-in, we got a piece of paper that said we could have a two for one drink. Not knowing the place that was two for one was outside the hotel, we sat and had a drink in the bar area (which was not busy). I thought the barperson saw our coupon, but didn't say anything about where it could be redeemed. We were charged full price for each beverage. We also got "coupons" for brunch the next morning, and we thought it should have been explained that the price of the brunch would be $25.00 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Good on many fronts”
Reviews.Author: Horseboxhero2010
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and good value in the CBD. Nice staff, decor and views. Good location (close to Darling Harbor and the CBD). Excellent breakfast buffet. My only very minor critique was that the staff weren't able to recommend a running route. All round very good experience though.

Reviews.Title: “Location, smiles and value”
Reviews.Author: Daniel1964
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights and had a very compfortable and enjoyable stay. We had a deluxe harbour view room that was more spacious than I expected considering we needed a roll out bed for our son. Great view from the balcony overlooking Darling Harbour. This hotel is in a great location of Sydney. Excellant breakfast. Modern feel when you first walk in to the lobby but what stood out for me was the friendly smiling service from every staff member we encountered. Just wish we could get a shower without having to stand in a tub with a shower curtain but a minor whinge on what was a great 3 nights in a very nice hotel that I would highly recommend. Thank you. Daniel

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: caser41
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The room was nice & very comfortable with a clean bathroom. We had a room with a street view rather than the harbour view. However we spent very little time in our room as we were touring a lot so it didn't really matter.Our package came with breakfast. The selection was excellent. The hotel is located on Darling harbour, so there were lots of things to do with in walking distance. Also close to many modes of public transport. The only negative point I would have is that the attached convenience store charged us an extra 35 cents on each overseas stamp we purchased. The next day a different clerk charged an extra 30 cents on each overseas stamp we purchased. In all of our travels in the Americas and Europe we have never ran into this extra charge before.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Views - Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: ally135stargirl
Reviews.Content: We had a three night weekend stay in a King Harbour View Room. Rooms were spotless and made up early each morning which we prefer. The view was fantastic we were lucky enough to see the fireworks at Cockle Bay during Chinese New Year. Buffet Breakfast was good. We had an excellent dinner in the restaurant. We also ordered room service which was great and very efficient. Bar was also good to sit and have a drink or light meal / snack. Location was also great with a short walk to Darling Harbour and the city plenty of taxi's available if you don't want to walk. Free Wifi in the foyer was great. Four Points Sheraton Staff are fantastic very professional and yet friendly at the same time, they all helped make our stay even more enjoyable. Best hotel service we have encountered for a long time. We will definately stay there again when we next visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rangela Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel in a great location overlooking Darling Harbour. Easy access to the waterfront where there are many restaurants and facilities. Excellent accomodation serviced by first class staff. A short walk away from the waterfront will take you to the city district with shopping, coffee shops etc. Highly recommended. Raymond (Hertfordshire UK)

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel for its class”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLuv
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night. First of all, I have to say the check in staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. I managed to get a room straight away despite arriving before check in time. I had an early dinner at the Dundee Arms which was decent for pub food. Did not try the restaurant in the lobby. Here are some of the issues I encountered. The hallway outside my room had a dank moldy smell, might be time for a carpet change. I happened to be there on an extremely warm day in Sydney and I felt the AC just could not cope. I was warm for the entire stay. Room is functional, not exceptionally spacious. Quite clean, but not luxurious. Walls are thin, I could hear everything going on in the hallway. Did not get a great night's sleep as a result. Location is so-so. It is an okay hotel for its class. You can't compare this hotel to one of the 5 stars, because it simply is not the same product. If you are looking for decent clean hotel but not looking for the 5 star luxury, then this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: sfergo
Reviews.Content: The rooms were too noisy, the walls were thin so I heard the noise from the other room's and my room had a street view so people leaving the bar kept waking me up. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to people who like their sleep. Also there was no cereal bowl in my room so I had to buy the expensive breakfast at the hotel. And the bedâ€™s werenâ€™t comfy. The one good thing about it is I could check in late.

Reviews.Title: “3 star at best”
Reviews.Author: HKCrocky
Reviews.Content: Checked in and was told I had been upgraded to harbor view room. That actually meant a standard room with a pretty useless balcony as it was facing the busy road that cuts you off from the harbor. Room smelt musty and old. Finishings tired and worn in places. Small TV. Internet service was patchy at best. Same for all my colleagues. Breakfast was perhaps the best part of the stay albeit in an 80's like environment. Just dont get there when it's busy however. The 2 staff struggle to seat everyone and get upset if you dont wait to be seated.

Reviews.Title: “excellent from start to finish inside & out”
Reviews.Author: garytrish6
Reviews.Content: we had a 2 night stay over and from the moment we walked in the hotel until we walked out it was 100 % top to bottom, Breakfast dinner drinks it was all excellent the staff were just brilliant so professional so helpfull it really did make our weekend one that we will remember for a long time. Thank you all very much

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jlmvcr
Reviews.Content: Great place to explore Sydney, only problem was there was no swiming pool

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotal”
Reviews.Author: sunnee79
Reviews.Content: myself and husband stayed at the four points in sydney for our honeymoon, and i was a little concerned over some of the reviews, but have to say it was lovely! we got upgraded free of charge for our honeymoon to a room facing the harbour and our room was very big, huge bed, very very comfy! its is a little warn the furniture but the room was nice, clean and the house keeping were there every day. the safe in the room is free of charge and the fridge comes equiped fully stocked by them (but chargable for their drinks), it was a little pricey so we took their stuff out of the fridge and left it on the side and filled it with our own brought stuff! they dont mind, as you only get charged if you actually use any of their drinks and we just put them back the day before we left! the staff are very friendly and the concierge especially! they always ackowleged us when we walked past and were very helpful with any questions we had! i would definately stay here again! and a great location, they have a bridge link to the harbour from the hotel bar outside, takes only a 2 mins to get there! oh lovely restaurant to go to, meat and wine co on the harbour!! we only found it 2 days before we went, so went that night and our last night! staff very good in there too.

Reviews.Title: “Look out for bargains and deals!”
Reviews.Author: Tushalb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel pretty late an managed to get a free night for our 3 night stay from the hotels website. In Sydney if you stay here rest assured of a great location and excellent customer service. The 24 hour concierge service was brilliant, team of dedicated people with excellent know how of the local areas and events information. Their property is a bit old or should i say classy but there some places like the corners in the bathroom that need a little more attention. The pix on hotel website are really understated. We had a city side ie building facing room but did have a glimpse of the harbour side room and that was just incomparable but only a tad bit more expensive. They even have an Irish pub on campus and convenience store and a special dedicated access of sorts straight into darling harbour!!! You won't regret staying here and yea it helps to get starwood preferred guest membership we got treated extra special with a bottle of bubbly from the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go to this hotel! NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: JMWS
Reviews.Content: first of all we rang up the day before to confirm our booking. They could not find our reservation. I was on the phone to them for around 3 hours trying to get it sorted. I hate how they switch you to room reservations and u cant hardly understand them. The next day we arrived for check in and we were made to wait for over an hour and a half for our room. It was being cleaned and was not ready. slack if u ask me! When we finally got our room, it felt like we were given a dodgy room! The floors were damp ( from obviously being cleaned ) They were still stained and really ugly! The bath tub was dirty with someone else's hair in it. It was also a shower/bath in one. which is not very comfortable! The beds blanket was thin but over all our sleep in that bed was really comfy. The mini bar had hardly any Alcoholic beverages and other things.Also we were supposed to have an astray on our balcony. Which they did not provide. Amongst other little things. When our room was cleaned the next day they did not refill anything. which was not very nice. we ended up having to order drinks cos we were so thirsty. Also the rooms are not very sound proof! room service was fairly fast. They had really nice food there. definitely a plus! Each floor had an ice machine. Which was very handy. The view was amazing! Especially for fireworks. I would never go there again, We did not enjoy the room or service. Go to another hotel if you are considering ur stay at Four Points.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: lucky_charm2300
Reviews.Content: The Four Points Sheraton was everything I was expecting. Having stayed at many Starwoods properties, it had everything I was used to. Great room with a lovely king sized bed. The bathroom was a nice large size. Loved the toilitries they stocked. I did not have a harbour view, but it was a five minute walk to the harbour itself so I didn't feel deprived. The concierge was helpful for finding my way around. Sydney is a pretty easy city to navigate. Only disappointment was finding out that a 3 1/2 minute phone call I made from the room to Canada cost me $44 Australian!!! I looked for the info in the room before I placed the call, but they didn't detail costs. Upon check out I was quite surprised by this extra charge I was not expecting (I was expecting maybe $10), and was equally surprised by the staff member that shrugged it off. The conversation was like this: me: "what's the extra charge for?" staff: "oh, that was for a phone call you made, $44" me: "what!?! how long was the phone call?" staff: "3 1/2 minutes, it's ONLY $11 per minute" me: "well that's certainly unexpected" staff: "yep, that's too bad - cash or credit" Word to the wise - don't make even short calls from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: X70MJS
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, great area to explore from, almost everything walkable Room had a good view but smallish and a bit dated. Bar and restaurant not welcoming felt like a canteen Sussex bar at front deserted and not promoted and could be a highlight

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing for a Sheraton hotel more like a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizzyds
Reviews.Content: The location of Four Points is excellent, overlooking Darling Harbour with loads of good restaurants bars and the imax cinema. Close to chinatown, great shopping, good transport and a very easy walk to harbour and all its attractions. Where this hotel fails is its rooms, small unattractive and with one of the worst poky, shabby bathrooms I have ever seen in a 4 star hotel. Badly in need of a makeover. No pool either just a small gym. When I booked I did not realise that there was another Sheraton in Sydney. There is in the city on Elizabeth St., opposite Hyde Park. I visited there absolutely gorgeous, huge marble bathrooms with huge separate shower, lovely big rooms tastefully furnished with sitting area, a great indoor pool with outdoor loungers with a fab view over Sydney harbour, gym and health club. And all for 10 dollars a night extra for a standard city room view. Overall, the Four Points might be okay for a buisness visit over a few nights but I think that any leisure visitor would find it disappointing and not very good value and certainly not up to a Sheraton standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: IanAUk Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I went to my Sisters Wedding in Sydney along with my Brother, hotel was in a fantastic location, rooms were of a good standard and Darling Harbour was easily accessible as well as Cicular Quay (10-15 mins walk), The Rocks 10-15 mins walk, Summing it up if you were to go to Sydney for a short stay this is an ideal location

Reviews.Title: “Holiday time dreamland”
Reviews.Author: zixo
Reviews.Content: This was the most affordable accomodation which was available at the time through wotifn darling harbour. We Would of preferred to of booked directly through this hotel as we were staying with another four couples, but seems like wotif has some specials sewn up. Wonderful view from the windows overlooking Darling Harbour. The staff were delightful and fantastic particularly at the reception area. The subsidised car parking area is across the road - at a cost of $40.00 it is a bargain during the Christmas eve rush hour if you plan to do so some last minute christmas city shopping. The rooms are a little in the smallish size - the bathrooms are even smaller, yet, the comfortable King size bed compensates for any short comings. Breakfast at the buffet would please even the fussiest of people. The choice and selection of foods was out of this world. No noise was heard from where we were staying on the eight floor and all of our friends thought exactly as we did. We will all stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bannisterja
Reviews.Content: Only drawback was there was no pool. Free Internet wireless from lobby. Excellent location. Fifeteen min walking to anywhere

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: lynwat
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night with my 11 yr old daughter arriving late afternoon and checking out for a very early flight next morning. Our stay was thoroughly enjoyed. We were greeted promptly on entering to assist with our luggage. Check in was quick and courteous. And our upgrade to a Darling Harbour view room from the City View I had booked was welcomed. My daugher was greatly impressed. The view was spectacular. Can recommend paying the extra dollars for the view. The location is fantastic and enabled us to enjoy the dining at Darling Harbour and a safe walk back to the hotel. The room offering twin beds although on the small size was comfortable and clean. The bathroom was servicable. I will definately book this hotel again when returning to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: BMWBMW
Reviews.Content: Assigned a harbour view room--nice touch. Overall nice staff and hotel The only comment is that why does the room safe required a credit card (free of charge) to use it. Why not just install a digital lock?? I guess it has the option to charge for the use it wishes.

Reviews.Title: “Panaromic Darling Harbour views”
Reviews.Author: yours_vikram
Reviews.Content: The location was just fantastic. Just adjoining the Darling Harbour, and the great monorail at its doorsteps. It was very convenient to reach there. The check in was very smooth, and they also gave us a room on the top floors, which was great. The room was quite big and had harbour views, as well as city. It looked beautiful during the night to look at the harbour. Overall a great place. The breakfast was great which they served in the room upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again with increased knowledge”
Reviews.Author: Steve8010
Reviews.Content: Had a maritime studio, great size with king bed (actual king bed - not two pushed together!). Bathroom very roomy however shower over the bath (tiny) with a shower curtain? In this day and age .. Only main concern was on our final night of our four night stay at around 9pm at night, hotel security let themselves in even though the DND (do not disturb sign) was on the door. We were actually in the process of getting changed after returning from dinner to be asked if everything was alright. They advised that they had tried to call earlier to no avail (we were out) and it was hotel policy that they were to enter the room to ensure everything was fine. They advised that had we phoned reception earlier to advise everything was ok then there would not have been a need to enter the room... Now I've stayed in many a hotel and have never needed to "check-in" with reception to advise my status quo previously; however would have happily obliged IF I'd been told at original check-in that it was a requirement. For security to circumnavigate the privacy of having the DND sign on the door was rather confronting...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, well located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: fivelaws
Reviews.Content: The Four Points is well located next to Darling Harbour, a short walk from the CBD. Room was excellent and the staff all very friendly. By far and away the best thing being that they were able to get me into my room at 08:30am, which means so much when youâ€™ve just arrived after a 24-hour flight. The â€œcity viewâ€� room had a fairly terrible view (see attached photos) but Iâ€™d stayed in other hotels on Darling Harbour and hardly ever looked out of the window, so nothing lost there really. But if this was your first stay in Sydney, youâ€™d be wanting to pay the little extra for a harbour view room. With all the restaurants, bars and other food outlets just next door in Darling Harbour, I never ate or drank in the hotel so canâ€™t comment on the quality. But the restaurant/bar did look pretty good. Probably the best of the Darling Harbour hotels Iâ€™ve stayed in and one Iâ€™d definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: cyclinglover
Reviews.Content: The location is really good, one of the best in Sydney. Rooms are good too. Unfortunately, there is no swimming pool nor walk-in showers. Check-in was slow although it was not busy. Rates fluctuate, would not hesitate to stay here if you can get a decent rate. Computers with free internet are available in the lobby, but the computers were very slow and unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer experience but great concierge service.”
Reviews.Author: Bluefish7
Reviews.Content: Location is great as it's a few blocks away from QVB and next to Cockle Wharf. Negative experience comes from the reception telephone line from the room. There are no options to dial directly to housekeeping or concierge and just appear to have one selection - which the hotel has a different name that I can recall now, Experience or something but it took me a while to figure that this might be the one to press for reception. There's only one option, not even a '0' for those who can't figure out. The waiting time to get through to the reception was horribly long! I have never waited this long, ever at any hotel. And I just wanted the reception to transfer me to concierge so the fact the hotel concentrated all calls to one line is not helpful. The hotel is likely aware of this long waiting hold time as the message while on hold tells me to enjoy the music in the meantime. Being aware and not resolving it is not good hospitality. I called at various time of the day and evening so it's not a 'peak' hour issue. The main saving grace in service at Four Points Sydney is the concierge. I commend Gary and Kenny (there was a third guy whom I didn't get the name) who were extremely helpful and were excellent in their follow through on my request for dining reservation at Marque and my airline changes. Though I couldn't get a seat at Marque after several days of waitlisting, I wasn't as upset because I knew that the concierge guys tried and they provided regular updates to me. Excellent concierge but the rest of the service in the hotel needs improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Old but great”
Reviews.Author: TravelinRebecca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Four Points during a business trip; my room was old, but very well appointed and cleaned. I was on the top floor overlooking Darling Harbour. The cleaning of the room was outstanding, and there was minimum wastage from the staff. The seafood buffet was amazing; I dined at the Corn Exchange midweek and consequently, it was also cheap. I wouldn't bother with a cooked breakfast; I tried it once and the quality wasn't worth it. Stick to continental or eat at a cafe in the city. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a quick visit to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SimonButcher
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights here after finding some unbelievable rates during the Christmas holidays. The hotel is excellent and the staff are incredibly helpful. We appreciated the conciergerie's honest advice. The location speaks for itself - if you're looking at a map, you may not notice that there's actually a walkway from the hotel which will take you straight to Darling Harbour (right near the Aquarium). The hotel is an easy walk from the city centre train station too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location & Best in Place”
Reviews.Author: skjdreams2
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is an Very good place to spent your time as it is just on the opposite side of the Sydney Aquarium, Wildlife Park. the Location on Sydney Darling Harbor, Walking distance to the Darling harbor Monorail Station, Walking again to the Sydney Tower. It has a great Restaurant, Conference Hall and great staff to help you out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Folkfab
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location, friendly helpful staff, Rooms are clean, If I had to mention a negative it would be the bathrooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and well appointed.”
Reviews.Author: Nelson_NewZealandSue
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Sheraton after a slightly questionable stay at a nearby apartment. The Sheraton staff were awesome from the moment we arrived at the front desk. They showed us the rooms (interconnecting) and in the time we went back to the other place to pack our bags, the rooms were ready complete with a baby cot - and it was a cot not a portable cot. The restaurant meals were awesome and there was plenty of choice. The bell man Tony was a true star. He was so knowledgable and the kids looked out for him all the time. Travelling with kids at a 5 star hotel may seem odd but we have travelled so much and our kids are respectful and not annoying. (If I can say so myself.) But the staff and guests were great and often talked about the good behaviour of our kids. That aside, they welcomed our family with open arms and we had a great stay. The location was brilliant. Highly recommend and we will stay again when we are in Sydney next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: mukali
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great location to explore Sydney. We did not have a car but the hotel is only a few minutes walk to Darling Harbour with its many attractions. Also within walking distance of Circular Quay, the Rocks and Sydney Opera House. A harbour cruise is a must if you visit Sydney. Chinatown was only 10 minutes walk and we had very good dim-sum at Nine Dragons restaurant. For dinner, there are lots of restauarants in Darling harbour to choose from; we went to one called Ice Cube and had a very good time and meal (Moreton Bay bugs are great!) The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. We checked in early and they got our rooms ready by 10:15 am. Ask for a room with a harbour view if possible. Room was clean, and the bed was comfortable. Overall the hotel met my expectations for a Four Points Sheraton. Taxi from airport was $38. But if you are travelling alone and travel light you could walk 10 minutes to a train station and take the train to the airport for less than half that cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: EsmeBunny
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at four Points. I found staff to be friendly and helpful. The location is great - close to the city, China Town and Darling Harbour. Slept very well in the king size bed and enjoyed the excellent pressure in the shower! The only thing I can fault is the costly internet rates ($12 per hour or $24 per day). I didn't use it but went to cafes with free WiFi to access the internet. I am hoping things will change in Au with internet charges. It needs to be included in accommodation rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BDe-19
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers everything you need on a business trip: good internet access, good location, good rooms, good breakfast, a nice little bar etc.. The location is excellent - very close to Darling Harbour, George Street, QVB and all other important spots in downtown Sydney. No matter what you need: pubs, restaurants, shops etc.: everything is very near. The service is very mindful - e.g. they called me in the afternoon asking if everything is okay, because I had the do-not-disturb-sign on the door all day long (in fact I staied in bed all day thanks to fever). Thanks to a special rate my stay was even a bargain

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for jet lagged couple”
Reviews.Author: pomaloma
Reviews.Content: Arrived here in the early morning after our flight from LAX, our room was ready for us at 7am, and a great concierge service brought our luggage up without problems. We had a great shower and got ready to see Sydney. The bed was lovely and had a great mini bar. Darling Harbour is a great middle point in proximity to the Harbor and the rest of the Central Business District.

Reviews.Title: “NOT RECOMMENDED AND HERE'S WHY...”
Reviews.Author: SydneyJenJen
Reviews.Content: The only 2 good things about Four Points by Sheraton was the friendly staff and the late 3pm check out but even then I ran into a slight issue with it. I called reception on the night I arrived to confirm my check out time was 3pm the next day and she didn't seem to sure until I told her that was part of the package deal. I requested a king size bed when I booked and instead on the day they said they didn't have any king size bed left in the hotel and we were given 2 twin beds,which turned out to be 2 single beds,and only upgraded us to a Harbour View room on level 1. The bathroom was not very clean,the shower was over the bath and water would splash everywhere when showering.The furniture seemed abit old and damaged and the new flat screen TV stopped working during our stay and had to get a maintenance guy to come up to the room to fix it.Lastly,they took $ 50 bond money twice when checking in,when suppose to only take it once,out of my account over 2 days when I only stayed 1 night and its been 3 days now and they still have not released the $100 back into my account! My bank confirmed they are still holding my money! I tried to call them today and had me on the line while it was ringing for more then 3 mintues and then to have someone tell me their Finance Department is currently busy and to call back later.Overall my experience at the hotel wasn't all that memorable and probably will not go back there again and highly not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Aust_mum
Reviews.Content: Good location. Only fault was the bathroom - I don't like brushing my teeth next to the toilet. Very small bathroom with the shower over the bath and toilet next to the basin. Excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel within walking distance to Darling Harbour.”
Reviews.Author: skimom333
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I enjoyed our week stay at the Four Points Darling Harbour. Our service was excellent. The room was comfortable, fresh and clean. There was a walking bridge to the left of the hotel entrance that got us to Darling Harbor in a few minutes walk. From Darling Harbour you could catch the ferry to Circular Quay, the hub of Sydney Harbour or just walk around and enjoy all of the wonderful places to dine at Darling Harbour. Chinatowne was also within walking distance of Darling Harbor. Don't miss Paddy's market in Chinatowne where you can find very nice and very inexpensive souvenirs! We had to go back a second time and get some more things to take home. For inexpensive groceries walk to Woolworths at Cnt Park and George Street. Don't forget to get some Tim-Tams! We had to ask the hotel to empty the refrigerator of all the items that they had for sale so we could fit some of our own food in there. This was the only problem with this hotel. They did not want to empty it out at first so we just put everything on the dresser and then the maid took it to get it out of our way. We would love to visit the Four Points again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but rooms could be better”
Reviews.Author: hneyb
Reviews.Content: Great location and good view of darling harbour. But unfortunately found the hotel rooms to be less than welcoming. Very dull, limited choice of TV channels ( doesn't even give you all the free digital channels - but gives you a couple of premium sports channels but not enough for a hotel of this class). No swimming pool which is dissapointing especially at the end of the day when you want a relaxing swim instead of a stint at the gym. The restaurant was also dissapointing especially considering the prices. Overall, the hotel is located very conveniently in the CBD and very close proximity to darling harbour and all its shops and restaurants. But I wish the hotel offered more for the price.

Reviews.Title: “High marks for location and staff”
Reviews.Author: klckt
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location; helpful, efficient, and professional staff. A bustling hotel that seemed to be popular with both tourists and business people. The early check-in and (unrequested) room upgrade were appreciated. I can recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Well executed inner city hotel, close to darling harbor and a pleasant stroll throughout the city and circular quay”
Reviews.Author: Scottd237
Reviews.Content: A well executed example of the four points brand. Close to darling harbor. In room Internet was busted on my stay, which in hind site given it's cost, not such s bad thing. Room was quiet at clean.

Reviews.Title: “A great home base for the best of Sydney and New South Wales”
Reviews.Author: Bennyhavens
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an alleged "5-Star" hotel in Sydney, but the Four Points by Sheraton Darling Harbour blew it away. In addition to providing a clean, spacious, comfortable room, this hotel had a great gym with plenty of weights, cardio equipment, and a view of Darling Harbour that made me forget how bored I was supposed to be on the treadmill. The location is hard to beat, as it is right on Darling Harbour and convenient to upscale shopping, restaurants, and the train / subway / monorail station. This hotel has somehow managed to combine a friendly, professional staff, great location, upscale ammenities and value (by Sydney standards)..............oh, and I should throw in the historical pub next door for good measure. I shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Geminidreams
Reviews.Content: I am a Gold SPG member. On arrival we were upgraded to a Maritime Suite. Furniture was a little tired but the suite was comfortable and nicely appointed. View over Darling Harbour was lovely. There were many points of interest within a short distance of the hotel. Breakfast was OK and included. Concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: pnut4912
Reviews.Content: A boutique hotel it is not, but the service team thinks it is one. Check in was a little sloppy, but after that, everything was great. During our stay, the Four Points concierge helped us with restaurant recommendations in the Surrey Hills neighborhood, booked a wine tour in the Hunter Valley, and provided directions / transportation options throughout our trip. Also, While on our wine tour one of our souvenirs (a small wine gadget) was misplaced on the bus. We attempted to contact the wine tour company ourselves, but were unsuccessful. Since we were leaving town the next day we went to concierge for advice. He continuously called the wine tour and within a few days was able to locate our lost item and helped ship it to us (back in the States). Although it was a small and inexpensive item, he put in a large effort and understood that it meant something to us. I am extremely thankful that concierge was so dedicated and wanted to share his exceptional customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Vielflieger_44
Reviews.Content: Best about this hotel is its location! Situated along Darling Harbour its not far from many offices,but also suitable for a walk to the famous sites or shopping streets. Staff is very friendly. There is a good coffee bar in the lobby and around the corner there are many great restaurants. There is however no executive lounge in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: oscarpebbles
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel, and it has been about 2 years in between so it was interesting to see if there were any changes. We arrived early (about 12pm) at Four Points as check in was at 2pm we expected to leave our bags with the concierge and wander around a bit but fortunately our room was ready when we booked in. The receptionist upgraded us immediately to the 14th floor which is the second highest. So far so good. The rooms are not big but they are adequately sized. There is no problem walking around the room without bumping into furniture. (I have stayed in hotels that you can barely move past the bed). Everything was clean, a few bumps on the furniture but it will still be a few years before a refurb, Flat screen TV and a good choice of channels if you speak English. The bed was comfortable and the Harbour view (Darling Harbour) superb. However I think the best asset the hotel showed when we were there was the staff. Always smiling and more than helpful. One morning I needed to print out my boarding pass for the flight home the next day and I inquired about using the internet. I was told that I had free wifi in the room but since I didn't have a laptop or printer with me this was no use to me. Normally I have to use the business centre in the hotel for a fee. The receptionist simply did it for me on the spot, All I needed to do was give my booking number (I had already booked in and chosen my seats through my mobile) and he printed off my boarding passes for me. The breakfast buffet is still great but not as extensive as I remember, even though you can still get your wheat grass shot if you need it. There was an incident with a traveler who had turned up for breakfast after 10am (breakfast is till 10.30am) who got annoyed with a waitress because her yogurt was not there and she wanted to eat healthy. Perhaps if she had managed to get there earlier then she might have got her yogurt. The wait staff told her they would see what they could do but the woman left before there was a result. The last time I was here my sister and her partner were with us and they were put in a smoking room. As non smokers they weren't happy about this but were moved. This time I ensured that I told them I required a non smoking room and had no problem. All in all a great stay at a great location in Sydney. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: twoleftfeet_88
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for a 2 night stay over the weekend whilst we were visiting Sydney for a family function. We decided to stay at Four Points as we have stayed numerous times previously and enjoyed our stay. However this time, our experience was very disappointing. The location of the hotel is fantastic, right on Darling Harbour and a close walk to the main centre for shopping etc. It is also only a short walk from the Town Hall train station. The rooms are always comfortable and clean and you can always seem to get a value for money room rate. The in room amenities are great - all the comforts of home. The service we experienced from the Restaurant and the Concierge were fantastic. However, we did have numerous issues regarding our actual reservation. It seems it may have been caused through miscommunication between central reservations and the hotel. I would recommend if you have any special requests, to re-confirm with the hotel direct, exactly what you need. The most frustrating thing about this was, you would speak to one person who was on the ball and very helpful and great service, but then you would speak to another employee and they were so unhelpful, seemed totally clueless about their job and had no customer service skills. In saying this, management was very encouraging to receive feedback and to turn the situation around. We ate in the Restaurant for both breakfast and lunch during our stay. The breakfast was reasonable, not the best hotel buffet I have ever eaten but there was still a good range of foods to select from. Breakfast was included in our rate, so was very easy to just get up and go to the lobby to eat. If we were to be paying extra for the breakfast in addition to the room rate, we most probably would not have eaten there every morning as Cockle Bay wharf is only a short walk from the hotel and there is plenty of cafes to eat at for often less money. The lunch buffet is mostly Seafood which those in my party who love Seafood, were very happy about! For someone who does not eat seafood like myself, there was not a very extensive amount of meals to choose from the buffet as a lot of the hot dishes still contained fish and/or seafood. If you are not going to be eating Seafood, then again, you may be better off going elsewhere for better value for money. Alternatively, they do have an a la carte menu.
