The service at both meal times was outstanding, even when the restaurant was busy. All in all, if you are looking for somewhere in Sydney that has a good location, comfortable room and value for money rate, then Four Points is a good choice. A stay at this hotel is made even better, if you are lucky to deal with employees who are able to provide excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to darling harbour and city”
Reviews.Author: ashida_alain
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this hotel. It is way below the standard of the Sheraton on the park which we stayed last year, though of comparable price. Rooms are rather small. Breakfast selection is ok. Fitness centre is good. Parking is available across the street but not so convenient as a parking directly linked to the hotel. Good side is easy walking access to darling harbour and the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but flawed service”
Reviews.Author: basename164_friends
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Location is great. Just a short walk from Darling Habour with lots of eateries. Rooms are OK but bathroom was tired - perhaps cheaper cityside room? Checked in by a rather surley receptionist. Efficient but not once did she smile. Extremely economical with her words. Bed was too soft for me and I had backache all night. Outrageous phone charges. Averaged A$8 per minute for calls to Tasmania from Sydney. My phone bill for 10mins of calls came to A$80.Shan't be doing that again in a hurry!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money, Great View!”
Reviews.Author: angielmo
Reviews.Content: Great location, very accessible to the shopping district and near the Darling Harbour. Good function facilities and excellent service from the various departments. You can get a superb view of the Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable but eat elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: diva_sparkles
Reviews.Content: My partner and I and another couple stayed here on a Saturday night on a busy weekend. Our room was small but clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable! The hotel is in a fantastic location as it is only a short walk to the restaurants, cafes and clubs in Darling Harbour and not too far over to the Casino, which is where we spent most of our night. I was a little disappointed at the service we received in the morning when going to the buffet breakfast which was included with the room we had booked and was even called "king bed with breakfast". We were told we weren't on the list and rather than recommending we sort it out with reception, we were expected to pay $35 EACH right there! We went to reception and politely explained the situation to the res staff, only to be asked "well do you have proof of that?" we presented our booking confirmation and stood there in a VERY awkward silence for 5 minutes while she tapped and clicked away at the computer. No engagement or explanation - she could have been on Facebook for all we knew! Finally a "you're on the list now" and we went in - only to find the food was fairly average and it was so busy. Our check out however was much more pleasant - this res staff was lovely and efficient. I would stay again and would recommend this hotel but don't get the breakfast included - save the money and find somewhere on the harbour which surely would offer a fantastic meal for less than $35!

Reviews.Title: “Tenth anniversary at 4 points”
Reviews.Author: DamayantiM
Reviews.Content: Had a good time when I visited Sydney with spouse and child. The rooms are good, though a li'l smaller than we are accustomed. service is good. Location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel average restaurant”
Reviews.Author: trickydirky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights recently with my 2 kids and found the accommodation excellent. The views (darling harbour side) are excellent by day and especially by night. The room is clean, the beds very comfartable. The bathroom on the small side but adequate; Only gripe is high cost of wireless internet. Staff is very helpful. The restaurant is OK but the buffet is expensive (aud 80 pp) and obviously understaffed. This is not th e1st time I have noticed this. Food quality is OK, The restaurant is a little too cold. (also not the 1st time this was noticed. Overall a pleasant exeprience, but room for improvment, particulalry as the corn exchange restaurant is concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Good base in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SKirby64
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as our first port of call in Sydney. We arrived at about 8.30am due to our flight arriving very early. Luckily, a room was ready right away. The location is this hotels great advantage. It is situated right on Darling Harbour but on the City Centre side. This means that the Darling Harbour shops and restaurants are close by 5 minute walk and the city centre is less than five minutes in the other direction. The room was spacious and modestly decorated. The furniture did seem a little dated but was in good condition. We also had an old CRT television, however we later found out that this is only on the 2nd floor and that every other floor has larger flat screens. We also found out that all the mattresses are new and we certainly did sleep well on them. They are on the firm side FYI. We did find the air-conditioning to be relatively effective and this is a good thing as they do not have windows that open up. The bathroom was large enough and had a shower/tub with a shower curtainï�Œ. Is it just me who hates shower curtains? The amenities provided were sufficient however no shower gel is provided, just the other standard ones. Food wise, we would recommend eating in the Dundee Arms, which is a heritage building owned by the hotel. We found the service and food in here to be excellent. The menu they had when we went was all items for $10. This was especially good considering the same items were on the in-room dining menu for $20. Otherwise we found the main restaurant, The Corn Exchange to be quite expensive and there were better restaurants located in the Darling Harbour area just a short walk away. We really enjoyed our stay here and found all of the staff to be very helpful and friendly. The concierge team were especially helpful and were excellent at what they did. A nice touch was a copy of a local magazine on what to do which was brought up with the bags. If you are expecting a luxurious room to relax in then this is not the place for you, however, if you are looking for a good, clean well staffed hotel with comfortable rooms. Look no further...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful harbour view, great location but not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: CanadianJayne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights and were rather disappointed. For a Sheraton hotel the room wasn't great and was super small. It had the usual comfy bed, which was just what we needed after traveling for 20+ hours, but that is all the room had going for it, other than the view of course. For the money I would stay else where. There were other hotels with similar location.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: C_los_10
Reviews.Content: Not one negative thing to report. My partner & I stayed for 3 nights and 4 days on the 8th floor. Walked in and was greeted strait away. Reception was very pleasant & my partner and I were given a free room upgrade from a city view to harbour view. I wasnâ€™t expecting much with the room and was so surprised, the room was lovely! Oh what a stunning view! All room facilities are great and all in working order. I was having trouble with the safe, called reception to advise, maintenance man was there within 10min. Features were great - tea, coffee etc, bathroom freebeeâ€™s replaced daily, plasma TV, extremely comfy bed & pillows, desk, internet access (paid), lovely bathroom I could go on! Its in a great location walking distance to everything. Enjoyed our stay so much and upon leaving the concierge printed out our boarding passes for free. I highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, LOVE this hotel”
Reviews.Author: princesscr
Reviews.Content: Finding outstanding service like we found at the Sheraton Darling Harbour is rare. This was an amazing visit because of the great service we received from the front desk staff, the spa staff, and the concierge. The room was extremely comfortable and made our special (birthday) occasion even better. Easy accessibility to transportation (train, ferry, bus). Excellent location. This hotel is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Rennie74
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night to celebrate our birthdays.I booked a maritime studio but we were upgraded to a darling harbor suite on check in which was lovely by a very friendly reception lady Mabel.I must say it was little pricey compared to the our previous memorable stay at the HIlton,Sydney.The rooms are a little dated but i guess the you pay for the beautiful view.Breakfast was ok and included in our $375 as was parking but if you are wanting an extravagant breakfast this is just ok. breakfast was extremely busy and the kitchen staff couldn't get out food out quick enough.Overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL AND PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: marg29
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Four Points the location was ideal and we purchased a myferry ticket which gave us unlimited use of ferries, bus and trains for a week, this was invaluable as we travelled extensively on the ferries and a good service was available from Darling Harbour. I had read in a previous review that there is stair access from the hotel to the harbour side this is located just behind the DUNDEE PUB at the front of the hotel and is not very well signed but it is brilliant quick access. The Dundee pub had great meals for AUD10.00 per person which were cooked in the hotels main kitchens and therefore really high standard. We enjoyed meal deals at the Cargo restaurant, steak AUD 10.00 on special offer and rack of ribs. Breakfast was great at the restaurants along the quay. The hotel is clean, convenient and although it is huge we never felt `lost` in it there are some great shops on the lower level, we had access to our room from 9 am which was invaluable to us after a long flight, we also stayed at another hotel near to central station to give us another feel to the city, in hindsight we wish we had stayed the full 6 nights at Four Points due to its great location. Bed really comfortable, room not plush but more than adequate for short time spend in them. Great base for sightseeing. Loved the Opera house tour and took advantage of half price tickets if booked on day of tour, Opera House tour was AUD28 (using coupon from Sydney guide) concert in main theatre was AUD50 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and value”
Reviews.Author: Pollyannablissful
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was fantastic. Close to Darling Harbour and all the restaurants and night life Darling Harbour has to offer. It's an easy walk to Pitt Street Mall and all the shopping. Staff were fantastic and friendly, rooms nice and clean and it was also easy to sleep in as it was quiet. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mich10Australia
Reviews.Content: Just returned from few days stay. Great location close too many attractions all within walking distance. The rooms were really clean and spacious. The bathroom probably could do with an update. Lovely views from balcony. The front desk staff were really friendly & helpful as was the concierge. Special mention to the Doorman/Porter "Tony". He was always smiling and happy to give directions etc. On check out we found our car had a flat battery. Tony sorted this problem for us straight away and nothing was too much trouble for him. Thanks Tony. The only negative was breakfast. Food was only OK . Also the staff weren't clearing dirty plates etc from your table. We had to ask a waiter to clear our dirty dishes and he just glared at us and only took a couple plates leaving more plates, glasses & coffee cups. Nothing else was cleared from our table while we were there. The attitude of this staff member was really disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Rather plain rooms”
Reviews.Author: MarkGD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the rocks, away from the CBD area though that may suit some. The service is okay without being great. The rooms however are rather ugly. They are a grey/white colour with old fittings and the bathroom is poorly designed and equipped. Everything is rather dull and drab, and I feel that the place needs to be totally renovated. I find it a bit depressing. The behaviour of a few other guests was also a pain as one kept banging the door, walking in and out of two rooms. After being asked to stop, in the end I shoved my fist in his face. The hotel staff did try to help but the guuest continued after they left. Not a happy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a view”
Reviews.Author: marilena999
Reviews.Content: A nice spacious room and reasonable bathroom with a great harbour view. The breakfast was a highlight with very sophisticated choices, (although the fruit was as hard as rocks. Nothing is perfect!). The staff were welcoming and polite in every way. I was very annoyed that a $50 deposit per night was added to my bill without me being advised of this and I am still trying to get my deposit put back into my credit card account more than TEN days later.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tonyleee
Reviews.Content: very happy with hotel location, room is clean and tidy, concierge is lovely and book us great blue mountain day tours

Reviews.Title: “Great local, Great staff. Stayed twice.”
Reviews.Author: zocko
Reviews.Content: Were supposed to take a cruise from Sydney and then return and stay at the 4 points after for a few days. Things got messed up and we missed the ship and had to make a last minute booking at the 4 points while we figured out how to catch up with the ship. I have to say that I spent hours at the concierge desk making arrangements to fly from SYD to Cairns, book a hotel there and catch the ship while in port. They were great and helped me beyond expectations. I think I tipped everybody in the lobby. The hotel is hugh and weaves around some historic buildings. Big lobby. two free internet stations that don't work very well. We were there for Easter weekend and let it be known that Easter is a BIG holiday in Aust. Things were closed from friday through monday for 4 days or more. That made making arrangements tough. The big holiday also brought along a premium charge at restaurants of 15% on food and drinks. From the hotel there is a footbridge that goes straight to darling harbour which we used a few times. We had breakfast buffet included in room which was $30 otherwise. On our after cruise stay we didn't have breakfast included so we went to the little coffee shop on the same street and saved about half. Also tried Tony Roma's which is also on the same block. Great ribs. We walked down Market street to Victoria Center which is a great arcade to see. Visited the casino, toured the maritime museum. Got rained on. Took the hop on hop off cruise. went to the "Rocks" took a speedboat ride. didn't get on the monorail. Had fun blowing up hair dryers and flat irons and converters. Spent a lot of money at Myers replacing things that we blew up. Made the end of the cruise, came back after for a few more days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location”
Reviews.Author: arose4lee
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Excellant location, right on Darling Harbour and very close to George & Pitt Street. Clean rooms, comfortable beds. I think we'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kittywills
Reviews.Content: stayed at this super hotel for four days during Sydney visit. clean lovely hotel. excellent location overlooking the harbour. Did not eat in hotel too many restraunts to try in sydney. Breakfast in one of the cafes overlooking harbour fantastic. First time in sydney would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “expected much more”
Reviews.Author: Chezpupa
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very tired and bathrooms are small and weathered; mouldy and outdated. Staff were stiff and not obliging. Location is very good and handy to the city. very poor internet access so poor in fact that we needed to move to another hotel because it was so poor and expensive. Overall we felt that there was no WOW factor or anything keeping us there for too long when there seemed to be so many other nicer hotels in Sydney. Brekfast also was very average.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lisa23Uk
Reviews.Content: This was so much better than i expected from reading other reviews. We had a 12th floor room overlooking the Harbour, what a view. Our room was really smart and comfortable, a great choice for breakfast , ideally located. We couldn't have asked for more and will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent central position”
Reviews.Author: DavidRowena Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights on our first visit to Sydney and found that we could walk to all the main tourist spots (Bridge, Opera House, shops, Circular Quay etc.). We had a high room with a balcony facing the harbour, lovely view, comfortable bed and room. Restaurants and cafes (and shops) within easy walk on the harbour side. No traffic noise, despite elevated road outside the hotel. Breakfast was excellent, plenty of everything, but may be expensive if not part of the package. Staff were very helpful and courteous. We would stay here again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chadnetman62
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated across from the bustling Darling Harbour with all the restaurants and bars you can imagine, a very busy hotel which cater for business people with many conferences on-going which can sometimes be a little daunting with the amount of people the hotel accommodates. an hidden gem is the small "pub" the Dundee Arms at the side of the hotel, excellent food and drink at reasonable price. overall a good central hotel in a good position. Rooms nice and clean with good services.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SydneyGlobalShopper
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at the Four Points by Sheraton Darling Harbour. Whilst the location of the hotel was great for us as we were attending a concert at the Entertainment Centre the hotel itself was a big disappointment. It is really in need of a revamp, the decor is dated and our room (twin) had 2 single beds which were not that comfortable and moved around all night. The airconditioning was very loud, making it difficult for my travelling companion to sleep and unfortunately our Deluxe Harbour View room over looked the main freeway leading onto the Harbour Bridge - lots of traffic noise. As our room was not ready when we checked in we were offered complimentary coffee & pie (which appeared to be one of those mini frozen pies that had been heated in the microwave - terrible) - we couldn't eat it. When we returned to reception we were told that our room was still not ready due to problems with the airconditioning unit! Finally, after another 30 mins we were given our room key - the receptionist said that she would send a complimentary bottle of wine to our room for our inconvenience - this never turned up!! Neither did our "complimentary" newspaper the next morning. Breakfast was also disappointing - a real dogs breakfast including cut up pieces of victoria sponge cake!! Very unusual breakfast fare. Pastries were stale and tasteless and the has browns were potato gems!!! Being a frequent global traveller I expected more from a Sheraton property - all in all, quite disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel in a great spot with friendly staff and very comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: deejay100
Reviews.Content: My family and stayed at Four Points on a 3 day trip to Sydney. Loved it! Great location, very friendly and efficient staff and nice comfy beds. The Pub attached to the hotels did $10 meals all day every day when we were there and the food was great value, simple but tasty. It was all so easy and comfy - would not hesitate to stay again. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Harborside hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Trevorbord
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Sheraton Four Points Darling Harbour for a five night stay with my wife over Spring Break 2009. The facility is a very nice hotel which overlooks the main waterway in Sydney Australia. The hotel is a modern facility located in the heart of Sydneyâ€™s Hustle and Bustle. The Rooms are nice in size, the staff is very nice. The restaurants are very pricey, but there are enough eateries in the local vicinity that you will not encounter a problem with the price of a meal. There is a â€œprivateâ€� bridge to Darling Harbor which takes less than two minutes to reach. From the harbour you can get anywhere in the metro area, from The Sydney Zoo to the Olympic Grounds, all accessible via various ferry services. There is a lot to do in close proximity to the hotel, The Sydney Aquarium and Wildlife World are located in the harbour and the monorail has a station in the harbour as well. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from the harbour complex as well as a couple of nightclubs. The Chinese Gardens and the Queen Victoria Markets and the sky tower are all short walks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sinoturkey
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel with friendly services and great location. Walk to Darling Harbor anf the Circular Quay whiere the Opera house is is only a $9 taxi ride. Hotel internet was expensive but there are internet bars close by.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not good for business travellers...”
Reviews.Author: mnmmaf
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney on average once a month to Sydney and have stayed in a number of hotels around the city. As the hotel that I normally stay in was fully booked I decided to stay at the 4-Point., big mistake! When I checked in (4 night stay) the hotel couldn't honor my double room booking and there was no internet access in the room. They were able to move me on my second night to a room with internet access but still a single bed. The wrong room and internet was dissapointing and inconvenient however what really annoyed me was what happened on my last night. On the night before checking out because I was going to be taking a long haul flight in the afternoon but had meetings in the morning. I wanted a late check out so that I could come back to the hotel change out of my suit and go to the airport. When I made this request to the hotel because I needed a 2hr extension they informed me that I needed to pay an extra 15AUD. Now 15 dollars isn't a lot but its the principle of it, I've never been asked to pay a late check out fee before at other hotels and certainly not for an extra hour. The 4-point isn't a bad hotel but there are a lot of other hotels in good locations and who know how to look after their business travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Musrag
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights for work in January. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The foyer and entrance were great as with most hotels. Room was a bit dated and very dimly lit. Overpriced mini bar and room service. Ate at the hotel only once the entire week as there are many places to go in proximity - food was ok but what I payed was a bit ridiculous. Bathroom is old and TV is very old style and half the buttons on the remote did not work. Could only scroll up not down which is a big pain. Overall I will stay here again due to location to office in Sydney but will have a look at some others located around for comparison. I did use the gym and this was good and a great view. Use late at night when no one else is there as other wise too many people watching the big screen tvs (Not on individual machines) on different channels as remotes are first in. Becomes quite loud and annoying. Great location to Darling Harbour. Not far away from Chinatown and the Mall etc. You do have to walk but that is what you do in the big city and it was very safe. Not close to Opera House or the Rocks if that is what you are after but also not a huge walk away either. Better to stay here and have something to do each night then stay over there where it quietens down at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jamesthefirst
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel for one night and all in all it was fine. Just as I would expect from a Sheraton Hotel. The location is great for darling Harbour and a short walk to a restaurant called Nicks. The seafood platter is amazing. Whilst you have Darling harbour on one side you also have China Town on the other side. If you are looking for a city centre hotel you will not go far wrong with this.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: London_Ontario_Kevin
Reviews.Content: The four Points Sheraton above all else had a great location. It was walking distance to most major Sydney attractions, including the Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Botanical Gardens, and the Maritime Museum. The hotel was clean and modern, and our room offered nice views of Darling Harbour. Our room came equipped with a queen size bed, and mini bar (which we used to hold our own beverages). We did not eat at the hotel, as there were many, many nearby restaurants offering a variety of different options at lower cost. My only real complaints about the hotel were the lack of a pool of any sort, and the very high cost of internet access. We went next door to the coffee shop, and enjoyed free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Kylie_Renz
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel four times as we are Starwood Gold members. We always stay in the harbor view suite with balcony as it is large with seperate living and bedroom area-we just find other rooms too small. Bad points: No valet parking (and it still costs $30+ to park your own car for 24hrs and have to walk 5min to get back to your room if you park up top), no pool or spa, bathrooms need to be updated. Good points: Suite room is big with excellent view if your up high, good concierge and doorman, close to everything. I guess the price you do pay for the suite room their is definatley better in Sydney for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel overlooking Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Passportholder
Reviews.Content: We arrived late evening after our flight from the UK. The reception staff were welcoming and helpful. Cases were taken to the room which overloked Darling Harbour. The room was clean and air conditioned with all the accessories you would expect to find and the bed was very comfortable. Our deal included breakfast which was excellent. It was a help yourself buffet style with a wide variety fruit, cereals, & cooked foods of very good quality. The staff gave a very good service taking finished plates/dishes away & replenishing tea & coffee. We did not use the restaurant for lunch or evening meals. The hotel provides a free internet service for guests with two terminals adjacent to the reception desk. Our room was cleaned daily to a high standard. The concierge team were helpful & knowledgable. The hotel is ideally located for Darling Harbour and the shopping areas. The restaurant & bars around Darling Harbour are quite expensive however a ten minute walk will take you to Chinatown were you can get much cheaper food in the numerous food courts. We would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel or recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: momotarokawaii
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in nice location but a bit far to walk to the Rocks area. The room was small and dark compared with other hotels in same price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: Baghag
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean and centrally located. The closest train stop is Town Hall inside the Queen Victoria Building (QVB), and it's only 2 stops from Circular Quay (which is the stop for the ferries, the bridge and the Sydney Opera House). Chinatown is a short walk away. The aquarium is right across the overpass. We used our Amex SPG points to book a city view room, which faced the ING building. Personally, I don't think the upgrade to a Harbour View room would be worth the extra points or money. Overall, a good pick for Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: gsuzuki
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Points back in February and we had a great time. The hotel is located within walking distance to Darling Harbor, the monorail station, and the ferries. The room we had was very nice, the view we had overlooked Darling Harbor. Even though part of the freeway/highway is located right next to the hotel, we did not hear any of the noise. I found the room to be a typical hotel room, nothing that really stood out. The staff was very helpful and even though our flight from San Francisico arrived in the morning, our room was ready. I do wish that the hotel had washing machines to wash your own laundry. I understand that most hotels have a laundry service, but for families looking for an inexpensive place to wash your clothes, it would have been nice to have this option. One advice I would give is if you want fresh seafood at a very reasonable price, go to the Sydney Fish Market. We took a background tour of the auction that takes place, but within the fish market grounds are some eating places and I found it to be excellent. If you are looking for a white table cloth service, you will not find this here, but the seafood was very fresh and inexpensive. For a dozen oysters, we paid almost 50% less at the fish market. Unfortunately the fish market does not open during dinner hours, but it is open for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great loacation though a bit aged”
Reviews.Author: JJLehto
Reviews.Content: This is a 4 star-rated hotel in Sydney. Its location is absolutely wonderful: in front of Darling Harbour (which means lots of delicious restaurants for every taste, bars, amazing walk along the turistic harbour, wonderful city landscape), next to a mono-rail station, 5 minutes walk from ferries quay, 5 minutes walk from city center and 10 minutes walk from sydney opera house. Elegant hall, helpful and kind receptionists ready to assist you whatever you might need, very nice breakfast and dinner lounge, with an absolutely tasty breakfast buffet (a bit expensive for european standards, but believe me, it's worth it, especialli if you plan to spend the day visiting the city and thus having a light snack at lunch). Rooms are quite disappointing, mine was a double, not very spacious, old moquette on the floor, old furnished. Bathroom had broken tiles, and an old-style bathtub with a plastic tent. Toiletries are nice and of good quality but there was no bathfoam or shower gel, so i had to buy it. If you're looking for great location this is the place for you, but if you love to stay in a modern room, that doesn't make you think of some 3-stars hotel in madrid or london, then you might prefer some other place.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location in Sydney for Families”
Reviews.Author: Pb650
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Four Points Darling Harbor. Traveling with two small children, we booked a Darling Harbor view suite. The suite was large, well cared for, and very very comfortable. Both the bedroom and the living room had expansive glass looking over Darling Harbor, which we just stared at for what seemed hours as there is just so much to see. The AC system responded rapidly, and was very quiet. Memo to families: At booking, we asked if there was a fold-out couch in the room for our two children, at which time we were told there was. Issue One: Fortunately we have skinny children, because the couch was a love seat which folded into a single bed. Issue Two: The hotel wanted to charge us $45 AUS just to fold out the couch - we made it clear that we were not informed of that policy at booking, and they graciously relented. My goodness, we were already paying $300+ a night for the suite after all. Bath was very clean with plenty of hot water, and we used the free in-room safe extensively. The few issues we had with the room were immediately rectified, and always with a smile. We did not eat in the hotel, as there are so many options within a 5 minute walk in the harbor itself. Also, I have to plug the doorman Tony, who was a great help at all times. The location is perfect. The Sydney Aquarium and Wildlife World are literally outside the back door of the hotel. We LOVED The aquarium, and went there on two separate occasions. WIldlife World was also a superb attraction, and very educational for all of us. Within a ten minute stroll to the south end of Darling Harbor is a very large outdoor playground which gave the wee ones a chance to un-steam. Restaurants in all price ranges abounded. Given the quality of the room, location, staff responsiveness, access to the ferry system, and the wide variety of attractions for parents and children, this hotel is a home run, and we would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Should not be a Sheraton - terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: 100daysperyear
Reviews.Content: This must be one of the worst 4 star hotels in Sydney. The rooms a anchient and dirty, the place has no ambience at all and the staff does not care about the guests. When I arrived my bathroom was dirty, including hair in the shower and the bedside lamps were broken. When I gave feedback to the front desk (written and verbal) nobody seemed to care and I never got feedback after my trip. This is especially disapointing since I am a platinum member with Starwood. I cut my stay short after spending one night. I had to get out of the place. The hotel has not seen a renovation since it opened it seems (this must be arround 15 years ago). The other guest were mainly groups. There are so much better hotels in Sydney - don't stay at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeverleyShillito
Reviews.Content: Cannot say anything good about this hotel. Our room was smelly and some of the common parts were dirty. Would not recomment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: donsyb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights using Starpoints. We were on an SPG preferred floor with City (i.e. no) view. The location of this hotel is great, right on Darling Harbour, but the room was showing it's age - bathroom in need of refurb, furniture looking tired etc. For a preferred guest room I've seen better. Don't know if we got an older room because it was a points redemption? Room was also a little small. Internet was not free, as at other Four Points I have stayed in. Staff were great, always offering to help. When we were leaving asked the doorman for a taxi and he supplied a stretch limo for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “Wowzers!”
Reviews.Author: Katlesh
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel as expected from the Sheraton Group. The location is fantastic with Darling Harbour and all the excellent restaurants...and for the main shopping and CBD area of Sydney. I booked a standard room but somehow ended up in what I think is a suite...unless all the rooms have their own separate sitting room area!!! I certainly didn't intentionally book a room so big but was very happy! The quality of room could spoil me for all future business travel....... very happy customer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , Great Room”
Reviews.Author: FunkyIngy
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise we got when we arrived at the Four Points Sheraton. Great room we were there as our work Christmas party was in darling harbour this hotel is the perfect location. got a great rate for 2 nights. Close to shopping , chinatown ,darling harbour, king street wharf , aquarium , casino. Just great! We highly recommend the corn exchange seafood buffet! Service is great, the staff are wonderful and friendly and anticipate your every need.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, frond desk service could be better”
Reviews.Author: PankajD
Reviews.Content: When we reached at 5pm, the room was still not ready - unbelievable! I had booked two rooms with my points. The rooms were city facing and clean. Absolutely great location for Darling Harbor - the hotel itself has a bridge connecting to the shopping and restaurants at the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rooms a bit tiered”
Reviews.Author: nottsinternational
Reviews.Content: Great location especially if attending a conference at the Sydney Convention Centre and also only a short walk from the city centre. Harbour cruise stop is just across the road so only 5 mins away from the hotel. I found the rooms a bit dated though and rather tiered looking. Excellent customer service at the check-in and also the concierge service but despite that I don't think Iâ€™d chose to stay here again m - not until it gets an update.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Almeidafe
Reviews.Content: Well located, friendly people in a modern and comfortable environment

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: TCTroubador
Reviews.Content: I was little concerned by the favorable and non-favorable reviews for this hotel on Trip Advisor so I only stayed there one night vs. three nights at the Westin Sydney. If I had it to do over again, I would stay here all four nights. Everything was well-maintained and our room looked out on the boats and people coming and going on Darling Harbor. The staff were very helpful and they provide free wi-fi in the lobby to check email. The hotel tastefully incorporates some small older buildings on the street including an art gallery that I wish I had had time to visit. Best of all, Sheraton has also taken over a small pub where they offer $10 lunches and specials on wine and beer. One note of caution: the hotel is not easy to get to by public transportation. From Central station we took the tram and thought we coudl transfer to the monorail, but that's another company. We decided not to pay to go one or two stops, and so we walked, Not terrible, but a little hike and up and down some stairs. To return to the airport we walked to a station near the Victoria building (I forget the stop's name) where we caught the Airport train. A walk of several blocks from the hotel, but easily doable.

Reviews.Title: “Four Point by Sheraton Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: tmfawzy
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, close to the CBD and NYE events, good service and a great view of Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend break location”
Reviews.Author: S_G.UK
Reviews.Content: Though there are many other hotels in the area to choose from, this hotel was great value for money, as they had a buy 2 nights get third free offer on. I also got upgraded to a better room when I arrived, so I think I got good value for money. However, if I had paid full price for this I think I would have been a bit disappointed. It is not particularly shabby or old fashioned, nor is it recently refurbished, modern, etc. This is simply a perfectly good standard, comfortable hotel to use as a base for any holiday or city break in Sydney or a business trip. It's perfectly located for shopping, for wandering the city from Darling Harbour round to the Quay and then round further to the Botanic Gardens. It also has pretty nice views of Darling Harbour from your room (well, mine anyway). It is not the place to stay if you intend to spend a lot of time in your hotel, for romance, or chilling out. They also, like many big hotel chains, continue to charge not-inconsiderable sums for internet access in the rooms. I HATE this. Whether business or leisure, I have been ripped off one too many times and have now vowed never to book another hotel that doesn't offer free wifi. As an aside, the front desk were VERY slow. They never seemed to have enough staff on. I travel extensively and I've never been kept waiting this long at reception - particularly annoying when you only want to get a new key or something. Or it's late at night and you just want to get to bed! Concierge was always well staffed and very helpful though. I also like that they have a good convenience store on their doorstep - two actually - so you get to stock up on basics for your room instead of paying mini-bar prices (tho to be fair, I never looked at this hotel's minibar prices, so dont know if they were reasonable or not).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: chirpytravels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an good location, but the front desk service is rather brash and disappointing. Despite being entitled to a complimentary SPG upgrade, none was given - the excuse given was that the hotel was supposedly fully booked, which was hard to believe given that rooms were available online at a reasonable price. After that we were given a room on one of the lowest floors facing the road. The SPG number was not recorded on the reservation, despite the reservation being made on Starwood site. I had to subsequently claim the missing points. I'm still waiting (6 weeks later) to be credited a "free nights" award, from the current Mastercard promotion. Every other hotel I've stayed in managed to have the nights credited within a couple of days of the stay. So far neither Starwood nor Four Points Sydney have been able to fix this, despite telling me that this is some kind of a glitch in their posting system. Wifi is charged at exorbitant rates. This is completely unacceptable. There are a couple of free internet computers in the lobby, which were constantly occupied, even at midnight. It seems absurd to provide free computers for guests, but at the same time to charge obscene rates for guests to use their own computer. This is 2009 and this is supposedly a business hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at Darling Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Fabian53
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Four Points Sheraton in Darling Harbor in Sydney, Australia. I had done alot of research and wanted something that was close to alot of the attractions that we wanted to see. We only had two days before our cruise was to leave from Sydney for New Zealand so wanted to make the best of the time we had. After alot of research on the internet we had decided to stay at the Four Poiints Sheraton. It was right across the street from the Sydney Aquarium and the Sydney Wildlife World. We arrived at the hotel around 9:00 am and were immediately upgraded to a harbor view and were allowed to check in early, leave our luggage and set off for our touring of Sydney. The price of our room included a fantastic buffet breakfast each morning for my husband and myself and it was well worth the cost which was very reasonable. It was a great assortment of hot and cold entrees, much like a cruise ship and offering some things even more. We were seated immediately after we told them our room number. The personnel were a great help with directions and telling us the best things to see as our time was short. They arranged for our luggage, arranged for the taxi to the port and everyone was very helpful. If we ever go back to Sydney I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The hotel is very convenient to Darling Harbor and within 15 minutes walk to Circular Quay where you get all the ferries. We caught the ferry there to and fromTarongaZoo and then back to Darling Harbor. It was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “For a 4 star hotel it's quite good - great location”
Reviews.Author: Clea700
Reviews.Content: This is a 4 star Sheraton so those expecting 5 star quality and amenities will be disappointed. The location of this hotel is fantastic, right amongst all the Darling Harbour restaurants for dinner and a short walk into the city centre. The room I had was fine, it was clean, quiet and the bed was comfortable. The reception staff were friendly and nice and smiled and asked how my stay was upon check out. The buffet breakfast was good but I have had better and it was hard to get the attention of a staff member a couple of times. Overall it was good and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff-great central location.”
Reviews.Author: thesprouts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for 6 nights using frequent flyer points in a city side king room. The room we were given was on the seventh floor and was on a corner so we only had one direct neighbour. The room itself was on the small side with the huge king size bed taking up much of it but there was enough room for a desk and armchair to one side. The bathroom was average in size. Both had been refurbished at some point and were well appointed. The bed was enormous and very comfortable. There were two pillows-one firm and one soft. There was a fridge/minibar and everything you'd expect-ironing board, iron, hairdrier etc. All in all the room was very comfortable. It was also extremely quiet-we barely heard anyone at all once in the room. Cable TV was free. Our friends stayed for one night and were upgraded to the city side suite which was very spacious and twice the size of our room. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful and went out of their way to help us. The commissionaire Tony was a really nice guy -nothing was too much trouble. He deserves a gold star if anyone at the hotel is reading this! The hotel arranged a hire car for us which was delivered to the hotel and waiting for us at 9 am for a drive to the Blue mountains and was then also picked up from the hotel. The guys out front did an excellent job at searching out taxis to get to restaurants for us and the longest we waited was 5 minutes in peak hour traffic. The location was fantastic-turn right out of the hotel walk around the corner down some steps and there you at right in Darling Harbour with loads of restaurants and ferries right in front of you. My best tip for Sydney having lived there for 6 months and having visited a couple of time since is buy the public transport day tripper pass and flog it to death-$17 /adult buys you unlimited buses trains and ferries for the day. Walk to Town Hall station buy the ticket, catch a train to Circular Quay, get a ferry to Watsons Bay, walk up to the Gap for a walk along the cliff and great views back to the city, catch a bus to Bondi, have lunch at Icebergs Club (not expensive restaurant above), bus back to town and if you have the energy over to Manly and back-bargain! Back to the hotel-we had a great time and would definately return there, even if we had to pay!!!! We have stayed in plenty of far worse 4 and 5 * hotels and not many better....

Reviews.Title: “What a view - Not!”
Reviews.Author: Essex-BJL
Reviews.Content: Booked this via expedia. Paid in advance in may for a bay view room. Despite this hotel reservation being pre-paid for when we arrived to check in they tried to give us a room without a bay view. I queried this since we had paid extra in advance for a bay view. 10-20 minutes later they said we had a room with a bay view . This room was in fact on floor 1 which meant our bay view was actually the back of the aquarium and the coach car park. It was technically a bay view room but not as adverised., see our photos. Pub attached to hotel was nice but closed on Sundays ( we were there sat eve to/tue morning) bar food was a very restricted "room service" menu. Bar staff v nice but pub empty when we used it so no atmosphere. Hotel wi-fi/internet access was a whopping Â£6.00 per hour or Â£12.00 per day. Reception staff V surley but rest of staff very nice.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: rxpriti
Reviews.Content: Location was great...close to city center (shopping), close to free bus system in sydney, located in Darling harbor (aquarium, restaurants, ferry). The hotel staff was excellent! They helped us out. We arrived to the hotel at 8am (they let us use hotel facilites to shower & get ready) and by the time we came back from breakfast, our bags were already in our room by 10am! They also gave us late check-out of 12 pm the next day. They set up airport shuttle for us. We were impressed with all the assistance, b/c they do not work for tips... The room was great...restful bed, clean granite bathroom! We would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: hayleyrBeijing
Reviews.Content: we have just got back from sydney as part of our honeymoon and the only fault I have was we didnt have a double bed and we backed onto a street. The hotel is in a great location, the rooms are cleaned daily - it is not in perfect condition but it is pretty good value for money. One other problem is @ the weekend it can be quite noisy as there is some sort of rave club up the road, but during the week it was fine. free internet access in the lobby which was very useful. Breakfast $15 each!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was in a good location but the rooms needed updating”
Reviews.Author: flyingcloggie
Reviews.Content: Great location however rooms were a bit dreary we stayed a week the Manager was very helpful and gave us a harbour view

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LizzyKav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our Honeymoon for four nights. Great Hotel. The staff were really helpful, breakfast was great and the location is brilliant. Loads to see and do at Darling Harbour and all within a 5 minute walk. Rooms were fab and the bed so comfy. The only downside was the cost of the internet access - $27.50 per day.

Reviews.Title: “OK but could be better”
Reviews.Author: katgriffey
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the Sheraton and the Darling Harbor/Cookle Bay location is great. You can get everywhere from here. However there are some issues - Had a twin bed room woth a decent view. The room itself was a disappointment - mold in the shower/tub; slow running sink drain; loud plumbing when next door took theor showers. The place needs a serioua face lift on floor two where I stayed. The rub was well worn. There was no internet connection on floors lower than 3. They have free internet in the lobby but it is always crowded and no time limits exist. I booked with Expedia - it wasn't cheap and supposed to be a 4 star. I give it a 3 based upon location plus or it would be lower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location that was reasonably priced!”
Reviews.Author: LilPiggyQT
Reviews.Content: My spousey and I stayed at this hotel for one night on a Sunday night. We had flown in from Melbourne and arrived quite early to the airport. We decided to take the train/subway from the Sydney Airport to the Wynyard station. We actually walked from the train station to the hotel and it is actually not bad of a walk - about a 10-15 minute walk. We arrived at the hotel at about 9:30am but we were told our rooms would be ready at 11am which was still excellent for us because it was earlier than I expected. There is an outside pathway that leads straight smack into the back on the hotel and pops you right out at the Sydney Aquarium once you exit the hotel from the front lobby. The aquarium is actually the reason why I picked this hotel and we weren't disappointed. At the end of the pier (about a 5 minute walk to the end of the pier) right next to the Sydney Wildlife World is a ferry that costs $5.20 per person for a one-way ride to the Circular Quay - best money I have spent in a long while! It will take you over to the amusement park if you would like and we had great view of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House from the ferry as it rode towards Circular Quay. We took a taxi back to our hotel from the Opera House after dinner and it was about $12.00. When we got back to our hotel after exploring, the concierge immediately brought up our bags! Great service! Also we had called to ask about the ferry and they were very helpful in getting us information about the prices and times that the ferry was running. The room we had was a king-size bed and it was absolutely fantastic. Comfy sheets and the air conditioning worked well. The selection of their mini-bar is immense and pricey but it was nice that there was so much available. We didn't go down to the hotel bar or stay for breakfast as we only had a short period in Sydney but I am sure to stay here again. It was the best location for our needs and very nicely priced. Stay here if you don't mind exploring on ferry or by foot and if you like to have a nice hotel that isn't overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Know Why People Don't Like - Stayed 14 nights”
Reviews.Author: RogerVegas
Reviews.Content: Had two rooms for 14 nights each. Overall enjoyed the hotel. I don't understand what some peoples problems are. First off this was a trip to Sydney to see Sydney not to stay in my hotel room. If I wanted to do that I would have selected either the Westin on Martin or the Sheraton Park. That being said let me start my review. We arrived on a Monday (the day prior to the Melbourne Cup) and were allowed to check in at 10:30am and given two rooms city side (757/751). First impression of the room was that it was more the suitable for my two week stay. The bellman took our baggage upon arrival and it was delivered to the within ten minutes of me showing up! That is service. The room: Decent size, king bed, mini bar, instant coffee, tea, kettle. It was strange to me that they do not provide a top sheet, just the comforter and a bottom sheet, but no worries to me. I had enough closet and drawer space to put all my clothes. The bathroom is not large, but again, I don't live in the bathroom. They provide lemon scented shampoo, conditioner, hand soap and lotion. My room was cleaned promptly each day. I did notice the siting chair had a few marks on it, but again, I wasn't buying it. The seventh floor was quite and I never had any noise problems. The mini bar is not cheap, but you can still put a few bottles of wine to chill to take with you to dinner. The air conditioner was pretty quite and kept the room nice and cool. TV, well like any hotel, they had a few channels, local 4 or 5 stations, which is good to me. Also had several sports and news stations. Movies were available for purchase but did not take advantage of that. The bed, well it is a Starwood bed, so it was HEAVEN and found myself finding it hard to get up every morning. My room was not outdated, overly worn or anything other people claim. I don't know what they are wanting, but I was happy for my entire 14 nights. The Lobby Bar: Great service!!! The bartender remember us each nigh (even after the first night) and the prices were not bad for Sydney. Friendly bar tenders EVERY time. I will say everyone who worked remembered us. We did stop by every night before going out, but they really did remember us on the second visit. Maybe because we were American? The Corn Exchange: Breakfast - $33 per person buffet Well lets just say the buffet is not "American" but was good. Had every morning scrambled eggs, bacon (more like ham), sausage, beans, roasted tomatoes, coffee, juices (about 7), tea, yogurt, sushi, breads and the list goes on. If you went hungry you were just plain stupid. Lunch was $45 and dinner $65 but we did not try -- to many other great restraints to eat at. Concierge: Best ever. Friendly, knowledgeable and was more than willing to help you with ANYTHING you needed. Dundee Arms (PUB) Food is from the same kitchen as the buffet and room service. Had a meat pie, nachos and a burger there (no not at the same time) and all were good. Nothing to write home about, but it wasn't nasty! The bartender was great and very friendly. They do have several dinning specials and happy hour. You can sit outside and enjoy the weather or sit inside, but it is a tiny pub. Look for the grumpy portrait of a lady....Yikes... Location: Amazing. Short walk to Darling Harbour. Many dinning options there and the aquarium and several other tourist attractions. Easy to catch the ferry . There is a mini mart across the street that is lower priced than the one on property. Also an easy walk to the Rocks, Oxford and CBD. You can find so many places to eat within walking distance. Also there is a Woolies and Coles very close if you want to pick up munchies/water for the room. Internet: They charge an outrageous $12/hr $28/day for wireless BUT there is 2 free computers just off the lobby you can do what you need. I used it every day to check work e-mails, look up places to go, etc. Love it! And it was FREE. Fitness Center Nice size, good overall. Great views. Used it every other day, but with all the walking not sure if I needed to. Who knew they had so many hill like SF. I can't say enough about the staff. I even wrote a letter the manager about the staff and I NEVER do that. They made my long stay great!!. Ever employee was friendly. The hotel is not a 5 star but it is a 4 star. I just don't get these people's reviews. To say the least I was nervous about the hotel, but all was good!!! It is the larges in Sydney. The staff really did make the stay. On check-out, you have the option for US or AUS dollars and their exchange rate is not good. Go with the AUS -- my bank exchange rate was better!!! A little advice on dinning -- Tandori Palace on Oxford, WOW! You must go! Also go to the Rocks Cafe a the Rocks on George and have breakfast, the best in Sydney, went 3 times!! My stay overall was great! I would tell you to stay here! I will when I return next year!! But if you are someone who wants that spa bath, that room that is just so, the stuffiness of a upscale hotel (where when it is 100F and you want to wear shorts for a cocktail and were made to feel not wanted ... lets say the Westin Sydney) then this is NOT your hotel. If you want a clean, nice sized room, amazing location, wonderful staff and a pleasant stay then please book this hotel. Cheers!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tinuviel01
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Cityside room. Had two rooms, one was smaller than the other. There is an option of selecting connected rooms with a door in the middle of two cityside rooms. The bathroom is not impressive and there was no hot chocolate with the free tea and coffee facilities. My room had a very noisy airconditioner. Free local newspaper placed outside room door every morning. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Option to leave luggage in the hotel after checkout. Recommended airport transfer service: Airport Connect. Internet charges are massive (AUD12+ per hour). Free 24 hour gym facilities with views out to Darling Harbour. I seriously doubt that the rooms are up to standard with the Starwood Hotels Brand. Overall, great location, services and staff but in serious need of refurbishment, especially the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: MEPHX
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for travelers who like to be able to walk to a variety of activities, restaurants, and attractions. It is also very close to the monorail, Cityrail, and bus stations, as well as a Sydney Explorer bus stop. Well worth the upgrade to a Darling Harbor view room. All hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Our package included a free buffet breakfast every day which was great -- the buffet breakfast catered to American, British, and Asian tastes, with several hot dishes as well as typical buffet fare. Local telephone calls were $1 -- very reasonable. The room had a tea/coffee maker, ironing board, complementary morning paper delivered to the door, and all the amenities you'd expect of a Sheraton. We were very happy with this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont let the word "Sheraton" fool you......”
Reviews.Author: SanjaMeegin
Reviews.Content: Sheraton's reputation sure doesnt mean what it used to. This hotel is dated and dingy. We stayed here for 2 nights - the location IS Darling Harbour, but there are at least 20 other hotels to choose from with the same great location. For the price we paid $220AUD a night - you would expect a little more. The rooms are tiny and havent been renovated for quite some time. The vent in the bathroom was blocked and filthy. Disgusting. Our rooms were on the first floor - the traffic noise is so loud its almost unbearable, the walls are paper thin (so thin, that we could hear the people next door hanging their clothes on the hanger) - and very noisy hallways. Beds are old and uncomfortable. I stayed here 3 years ago and thought I would try it again in the hope that it had been "upgraded" - my mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this hotel unless all other rooms in Sydney are booked”
Reviews.Author: T_YOS
Reviews.Content: First the positives: the staff is excellent. From the Bellman to the front desk to the SPG Platinum desk manager (Rachel), the staff is very sociable, helpful and super professional. Now the negatives: as you enter the hotel lobby, you are greeted with a smell that is a mixture of old building, food, air freshner that you would not confuse for something pleasant. The rooms are small, old, carpet full of stains, utensils in the room not clean, bathroom so-so. Even the suites are not impressive for a Category 3 Starwood hotel. Look for deals at the Westin or Sheraton which are better located and are much, much better hotels (I have stayed at the Westin and have gone to the Sheraton). Net-net: skip this hotel, not on par with the Starwood brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: socram13
Reviews.Content: We just wanted a 4 day break in Sydney and my wife liked the look of this hotel as it isn't too tall and guaranteed a harbour view. Not our first time at Darling Harbour so we knew the location well. We arrived well before 3pm check in (11am on a Monday) and the room was ready - a bonus. Nice room and no complaints about the fixtures and fittings at all, with a useful desk with 4 socket extension cord. There were two bedside lamps and also a portable desktop lamp that was convenient (though it needed the base attaching securely...) Air conditioning was unobtrusive and the room quiet - except for Melbourne cup day.... The hotel is across a busy (noisy) road,but we had no traffic noise at all, but even with the good sound insulation, the thump, thump, thump and excessive so called music from Helm Bar, on the harbour, was intrusive from about 3pm to midnight. It could be heard all over Darling Harbour and we were amazed that they were allowed to get away with it, as it must have been over 100 decibels. Coffee/tea making facilties and a fridge/minibar in the room. Needless to say, we bought our drinks elsewhere. Nice bathroom with good supplies. TV channels limited (they want you to pay for movies...) Food in the hotel we thought extortionate, and there were not the numbers for the breakfast lunch and dinner buffet that generate a rapid turnover of food. $60AUD is way over the top in spite of the seafood - most of which was cold anyway. Pretty stuff, but we weren't attracted. The Corn Exchange restaurant were charging $18 for a meat pie, yet the Dundeed Arms (part of the hotel) had excellent cheap bar meals for $10! The pie was excellent and the chips would probably be the best I have eaten, but why no garnish, peas/beans on offer? Wife's spag bol was a very generous portion. Charged to the room. No cider available either, (when every other restaurant we used did serve cider) and they were proudly pushing their wide range of available beers. Across the bridge, Harbourside was the place to eat with plenty of options. Monorail day pass at $9.95 is OK and the Monorail station is only 80 metres away. We cannot understand why some of these hotels charge so much as not all guests are on company expense accounts, so when the dining room is generally under utilised, why top prices? We challenged the extortionate $12AUD an hour (yes, an hour) for WiFi internet, yet weren't aware of the two free terminals in the far reaches of the lobby until ten minutes before leaving as we didn't hadn't read read the other reviews! From our point of view, the only missing facility was a pool. Overall? Pretty good but they are after your money and obviously cater far more for wealthy corporates than casual holidaymakers.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but worn down”
Reviews.Author: elisaNorway
Reviews.Content: The Four Points by Sheraton is a large hotel and seemed to typically take in a lot of tour groups. Expect lines at checkout and checkin. Room was large and clean with harbour view and a small balcony. However walls, carpets, sofa etc showed that it was quite some time since the last renovation and this dragged down the overall impression. Internet was ridiculously expensive and they did not seem to have wireless in the room, only the good old fashioned cable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dabaasch
Reviews.Content: Great location with easy access to restaurants, shopping, water taxis and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, so so location”
Reviews.Author: cruise603
Reviews.Content: Using SPG points/cash we stayed at the 4 points for 2 nights. Location is great for ferry but quite a walk for train. Staff is very nice and helpful and let us check in at 9am. Hotel also has 2 free Internet stations for guest use, and there is a convenience store across the street. Overall, we had a very nice stay and Sydney is so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Dull lighting, small towels but great aeroplane and Harbour views”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: I found the lack of lighting in the bedroom to be unsatisfactory. This appeared to be a design fault as there was only one downlight above the doorway, another one not far into the bedroom - off centre - and a standard portable light. While I was on my own, it occurred to me that if a couple was resident, one member would be unable to read in bed if both were of a mind to do so. On my second night, the room attendant neglected to provide large bath towels. I could not be bothered calling reception, so I made do with smaller size towels. When my friends called the hotel, two had to wait up to five minutes for the call to be answered before they were put through to my room. It appears that Sheraton have a call centre in either India or the Phillippines that handles these calls which raises some privavcy issues for guests, particularly given data theft that has become a problem in India (but not so much in the more friendly Philippines). I had been upgraded to a Harbour view room. The highlight was watching up to four planes approaching Sydney Airport (Mascot) in sequence. Not quite as good as standing on the observation platform at Heathrow, UK but quite interesting nonetheless. The bed was satisfactory but the lack of lighting means that I have to mark down this hotel badly.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent View”
Reviews.Author: ScrapbytheSea
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a magic view from the Harbour side rooms. The rooms were clean but oldish, the carpet was quite worn. It looked a bit tired. The restaurant & room service was expensive but the Dundee Arms a little pub just outside the hotel was great...the meal was supplied by hotel restaurant ( some of the same meals as room service) but at $10 - 1/2 the price of room service meal. Drinks in the hotel restaurant were expensive...it is much better to go down into Darling Harbour and purchase meals and drinks there. The staff were friendly . Overall nice but impersonal large hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm...I didn't like it.”
Reviews.Author: HolidayGalDublin
Reviews.Content: This was just not a nice hotel. Technically, the lobby was grand and the rooms were OK at best..but it just wasn't nice. No.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Good value if you shop around.”
Reviews.Author: SURFER_DUDE44
Reviews.Content: First of all, check more than one travel site for the best rate for this hotel. The Four Points web site sometimes has specials that other sites don't know about. Location on Darling Harbour is perfect. City side or harbour side is quiet. Rooms are a little small but so what. They are clean and you are located in one of the best locations in town for sometimes as low as $115usd per night. In house food and drink is okay, but you are on Darling Harbour....so go out and go to "Nicks" or "Meat Company" and have a great meal while enjoying the Aussie ambiance. One mini complaint-----forget early check in. I arrived 10am and got the old story that my room isn't ready yet (mid week in winter, so I know there were many vacancies). Told to come back at 1. Left back with bell desk and walked around for a couple of hours. At one o'clock on the dot, they gave me a key. This happens every time, so be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Not an Hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: grimrater
Reviews.Content: Travelled with 4yr & 8yr old grandchildren. This Hotel is very busy with conferences and has business people bustling around the lobby. We chose the Hotel because of the position on Darling Harbour. The harbour view rooms are fabulous. However, you have to go up steps, across a bridge over a very busy freeway to get to Darling Harbour. There are other Hotels right on the harbour which would have been more suitable with the children. A breakfast order for the children consisted of 3 slices of toast, 3 halves of english muffins and 2 glasses of apple juice, cost: $AU32.00. Rip off! The television didn't have children's channels available. I accept I should have done my homework before booking but I was just hooked on the location, my mistake. The staff were very good but always under pressure. If you want a very large impersonal Hotel for business meetings, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: WeekendHussler
Reviews.Content: Maybe we were lucky but we got a very good rate at the last minute through the hotel website and then were upgraded to a harbour view room upon arrival (maybe turning up at 4pm when there's no regular rooms left is a tip?) Importantly, the room was very clean and we slept soundly. The only downside would be that there is very little lighting in the room to the point where it's difficult to sit on the couch and read. The staff were excellent and very helpful in answering our questions on parking. In short, I think this is a very well priced hotel in a great location - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, good value”
Reviews.Author: direct2dubai
Reviews.Content: Room and bathroom was clean. B/fast was usual continental with good variety of cereals, youghurts and fruit. Hotel had old feeling to it but met our requirement of cleanliness and location. Close proximity to Darling Harbour, Aquarium, Ferries, Opera House and high street shopping. Would recommend this hotel highly to budget travellers. Try out the Lindt Cafe at Darling Hrbour - chocolate lovers dream :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KathrynC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an ideal location for Darling Harbour. It sits right next to the monorail, is very close to George St, boat trips are easily accessible, however, it is a bit of a walk to Circular Quay (about 30 mins) - but this didn't bother us as it let us see a lot more of Sydney. The staff were extremely helpful. We arrived early in the morning after a long flight and it was no problem to check us into our room. We also got late 3pm checkout and booked a 3 nights for the price of 2 (in advance) which included breakfast. (I think this was the best breakfast I've ever had in a hotel! The choice was amazing!) Some people have said that the rooms were small in their reviews, however, we didn't notice this at all. We had a lovely room with a gorgeous view of the harbour. Maybe some of the wooden furniture was a little scratched, but when the rest was so nice, it really didn't matter! The hotel also has 2 computers with free Internet access. It is more expensive to eat and drink in the hotel (like most large hotels), so I'd suggest getting a package deal in advance (our breakfast was only around $10 dollars more/night) or going to Darling Harbour or elsewhere for meals and drinks. I can't see why you would be disappointed with this hotel and I'm one who has high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned and pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: davidokok
Reviews.Content: We stayed on 2 occasions in Feb.2009. Once for 4 nights and on our return [ having travelled Australia ] we stayed for 2 nights. There are some good deals dealing direct on the internet with the hotel such as 3 nights for 2. However,we managed to miss/overlook these offers and booked at 270 Aus.Dollars per night for a Harbour View to include breakfast. Price was for 2 people, and included late check out , which was up to 3pm, although the sub text to this is that its at the hotels discretion. Our room was excellent and our views were well worth any premium. Breafast is buffet style and there is an extensive choice and is recommended. We only had one evening meal in the hotel and the food was more than acceptable without being stunning.Price was a tiny bit dear. Darling Harbour is a vibrant area which has been regenerated during the last 20 years. There are numerous great restaurants, shops and bars all close by. Also just across the road from the hotel are attractions such as Wildlife World, Sea World , Maritime Museum and IMAX Cinema. There is a ferry quay just over the footbridge from the rear of the hotel and many public and private ferries operate from there. Would recommend travelling by public ferry to Circular Quay from where you can see the Opera House and the Bridge. Another worthwhile public ferry trip from this landing/wharf is to Manly [ you will need to change at Circular Quay ] Manly is well worth a visit in its own right, but a best part of that day out is travelling in Sydney Harbour. The Monorail station is nearby and well worth using [ usually best to buy a day pass ] to access other tourist spots. Whilst we made our booking we joined the Starwood Preferred Guest scheme [ free to join, you get points for stays at their hotels]. There is not normally a great advantage to these schemes although we always join as we feel it gives us some leeway if we have to negotiate on anything at the hotel. On this occasion it helped us secure our late 3pm checkout . Additionally we were invited to a "get together" at the hotel where we were served endless canapes and beer and wines for 2 hours and finally on our return for our 2 night stay we were upgraded from a harbour view room to a harbour view room with a balcony and in our room was a bottle of champagne and chocolates, all complimentary and all without us asking. Whilst we were away for approx 3 weeks,the hotel happlily stored our considerable luggage for free. We loved Darling Harbour, and this hotel is well postioned to allow you to get the best from the area. Overall,we considered the hotel as pretty good value David and Wendy

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best affordable hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: karzrao
Reviews.Content: I travel to sydney a lot on business and pleasure and have stayed at a number of hotels and apartments. This hotel is probably the best hotel to stay at when looking for a hotel at under $200 a night. It is right on darling harbour and if you get a room with a harbour view, the sights are spectacular from your room. You can see the whole of darling harbour lit up at night which looks great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to sydney for a holiday and looking for good affordable rooms

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: NaMakani
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Points Darling Harbor for three nights in the early part of May 2009 and again for two nights in early June at the end of our trip to Australia. We recommend it highly as a friendly, comfortable base for exploring Sydney. It is nicely located on very attractive Darling Harbor, a short easy walk from the Aquarium ferry stop which will take you to Circular Quay and other transportation connections. Just a couple blocks away is a monorail stop and a 10-minute walk will put you at a main bus junction. Walking to the Rocks is a bit further but is pleasant and goes through major shopping areas. The hotel has an interesting design that incorporates both new parts and also some of the old warehouses that used to line the harbor. The rooms are in the new section and have views of either the harbor (for a bit more) or the city. We opted for the less expensive city view room for both of our stays. You can get good rates online, especially if you pre-pay. The first stay we had a â€œspecialâ€� package which included the buffet breakfast and a â€œ2-for-one beer sampler.â€� The breakfast was great â€“ one of the best buffets we encountered on our month-long trip, but it added quite a bit to the cost, and the beer sampler simply wasnâ€™t worth it. On the return we prepaid and took a room-only option. There are plenty of nice breakfast options near the hotel. Both rooms werenâ€™t large but they were modern, stylish, and very comfortable. Both had comfortable queen beds, a desk and work area, a side chair, night stands, and mini-bar with small refrigerator. The bathrooms were attractively tiled in marble and had adequate counter space. The a.c. units were quiet and effective. There is a charge for wifi internet access but there are two computers in the lobby available for free. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. For example, they made reservations for us at the CafÃ© Sydney for our return stay, and when checked in a note from the concierge was waiting confirming that. At dinner we were surprised with a small appetizer compliments of the hotel! Everyone from the bellman to the front desk staff had the same excellent helpful attitude. And of course in Australia no one was expecting a tip! All in all we liked the Four Points very much and would likely stay there again on our next trip to Sydney. We donâ€™t hesitate in recommending it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Darling Harbour, nice room with fabulous bed!”
Reviews.Author: Trippy21
Reviews.Content: Location was great for the Darling Harbour area, although Circular Quay and the Rocks are about 15 minute walk away. Room was pretty much as expected from a top class hotel. But I must mention the bed, it was huge, you could have easily fitted three people in it!! It was very comfy and lush after travelling for 3 weeks. On the whole a nice hotel, but nothing really outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Towels that smell of cigarettes!!! YucK!”
Reviews.Author: marishavh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the weekend for a work function. What a dive! The rooms were old and tired looking, with the funiture all chipped and paint peeling off. There was pubic hair in our bath tub! And our towels stank of cigarettes. One of my colleagues rooms still had a half drunk bottle of wine and two dirty glasses out on the table from the previous tenants! Also our bed was two singles pushed together and were hard and uncomfortable. Only plus of this hotel is it's in a good location, walking distance to the Harbour and all the restaurants. Not worth staying here for though. Oh yeah and they charged $36 parking for the night, rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money, but plain hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dal-n-lana
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Ok location. A 15 minute walk to Circular Quay. Good location for the price paid. However, I would have preferred to stay closer to Circular Quay or the Rocks.
