ROOM: Adequate size. No frills. STAFF: Staff was generally friendly and kind. Front desk was a little difficult in getting us a decent room. HOTEL: Average hotel. Good value for the price paid. I would prefer to stay closer to The Rocks or Circular Quay in a more unique hotel. CITY: Sydney is gorgeous. Very clean and organized. Take ferry trips, well worth it. If you have time, take a ferry to Robertson Park in Watson's Bay. The restaurants there have the best Fish-n-Chips. While you're there, go to The Gap. FOOD/DINING: Breakfast at the hotel was good. Had variety, but got bored after 3 days. Best places to eat in the city are along the port in Circular Quay. If you have time,

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly positioned for easy access to many attractions.”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights as part of a short trip to visit family. We originally had a city side room booked but on a arrival were up graded to harbourside view - absolutely wonderful - couldn't believe our luck! The hotel is perfectly situated for visiting all that Sydney has to offer and we particularly liked the ease of getting the ferry from outside the hotel to Circular Keys and The Rocks area. We didn't eat in the hotel as we enjoyed trying all the other wonderful eating opportunities in Darling Harbour. Our room was lovely and clean and the hotel staff were, without exception, friendly and knowledgeable. All in all a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Made a special Birthday event even more special.”
Reviews.Author: newmummy26
Reviews.Content: What can I say but Four Points went all out for my mothers 60th birthday on Saturday night. We booked 2 rooms, was expecting to get cityview rooms, got upgraded to Harbour view rooms. Being a Starwood Preferred guest this didn't even cost me any points. Checked in, rested, then on Saturday night had dinner at the Corn Exchange, did the seafood buffet, it was great, but I have to say not worth the money, as it was all geared it seems to please the asian diners, but left the rest of us wondering what each dish was. Needed more veges, more roast meats and definately not so watery prawns. But the lobster served at the beginning is how the whole buffet should be since we pay $75pp. Breakfast the next day at the Corn exchange was well worth it. Thats how the night buffet should be. The beds were soooo comfy, all the staff were above accommodating and so cool and courteous. Definately will be staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in a great place!”
Reviews.Author: jeffs_nz
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently spent 3 nights at the Four Points Sheraton and had a great time. We had booked a city view room, but on checking in, we were surprised to find that we had being upgraded to a harbour view room and our weekend just got better from there. On reflection, we have both decided that next visit we would spend the extra money for the harbour view room, it is well worth it. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the Concierge and the Commissioner who pointed us in the right direction more than once. The room (as mentioned earlier) had a stunning view, and was spacious and clean. The breakfast is well worth the cost, great variety and service. The location of the Four Points Sheraton is next to none! A very quick stroll down to Darling Harbour (less than 5 minutes to the best bars and restaurants). Ten minutes walk to Queen Victoria Building and all surrounding shopping. Fifteen minutes walk to the Rocks and all its surrounds. The Monorail stop is about 2 minutes from the hotel. I highly reccomend the Four Points Sheraton and will be back for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rossichka
Reviews.Content: I'm amazed by the organisation in the hotel. It was excellent. And they checked us in 5 hours before the official check in time! The room was nice and specious, but the most important was the bed - it was absolutely fabulous. I had a great sleep there. The only minus I could find was that the windows couldn't open. Oh, and the breakfast was very expensive, but there are plenty of cafÃ©s around that serve great breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OenoIndo
Reviews.Content: This hotel over look the darling harbour and offers great eating places close by. It has a very good concierge service and the rooms are well appointed. There is a small cafe outside the hotel that offers some great food and wine. I sat there with my wife just after a rain shower and it remains a very memorable eveing for both of us. I must add that the hotel even sent us a thank you note after we left - I don;t know of too many hotels that have done that.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: AbhishekG_Mumbai
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while on my honeymoon over the New years eve. This hotel is all about its location - bang on the Darling Harbor and walking distance from attractions like the Sea World, the Observation deck, shopping area, etc.Other sightseeing attractions, though a little far off are very well connected from Darling Harbor. From the Sydney harbor u can come back to ur hotel and continue the new year celebrations on the Darling Harbor. The hotel had very courteous staff and decently decorated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY AVERAGE....SPEND MORE AND GET A BETTER HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Dishtalk
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Four Points Sheraton. The only part that is better than average is the location. Here is what the cons are: 1. Rooms are just average. Showers were dirty when we checked in. Carpets need to be changed. Got woken up at 6:30am to the sound of the room next door having a shower. The sounds from room to room is very loud and if your neighbors use the toilet/shower, you hear it. Also, if you are harbor side, you'll hear the nightclub below until all hours. Very hard to get to sleep. 2. No pool. 3. Menu pricing is beyond ridiculous. Breakfast is $20 & $28. Room service entrees are $29 plus a $5.00 delivery charge. 4. Hotel charges $15.00 for every hour you may need to extend. 5. Concierge recommended restaurant: Ice Cube...is was a complete waste of money and a terrible experience. Steaks ($39 each) were cold, they forgot the veggies, did not fill water, did not check back with our table and we could not order wines and other items.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Teen05
Reviews.Content: Right in heart of Darling Harbor. Only negative was only 2 computers available to guests at no cost. They were always crowded. Very good fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Val2754
Reviews.Content: The Four Points is just 45 minutes by taxi (50AUD including tip) from Sydney Airport. We had on a previous visit stayed in The Rocks so wanted to try somewhere different. Check in was very efficient and as we are SPG members we were upgraded to a harbourside suite on the 15th floor, without asking, for the duration of our stay. We had booked a harbourside room. At check in the staff offered suggestions on what we could do during our stay and were very helpful. The suite was clean and comfy with a seperate lounge and TV, a bedroom with a comfy bed and pillows also with a TV, a walk in wardrobe area and bathroom with a shower over the bath. The towels and robes were almost like new, all white and fluffy! Also slippers were supplied. The room also had a small kitchenette which included a microwave, fridge, cutlery, crockery, toaster and tea and coffee making facilities and supplies. The breakfast buffet had everything we needed, eggs could be ordered, and there was a good selection of Continental and Asian breakfast items. The Concierge department was fantastic and had everything to hand. We didn't need to go to the Tourist Information as they had all the transport timetables ready printed off to hand out. They also had an excellent map of the city. Nothing was too much trouble for them. We stayed here at the beginning of our trip for 4 nights and then at the end of the trip for just the one night(no upgrade this time!) but still on SPG floor. As our flight wasn't until late in the evening we were able to use the shower in the gym to freshen up before we left even though we had checked out at noon. All in all we were very pleased with the hotel and especially the location. The restaurants of Darling Harbour were just a short walk away and so were the ferries which take you around to the Opera House etc, and the main CBD area with the shopping malls are again just a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: maziars27
Reviews.Content: Booking a hotel for a trip on the other side of the world is difficult. As much research as you do, you really don't know what to expect until you actually arrive. The taxi service from the airport was $45 each way. The four points has an impressive entry, great service (bell boys and front desk service). We arrived early and were able to leave our luggage until our room was ready to check in. The hotel is nice we paid $145 canadian for our room per night. We stayed for two nights. The location is great for the Darling Harbour... but if you want to be close to Sydney Harbor I'd recommend The Rocks. We walked from our hotel to the Sydney Harbour which took us 20 mins or so. There is a free bus that you can catch bus 555 from market street that will take you there directly. (this is right beside the Queen Victoria building - old building turned luxury shopping centre). The area really capitalizes on the fact that it's a touristy spot... breakfast was a whopping $35 pp and dinner was $75 pp. Even trying to find a local bakery or more reasonably priced restaurant was impossible. One thing we learned a little too late, was that tipping is not necessary in Australia... anywhere.. not in restaurants ... taxis ... spas... ect. Since taxes are also included in all prices that helps things... but sydney is a pricy area so be prepared to spend a small fortune :) The room at the Sheraton was a slight disappointment.. it was clean and comfortable but very basic. I guess I expected more from a Sheraton. We had a city view... but given the hotel location I'm glad we didn't pay for a Harbour view room. We did have room service twice once for dinner and once for breakfast... the prices were more reasonable than the restaurant down stairs, the food was good. There is a $5 surcharge for room service added to the bill. Overall our stay was comfortable and safe. I would stay again if the price was right. And now I know the area... Do your research and you won't be disappointed...

Reviews.Title: “very nice location & budget hotel for a 4/5 star”
Reviews.Author: amit_199
Reviews.Content: I was there for 3 nights. The location is just fantastic offers connectivity to near by tourist sites. The room rent was A$ 170 per night which i thing was a very good deal. I dint like the ligting of the room , lobby it was very minimal. The hotel dint had a ppol facilty and was very loud at lobby level. The conceirage was excellent and so was the reception. Given the deal i think i was happy with it

Reviews.Title: “Easy, enjoyable stay in Sydney at Four Points”
Reviews.Author: room_downstairs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Four Points recently with family. We were quite impressed with the hotel, and very much enjoyed our stay. The best part of the hotel is its location, in Sussex Street, which is basically a two-minute walk down to Darling Harbour and a five minute walk into the centre of the city, depending on your destination (George Street, Pitt Street, Hyde Park etc). Each night we just walked straight down to Darling Harbour to have dinner at one of the many restaurants down there, and enjoyed the nightlife and the atmosphere of Cockle Bay. From Darling Harbour you can catch a ferry or take a sightseeing cruise, eat at one of the multitude of restaurants or shop at Harbourside, so it was obviously excellent to be only a stone's throw from there. It's very handy to the Monorail, which is also a short distance by foot, and there is also a number of useful services on Sussex Street including a newsagency and a convenience store. The hotel itself has many different amenities e.g. a restaurant, bar (but don't eat at the Lobby Bar - the buffet is extraordinarily expensive and there's a huge selection of restaurants at Darling Harbour anyway), fitness centre and conference rooms, so naturally we saw a lot of business travellers there. All round it was quite busy, but the staff are very efficient and friendly, especially the valets and concierge, and they were really helpful from the moment we arrived. Check-in was simple and quick, and our bags arrived up at our room in excellent time. I have to say I was quite impressed with the friendliness of the staff, who answered all our questions and tried to help wherever they could. The staff and housekeeping all said hello and smiled if you saw them in the corridors as well, which I thought was a nice touch. We stayed in a city side room, and it was good for the price and what we needed. The room overlooks Sussex Street which is not bad, but I'd highly recommend paying the extra and staying in a Harbour View Room because the views of Darling Harbour are absolutely fantastic. Because there's over 600 rooms the rooms are fairly small, but the room was clean and tidy, with everything you would expect (air-con, television, small fridge including mini bar items, tea and coffee, iron, desk, internet, room safe etc.). The bathroom was compact but big enough for everything, with a huge mirror, and housekeeping always had it spotless everyday and stocked full with plenty of fresh towels. The beds are also quite comfortable too and I slept well each night. It was great coming back to a very clean and comfortable room each night to relax in. The only gripe I have is the proximity of the rooms to one another, because of the occasional noise. The rooms are very closely situated and so we could hear people talking very audibly in the corridor outside the room, housekeeping delivering breakfasts, and other guests opening and closing their hotel room doors. Late at night this was slightly bothersome. The guests in one of the rooms adjoining ours seemed to shower quite late at night, and the water pipes made a particularly loud noise. It didn't bother us terribly much at all because there wasn't that many people staying on our floor, but I can imagine that during peak periods this would be worse, and more noticeable. If you like good distance between yourself and other guests, I would stay elsewhere. Despite that, I still think that it was a good hotel. Overall I would recommend Four Points and I plan on staying there again when I go back to Sydney, this time in a Harbour View Room. We had no difficulties whatsoever, and our stay went seamlessly thanks to the helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: berniel7
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the hotel. We had stayed here three years ago on a previous trip. Following are pros and cons: Pros: (1) Booked a harbour view room which provided a nice view of Darling Harbour. (2) We included the buffet breakfast in our room rate and found it to be very tasty and a good value. There was ample food selection including juices, coffee, or tea, and the quality was very good. (3) Hotel is in excellent location, a few minutes walk to Darling Harbour and all its shops and restaurants, and the Sydney Acquarium. The monorail is also only a few minutes away which takes you right into the central business district where all the large department stores and shopping arcades are located. Also close to Chinatown. (4) Although only two computers were available, internet service on the lobby level was free to guests. (5) Concierge was knowledgeable and helpful especially in helping us to mail a letter without having to go to the post office and in providing directions. Cons: (1) The rooms are relatively small, although adequate in size. However, it could definitely use refurbishing as the carpet was worn and the bed could have been more comfortable. (2) No flatscreen TV. (3) Would have liked to try the Corn Exchange for dinner buffet but found that it was too expensive, especially on the weekends. In summary, we would stay here again because of its location and price charged, especially if combined with the buffet breakfast, which made for a good value. The hotel staff is also helpful and friendly. (We also stayed at the Sydney Shangri-la on this trip - separate review.)

Reviews.Title: “Decent location but not peaceful!”
Reviews.Author: kiroop
Reviews.Content: We spent the last 4 nights of our quick NZ/AUS trip at this hotel. Here is our synopsis: -Staff was very courteous and helpful, even upgraded us to Harbor View for no extra charges - The rooms are on the small side and seem very dark. I think it is the dark carpet and furntiure they chose to use; plus the carpet looks very worn out. Even the hallways in the hotel are on the dark side. -Bathroom is clean but seems very small, dark and crowded as well. -Location is good as it is within walking distance to CBD, Darling Harbor, Chinatown and about 15-20 minutes walk to Opera House/Rocks area. -Two computers with Internet are available for use complimentary to guests. -To make any phone call from your room (even toll free ones) they charge you a surcharge. This was annoying but we found this to be typical of other hotels as well... - If you like Malaysian food, Mamak is a great restaurant within a 10 minute walk from hotel and it is BYO wine which was nice. -The breakfast buffet (included in our room cost which was about $130/night inclusive of all taxes) was pretty good; they had a good selection of sweet and savory. Plus they make the eggs anyway you like. Overall, I would hesitate to highly recommend this hotel just bc there are so many to pick from and I would definately try something new. However if all else was booked, I would def. feel comfortable staying here again. Aslo, perhaps since we had just stayed in some similarly priced hotels that were overall more aestheticlly pleasing and also in good locations, this one just didn't make the cut for us. Perhaps we are getting too picky bc overall most people would say this hotel is a pretty good choice; like I said I think we just got spoiled bc one we stayed in right before this one was so bright and airy and similar in price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Typical Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisEFrost
Reviews.Content: We chose the Four Points by Sheraton Darling Harbour purely for the location and weren't let down. A 5 minute walk away from the Sydney Aquarium and Maratime museum there are plenty of things to do outside your front door. The ferry terminal (also 5 mins away) is a great way to see Sydney and gets you too the rocks in 20 minutes taking you under the Harbour Bridge offering you fantastic views of the Opera House. The hotel itself is a very "run of the mill" business hotel. The rooms although cleans and resonably spacious offered no features, but served the purpose as being a great base for a short stay in Sydney. We didn't make use of the restaurant or room service as you're spoiled for places to eat both on the main streets and in Darling Harbour itself. Prices in this area are a little on the expensive side so be prepared! The only problem I had was internet access. The hotel have 2 free computers in the hotel lobby and wireless/wired from rooms and the hotel bar. These are chargeable and were one of the most expensive I've experienced, and I'm still surprised that they charge you even if you're sat in the bar, drinking paid for drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Location better than expected, good service, nice room”
Reviews.Author: TravelTwinkie
Reviews.Content: Our 2 night stay prior to a cruise was comfortable. All services were available and staff was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Darling Harbour is a great place for wandering, picking up the Explorer bus and seeing the whole city. 15 minute walk to the cruise piers and lots of easy harbour area touring. This was actually the nicest 4 Pts of the brand that we have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged”
Reviews.Author: landcruiserBJ
Reviews.Content: Being familiar with the Darling Harbour area and the location of this hotel we decided that the final couple of nights of our Australian break would be taken at the Four Points with a harbour view room. The online booking was quick and easy and the cost, with the 20% online discount offer, was reasonable. However a couple of days after making the booking a check online of our credit card statement revealed the Four Points had charged us for three nights not two â€“ even though the online booking receipt and their follow up email both correctly indicated a two night charge. How did that happen, we can only assume some manual intervention changed the amount to be charged!! An email to their accounts department elicited a quick refund and an apology. See our report on The Sheraton on the Park, Sydney â€“ overcharged at both of these Starwood Group hotels. Our initial greeting at reception was warm and friendly, and we were advised that due to â€œspare capacityâ€� we were being upgraded to a Deluxe Harbour View Room â€“ we had tried to book one of these online but there was not any available!! Perhaps the â€œspare capacityâ€� had come about as a result of our overcharging complaint and perhaps even our letter to Starwood Chief Executive in White Plains, New York regarding both of our overcharging experiences in his Sydney hotels. Throughout our short stay the staff were friendly and helpful, the room was well presented, the hotel location was excellent, the beer was expensive, there was some noise from the expressway that runs between the hotel and the harbour there was also some noise from one of the harbour bars but neither of the noise levels impacted on our ability to sleep. The accounting issue apart we would certainly consider staying at the Four Points again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with The Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Thrilme
Reviews.Content: The Fourpoints Sheraton Darling Harbour is a very nice hotel.Great location ,very professional staff and overall good experience.I will definitely stay there again on future travels to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “wow what a view!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hotlips15
Reviews.Content: we had a harbour view room, and what a view we had over darling harbour! beds were comfy,staff were helpful, central location for darling harbour not far from other sights.within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 Stars about right”
Reviews.Author: bognor
Reviews.Content: Somebody else reckoned this hotel is about 3.5 stars and I agree. It is clean, central and well situated but I found it to be overly expensive (we paid Â£160 prpn) and that is for a fairly small room with no view, they wanted a lot more for a harbour view. For some strange reason the maid kept stealing our bath plug! We found the staff to generally be pretty good but we did not enjoy the buffet breakfast - (included in our rate but otherwise expensive) - horrible cereals without cold milk, most of the hot stuff rather tired and unappetising. Some quite nice restaurants nearby though, including the Tony Roma's.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: si_b2001
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, got upgraded on arrival to harbour view, staff wonderful and very helpful. looked after very well bar pricey for beer though!!

Reviews.Title: “cant beat the location and service”
Reviews.Author: lilbopeep
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to sydney and also our second stay at this hotel. The hotel is right next to darling harbour, there is a walkway at the back of the hotel which takes you striaght over, and darling harbour is the best place for food and drink, chilling out and ferry access, oh and a 10 min walk into town. The hotel has good front desk service, rachel served us and let us check in early, even got a room ready for us (we arrived at 7.30am) and gave us a key to the fitness suite to freshen up whilst waiting. We were staying during a special occassion and the hotel gave us a bottle of bubbly and a card signed by about 8 of the hotel staff wishing us the best, real nice touch. We had a king size harbour view room, not the biggest room or bathroom, but absolutely adequate for what we needed, soft bed and good view. Reasonable selection of tv channels and well stocked mini bar. We didnt eat at the hotels restaurant, there was too much choice at the harbour, but we did use the pub every day for a bevvy before returning to the room, an essential part of the hotel! Would we stay here again? Yes, the location and decent price we got by booking direct with prepayment means we would.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the KING SIZE COMFY BED”
Reviews.Author: ShazaAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights toi visit family. Checked in early which was very nice. Very helpful and polite staff . Room with fantastic Darling Harbour views was very clean, and the King bed was such a pleasant surprise as it was so comfortable, unlike the usual beds in most hotels! Great location to access the city on foot, or catch a ferry right at the harbour to Circular Quay to explore anywhere you may want to go. Buffet breakfast was yummy..but the coffee could have been better. I would go back again next time in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Thumping Music”
Reviews.Author: barium99
Reviews.Content: Good location and generally very good hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. Biggest problem we had was the noise. We booked a harbour view room for several days for a wedding and in anticipation of Australia Day fireworks, but were unable to stay in it because of the loud noise from a nearby bar (The Helm, which is on the harbour). Reception were helpful in the early hours of the morning and arranged an alternate city view room, with us obviously missing out on the view over the next several days. Unfortunately the alternate room provided only accommodated two, which meant that one of our party of three (me) had to sleep in the noisy room. The following day we arranged city view accommodation for three and were happy enough in that room, although missed out on seeing the fireworks from our room and instead had to stand in the rain. Reception staff were very polite and apologetic about the noise, and otherwise the hotel is in quite a good location, but the noise definitely took the shine off the experience. Hotel staff adjusted the cost of our stay in accordance with the move.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cloughy1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 13 nights and really enjoyed my stay there. I had a room with a view of the harbour which was great, there was nothing better than waking up to clear blue skies and the view of the aquarium and restaurants. It was really close to a lot of the attractions, which made it a great base for a stay in a Sydney. The Sydney Tower was 5 minutes away and the Harbour bridge and Opera House where 20 minutes walk away. The hotel room was of a good size, although the internet was not free, the hotel gym was good which made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but get a harbour view”
Reviews.Author: carlyr27
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here in a harbour view room for 3 nights on 9th Nov 2008 with our 18 month old son. We arrived late in the evening after a long long flight and check in was great and really friendly. The rooms are great we had harbour view but cityside would have been very dull. The bed was HUGE. Once you get a travel cot in the room not much other room but it was fine. We had room service most nights and the food was very good and reasonably priced because Sydney in general is quite expensive! We were b&b and the breakfast is excellent choice and quality. The only thing is this hotel is not very child friendly and although we enjoyed our stay they are more geared to business people.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: trekking-Taffy
Reviews.Content: This was part of a 4 City Holiday for a 20th wedding Anniversary, the hotel was very well located. It was in walking distance of Darling Harbour activities and close to the monorail which looped around Sydney. Staff, accommodation and food were excellent. It was mentioned in passing on booking in that it was our wedding anniverary and a free bottle of champagne was in our room. A great place to stay if in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Ferry Stop!”
Reviews.Author: hairofflame
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the Four Points by Sheraton Darling Harbour with a friend of mine on a recent trip to Australia! We always love staying at Starwood properties, so this hotel was right up our alley. We took the train from the airport to the hotel with ease. A short walk from the station landed us at the hotel. We were greeted with open arms from the concierge who offered to take our bags. We checked in immediately and up to our room. We did not have the great Harbour view, but let me tell you a view of the city had its perks as well. Our bags were shortly delivered to the room along with maps of the city, some tour options and coupons for some of the main attractions! The location of this hotel is great. They have a walkway that leads directly to Darling Harbour (great places to eat!). Right near the walkway is the Sydney Ferry stop, which will take you anywhere! Definately the way to get around the city with great sights of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Our 6 night stay at this hotel was tremendous! 2 computers in the lobby with free internet, free local paper in the morning, comfortable bed with all the normal amenities of a hotel. If back in Sydney again, we will be back to the Four Points.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jenn1280
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just fantastic. My partner and I booked it for the night he returned from a month long trip home to Saudi Arabia. It was such a wonderful hotel - the room was beautiful and the view was fantastic. I had some initial doubts about the view (it's not on the side of the Novotel, Ibis, etc, where the best views are) but it was still beautiful. The room was extremely comfortable and the service was great - we ordered a club sandwhich for a late breakfast and it arrived within 15 minutes. It is the best hotel I've stayed at in Sydney, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Good location at darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: cemckeon
Reviews.Content: We had a layover in Sydney and chose this hotel right in Darling Harbour. Like most big city hotels it was crowded and bustling with activity. Convenient location for anything on the harbour - ferry, aquarium, restaurants, shopping, sightseeing, etc. The concierge made a great recommendation for dinner - Coast at Cockle Bay Wharf - short walk from the hotel. Absolutely, the best swordfish I have ever had! Restaurant service was excellent too. Hotel was also convenient for an evening ferry to see the Harbour Bridge and Opera House lit up at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: sueg47
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Points for 6 nights in October. Were upgraded to a harbourview room... fantastic views day and night. Room was very spacious, amenities fine and spotlessly clean. Staff were universally charming and helpful. Can't comment on food as we only had breakfast a couple of days. Very good location for entertainment, bars and restaurants. 3 minutes walk to the ferry for Circular Quay and 2 minutes to the bus stop for the "hop-on/hop-off " buses. Would choose here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best All Round Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bchapman23
Reviews.Content: This has be one of the best hotels in sydney for location, staff and quality. I have stayed at this property several times and the staff have never provided average service and the property is always maintained to the highest standard. It was a pleasure once again to stay at this brilliant hotel. I will add photos from my stay once i get organised. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Where was ther service”
Reviews.Author: travelfreak38
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a few issues to mention. On the first evening we decided to eat in the hotel restaurant, never again. the food was ok but the staff werent exactly consistant with what they were doing. we initially didnt get charged for a bottle of wine nor sparkling mineral water. however the waiter realised and broguht us another bill about 15 minutes later. Understandably they were busy but in the world of technology how did we get served the wine and water without it going through a system, definately not sure. We used the automated check-in system which overcharged our card but management seemed apologetic even though reception didnt really care They have a long way to improve but maybe slowly getting there. The location was fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property!”
Reviews.Author: SilverCry3
Reviews.Content: I was incredibly impressed with the Four Points Darling Harbour. It is located in a perfect area of Sydney... right below the impressive historic Rocks area and right next to the Central Business District, both just a short walk away. Darling Harbour has a charm of it's own and is a beautiful area to stay. The Four Points is right along the water, next to a small ferry port which is so convenient if you want to take a ferry to Circular Quay or Manly Beach or Watson's Bay. Highly recommend doing all of those also! The ferries take you past the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House - it's a truly magical experience! The rooms at the Four Points were great - the bed was so comfortable, the room was clean, spacious, housekeeping was good, the conceirge was extremely helpful with assisting me book my tours and giving me recommendations. I did not try the restaurant within the hotel but I did go to the bar across the street called the Dundee Arms, which is small but a perfect meeting place to grab a quick drink before dinner. Sydney is such an amazing area, there is so much to see and do and everyone is so nice! Walk around as much as you can in The Rocks and take the ferries!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappytravelsCanberra
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Sheraton on Darling Harbour in 2008. I was impressed (both times) by the standard of service. All staff were very welcoming and helpful at all times. I had a twin room harbour view (both times) which was excellent. Very comfortable bed and the room furnishings are adequate. I was impressed with the airconditioning. One of the few times I have found airconditioning that was comfortable, quiet and not needing to be adjusted or turned off at night! Another plus.....the walls are very well insulated so noise from nextdoor isn't an issue! The breakfast in the restaurant was a good standard and also catered for my gluten allergy without a problem. Very well located, within easy walking distance of Darling Harbour and the CBD. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “top class check in”
Reviews.Author: alfiebear
Reviews.Content: On our first ever trip to Australia,our destination hotel was the Four Points by Sheraton.Our flight from the uk was overnight and we were on the ground in Sydney airport around 5 am.We took a taxi to the hotel<approx 50 aus,dollars>and arrived at the hotel arond 6 am,we went to reception and they checked us in,and we were in our room and in bed for 6.30 am,well done four points,great service ! Our room overlooked darling harbour,the room was o k nothing special,and had a large king sized,very comfortable bed,t v, tea and coffee making facilities,iron and ironing board,and a complimentary safety deposit box which worked by swiping your credit card,however no charge was taken. The room had the usual overpriced mini bar and additional plug sockets for the business traveller.The bathroom had a bath with overhead shower,the bath was slightly cracked and really needed a good scrub clean,however the water was the hottest water we have ever had in any hotel we have ever stayed in. We never ate in the hotel,nor used room service,we did go down and enquire about dinner one evening,however at 60 dollars per head for a buffett dinner,we declined and went out to eat around darling harbour. We only stayed in the hotel for four nights, and to be fair we never had an issue,the hotel for us was just in the most perfect position for darling harbour,and if thats the focal point for your stay,then I would reccommend it.We would use this hotel again if we were ever in Sydney. As always if I can be of any help to anyone,please feel free to e mail me at the usual address. alfiebear1950@hotmail.com. Happy holidaying. Alistair Allan

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable room for Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: TheQueenslander
Reviews.Content: The number of hotels and serviced apartments dotted around Darling Harbour servicing the Syndey Convention centre makes choosing hotels a difficult one. Proximity for conferences is important, but so is comfort after a day of meetings. The Four Points is on the fringe of the City, bordering Cockle Bay side of Darling Harbour - the monorail is 3 mins walk and walking to the Convention centre is a good 10 minutes away. Restaurants at Cockle Bay are nice looking but usually average in quality, We were upgraded to a Harbourside "suite" - an enlarged standard room with the addition of a sofa and balcony overlooking the water after booking at $315/night. The room was comfortable, looked new enough, bedding comfortable and bathroom midrange. Whilst our room was quiet on the 8th floor, a friend was in the same style on the 3rd floor which was way too close to the expressway directly under his balcony. They were renovating their Corn Exchange restaurant, so brekkie was in the ballroom - a comprehensive, but uniformly uninspired array of standard buffet fare for the money. Really nothing special. Nice gym set up, but no pool, sauna or spa. Overall, a comfortable stay - to be expected for 4 star, but no bargains here. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base to shop, eat and explore”
Reviews.Author: shano77
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed one night recently for our joint birthday celebrations and loved the hotel and staff. We had a king room with great views of darling harbour and had breakfast included at the hotel restaurant also. Upon arrival the staff were all very friendly and helpful from the parking and baggage staff to reception and the restaurant. The breakfast was fresh, tasty and varied and the room perfect for a quick stay. What a position right on darling harbour and close to chinatown and the pitt street shopping area. Perfect couple of days in sydney and good value for money. we'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price or it's star rating”
Reviews.Author: Doug H
Reviews.Content: Every time I book at Four Points, I assume it will be better than it ends up being. I know that Starwood has been trying to upgrade this brand to bring it more in line with its other brands, but it still falls short. This hotel in particular, while a great location in Sydney (especially for tourists visiting the Darling Harbour area) just isn't up to par given the price tag. I had a Harbour View room on the SPG floor (the view was good), but the room was incredibly damp, even allowing for the fact that we were three blocks from the water. The cielings were quite low, making the bathroom dark since it only had one light. It was rather ironic, in that I read the Starwood brochure provided in the room, and it said one thing that Four Points had was a good shower - and this shower was not very good. Even the furniture in the room needed updating. The prices for all services - room service, in-room telephone, and Internet, to name a few - were all more expensive than the Westin Melbourne where I had stayed previously. After I arrived and got settled in, I checked out rates for the 5-star Sheraton on the Park across town. For the subsequent nights I had in Sydney, the Sheraton was the same price - so I checked out early the next day (the front desk was very accomodating, so a thank you to them) and transferred. It's not that the hotel overall was bad - probably 3 stars overall, and definitely suitable for tourist groups - but given the higher perception that the hotel gives on its web site and the newer, more upscale look Sheraton is trying to put on this brand, I can't give it more than the 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mfnMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! My recent stay at Four Points brought back fond memories of a short stay at the Sheraton Mirage Port Douglas almost 15 years ago, where my family and I enjoyed hotel hospitality at its finest. On this recent trip to Sydney, I contacted Four Points after a terrible experience at the Saville (Bond St) and was immediately accomodated with a City side suite at a comparable rate (to the Saville) and was also offered a Habour view room. The lovely reservation operator was also conscientious enough to enrol me into their Starwood Preferred Guest program in order to accrue loyalty points. The following day I arrived at Four Points just after 12pm and was greeted by the polite and friendly concierge and doorman. My bags were immediately taken by the concierge who assured my the bags would be sent to my room once I was checked in. The bags were promptly taken to my room. At check in, I was amazed that despite the 3pm check in, my room on the 10th floor was actually ready so I was able to organise myself and settle in. The City side view was fine and the noise level was pretty low particularly at night. The two night stay was very comfortable and the 24-hour, well equipped gym made the hotel all the more accessible. The service was excellent and room quality was outstanding, despite the room being a little bit small. The staff were always attentive and ensured guest comfort. I will no doubt, return on my next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SpivsUKOK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Points for a week on business. As a hotel, it's fine but not exceptional. My overall conclusion is that it's not making the most of its excellent location. The location is certainly fantastic, right by Darling Harbour - you can be on the boardwalk within a minute of leaving the hotel and this means that there loads of bars and restaurants literally on your doorstop. In addition, the main shopping area is only a five minute walk away in the other direction. Although the view from my room, onto the harbour, was wonderful, overall I would say that the bedroom and faciltiies were average. The room was slightly on the small side for what I would expect, it had an OK bathroom (which was functional rather than impressive) and a sense that the fixtures and fittings were starting to wear thin. All in all it felt like it's time for refurbishment. . I didn't use the restaurant but did make frequent use of room service. The service itself was slightly above average but the quality of the food was average to poor - a shamefully lame plate of fruit offering being a noticeable weakness. The lobby area gives a good impression of size and is relatively grand, but the corridors felt a bit gloomy. There isn't a hotel bar in the traditional sense - more like a pub tagged on the side. This was fine and although it didn't feel like it was part of the hotel I found that a good thing. Felt comfortable being in there by myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mhquay
Reviews.Content: Spent two days at this hotel on business. Location was great. Close to Darling Harbour nightlife and ferries. 10 minute walk to downtown and circular quay or take a government ferry and get a scenic cruise as well. (Leaves form Pier 26) Rooms were comfortable. Get a harbour view if possible. This is a big hotel so bar and breakfast area get very busy when full. PP Mandurah, Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RLMUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points Darling Harbour for 5 nights to start off our honeymoon. The hotel is in a great location, 3 minutes walk to lively Darling Harbour restaurants and Bars as well as the Aquarium. You can easily explore Sydney from its central location, a 15-20 minute walk to Circular Quay or the Rocks, or you can take a ferry which is just 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Service was overall average as were the rooms. I wasnt expecting anything spectacular and that is what we got. The common areas are impressive, the rooms are a bit on the small side, but well appointed. Breakfast was very expensive and not worth the price. The Head Concierge was brilliant, the others were again average. If you are looking for a luxurious hotel, this is not for you. if you are looking for a good central point to explore Sydney, this is a great hotel to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, OK Staff”
Reviews.Author: Woogieworld
Reviews.Content: Our first place that became our home for five days in Sydney. Great location to everything, easy walk around Darling Harbour. Taxis a plenty for everything else. Great location to catch tours and what-not. Staff was a bit difficult at first, had our room but didn't want to let us in (after 30 hours of travelling, I was getting a bit out of place). Restaurant is quite expensive and really not fantastic. Avoided for rest of trip. Had problem with some charges, front desk finally gave me free internet for most of the trip because of it. Otherwise, nice place and would stay there again. That is, if we could get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: maryellenNottingham
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the stay here and the staff were helpful. The room was comfortable with a good view over Darling Harbour. (Having read earlier reviews on this site we did not upgrade to a balcony. There was no point in sitting above a busy road.) Breakfasts were fine although the restaurant was always crowded and it was not a particularly relaxing experience. Apart from that the hotel was fine and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, where's the Internet?”
Reviews.Author: ccharles_byte
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Great location. Its so near Darling Harbour! The food (room service) is excellent. The beds are comfortable. Just beware, the lack of Internet access (wired, or wireless) if you are in a room on floors 1-4. Wifi is available in the business center or lobby only.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Views of the Harbor”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoBright
Reviews.Content: Well worth the premium for a harbor view. Spectacular. Doormen and other staff very helpful. Thanks Tony for your assistance with our missing luggage and the refund from the store across the street. Great location. Right in the center of everything. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mm29
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Four Points and were delighted with the hotel. The hotel overlooks Darling Harbour, which can be accessed by a walkway and stairs directly from the hotel. The room was clean and nicely furnished; we had a harbour view room which I would defiantly recommend if you are there for a few days. Breakfast is expensive (AUS$33.00) but does include everything you could possibly want. The pub next door to the hotel offers a small selection of evening meals at a very good price and if you have spend all day exploring the city itâ€™s a good place to spend the evening. Having said that there are many near by restaurants and we would defiantly recommend The Sydney Tower for dinner as well as the views. From the hotel you can walk into the Rocks area and Circular Quay but another alternative is to take the ferry from Darling Harbour, this is very reasonable and a great way to see the sights (especially at night). A good way to see Sydney is on the "hop on hop off" bus, there are two versions - a coach or an open top bus - we did the open top bus which covers the city and Bondi. The ticket is valid for a full 24hrs so can be used over 2 days - also if you are hesitant (or ask) they may offer you a small discount. We took the city rail from the airport to hotel; the nearest stop is The Town Hall, which is approx 5 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff but otherwise only ok”
Reviews.Author: oceanrunninggirl
Reviews.Content: We had intended on staying 3 nights at the Sheraton but found it was a let down after all the other hotels we had booked on our 2 week vacation through Australia. We checked out and went home after only 1 night. The room was ok...only king bed..no doubles so all three of us (my teenage daughter and husband) had to share a king bed...since we are all skinny it wasn't a problem but hard to believe there were no doubles at all and a rollaway was extra. The breakfast buffet everyone seems to rave about couldn't compare to any buffet's I have had in the past all over the world. Even my teenager passed on it. The coffee was poor as well. The really good feature of the Sheraton was it's staff...the concierge's work really hard to answer everyone's questions and one guy in particular helped us alot to get the ferry to Manly. Also, the front desk was good and did not give me a hard time as a starwood preffered member to check out early. Don't stand in the starwood line though because they ignor it. I guess the main dissapointment was the gym or lack of it. It is probably our fault because all the other starwood hotels we booked had sauna's and steamrooms and some jacuzzi's. My husband was looking forward to relaxing since it was the end of our vacation but the gym was not at all what we expected. Actually we would have been happy with the Westin or the Sheraton on the Park and it's my fault for not looking at them closer and realizing the Sheraton 4 points is more of a group tourist busy place...not at all for relaxing. Do yourself a favor and book at one of those...the location is better too because we walked to circular quay all the time...the restraunts and shopping were so much better there and the transportation to Manly and Bondi are easier too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dublinyogi
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, within walking distance (if you are pretty active and like to hoof it around to see the sites, which we found very enjoyable) of all the main sites in Sydney. Good service, great view, our room was an executive harbour view and I think it was worth the upgrade, although the balcony didn't have any furniture on it and is suspended above a busy road. The room itself was spacious and well equipped, great mini bar, very very small bathroom. Darling Harbour is a really good location for just wandering around people watching, lots of restaurants and places you can just sit and have a drink. It's quite contained as well so if you're tired after a days sightseeing you've got a lot of choice with not too much walking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and proximity to Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Morand
Reviews.Content: For our 5 night stay, we have asked for a so called â€šSuperior Harbour View roomâ€™ (non-smoking, at a higher level). On checking, the initial room (3 beds, although asked for twin beds, and not cleaned, and the room at low level only, etc.) itself had practically no harbour view - only that of the Aquarium roof and main road below. We refused to take this roomâ€¦ and finally (waiting patiently over three hours) we have got a nicer room and also situated at a higher level, as booked. The best asset of this hotel is its location, its proximity to Darling Harbour and nearby shopping malls, but the hotel is somewhat 'tired' in decor and outfit. The windows are sound-proof (mainly in view of the traffic of some importance), and the beds are good. The internet (wireless) at the lobby is properly working and free of charge (the broadband access in rooms is too expensive). Difficult to say if we would stay there again. Maybe we shall try next time another hotel (the Darling Harbour view is 'nice to have' but not a 'must'). From our understanding, there might be other options in the inner city (and less expensive ones).

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MissyPhow
Reviews.Content: Four Points is in a fantastic location, walking distance to restaurants at the Darling Harbour and main shopping strip around QVB. Huge hotel with friendly enough staff but nothing really special nor leave a lasting impression. Get a harbour facing room for a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Darling Harbour & The Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: anna68
Reviews.Content: First time in Sydney we booked this hotel through Trailfinders as it was a half decent price over the new year period. Located right next to Darling Harbour we loved the location. Lots of lovely restaurants and bars in the harbour to enjoy for breakfast, lunch or dinner. It is also where the aquarium and the wildlife centre is located. You can also get ferries from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. If we returned to Sydney we would stay in Darling Harbour again, just a great atmosphere. Our NYE cruise also left from King ST Wharf just 5 mins from the hotel - handy! Our room had a view out over the harbour, was a good size and nice decor. The bathroom was a little dated but nothing to be concerned about. We found that the corridors looked really dated and we missed having a pool which would be the only thing to make us stay elsewhere. We ate buffet breakfast on our last day and thought it was very very good, loads of choice and hot. Although i'd say b&b probably not worth it when so many restaurants nearby. We enjoyed Sydney and the NYE experience will last a life time. This hotel was lovely and we would happily stay here again, if they added a small pool then it really would be a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: lisawickedfairy
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful suite overlooking darling harbour and excellent service during our stay. Excellent breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good but too expensive, esp with extras”
Reviews.Author: boston6_8guy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sydney Sheraton Four Points previously, and it's a good hotel, and this time was a good experience. BUT, they annoyed the heck out of us with their many fees. It costs money to use the office center, the breakfast was good but hugely expensive, and then the rooms aren't cheap either. The hotel is nicely located in Darling Harbour, but there's lots more of Sydney that's worth exploring beyond this area. If you want a great hotel that's spotless and easy, and close to tourist interests, this is a fantastic choice. Just be ready for lots of fees!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is only OK, but location is great!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaInSeattleWA
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights here and selected the Four Points because we had a corporate discount. With the discount we felt that the hotel was fair, but at regular rates we would have had issues. The Concierge and front desk areas are very nice and the hotel couldn't have a better location- you can walk almost anywhere that you'd like to go. Our room was the problem. Part of the issue could be that they were fully booked (which they said they were) and had to give us one of their poorer rooms. Our room had a nice city view, but was very cramped. The TV looked pretty old and the volume was inconsistent from channel to channel. The bathroom was our biggest issue. The fan didn't work and the tile around the tub showed signs of mildew and mold (both around the tub surround and where the tile met the ceiling. We complained, but the hotel desk said they couldn't do anyhting and would look at the whole room after we left. We also came back one day to find that the cleaning staff had changed the bed without putting full sheets back on. I liked the athletic facility and equipment, but it lacks a pool which I'm used to elsewhere. Overall I think that the experience was average. We would stay again in a pinch, but would hope for a bathroom in better condition.

Reviews.Title: “expensive and inferior to other choices”
Reviews.Author: BHinAUS
Reviews.Content: I am a SPG member, booked through them, and the best rate I got was $300+/night. I would rank this hotel a 4.5 Star, not a luxury hotel, and in some cases outlandish prices. The lobby restaurant has a $50/person buffet lunch, and takes advantage of few hotels within its vicinity. The line to check out in the morning took over 20 minutes of waiting before I opted to deposit a checkout envelope in a box by the elevator. Weeks later I had to ring them to gt a copy of it, as it was never sent to me. While the hotel is well kept, it is not the best location compared to less expensive, better quality hotels. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a place”
Reviews.Author: Loulou585
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on Darling Harbour, we had a fantastic view of the harbour. The rooms are large and clean and a good price. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is within easy walking distance of various restaurants, cafes, bars and shops. Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel earlier this year and enjoyed our stay. This hotel is in a fantastic location near Darling Harbour which I would recommend to anyone staying in Sydney .....we also stayed in the Rocks later on in the month on the same trip & we thoroughly enjoyed Darling Harbour. The hotel itself has a businessy feel but the rooms are lovely .. very spacious, very comfortable bed and overall a nicely decorated room. Breakfast was also lovely though no time was wasted in starting to clear away the buffet when the time came. We stayed for almost a week and then came back to Sydney for a night and stayed again and this time were upgraded to a harbour view which was lovely (though I wouldnt necessarily pay a lot extra for this). To be upgraded a tad was nice though. Overall I would recommend this hotel & I would def recommend Darling Harbour as an area to stay. It is still in walking distance to the very heart of Sydney as well as having a great buzz all to itself! And there were some lovely restaurants there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: dianews
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2007. Great Service by reception, concierge and restaurant staff. Nice room overlooking Darling Harbour. There is a walkway adjacent to the hotel, to Darling Harbour so you don't have to negotiate the roads, however, there are steps, so this would be difficult for disabled people or those with toddlers. We had a room on the 7th floor and it was very quiet, the bed was the most comfortable one that we stayed in on our tour of Australia and New Zealand. The breakfast is expensive but there is a good choice. However, there are restaurants in the harbour serving cheaper options. It is about a 20 minute walk to the bridge, but you can take a ferry for about $5 (aus). The restaurant is expensive, but there are plenty of other restaurants in the harbour to choose from and the hotel pub serves good cheap meals

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fego
Reviews.Content: Both myself and my wife stayed here for 2 nights in December 2006. Our room was a suite overlooking Darling Harbour. The room was clean, comfortable, very large and luxurious. We found the hotel employees to be very courteous and attentative. The big selling point of this hotel is it's close proximity to all sights in Sydney and the views over Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Good but seriously crowded”
Reviews.Author: Rianbkk
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a rather sterile environment and it seems all charm has been lost on typical 3 star amenities. As a businessman who stays (or rather stayed) here weekly I have to say that the busloads of tourists that make up 80% of the hotel's visitors can make your stay a little frustrating. The restaurant/breakfast area can be full in seconds when another group lands, and the waiting times to catch an elevator can be daunting. High school kids kept me awake most part of the night as the plumbing is poorly isolated and you can hear people taking showers throughout the night. Hey, we were all young and all had those crazy school or holiday outings, but it just doesn't seem to glue well with people who need rest and tranquility. Asked about this, the receptionist told me that these groups are now the biggest customer base and that they should be expected to be there most of the year. Beds are excellent but the ongoing noise at night is not compensated by that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Concierge service”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeTina
Reviews.Content: First I need to say this was booked thru spg.com using a cash and points offer. This was my first stop on my first trip outside the US. I had several email conversations with the hotel prior to arriving since we were arriving on 7 AM flight after 14 hours of flying I wanted us to have a room - so I had prebook the night before to guarantee we would have one okay no problem there. Check was easy, fast - we showered and headed downstairs to breakfast what - $40 for a breakfast buffet are you insane - obviously they are - Needless to say we skipped eating in the hotel after we had spent majot bucks on a morning meal. The room - The room was a good size. We had two twin beds, tv had some channels but not nearly enough we had a lot of news we were on vacation didn't need 3 sports channels and 4 news channels. The bath room had mold in the shower - that disappointed me. They have stuff to clean that - why couldn't Sheraton buy some?! Front desk after check in I used them a couple of more times - currency conversion - great - no fee and gave a very decent exchange rate. The next was to ask about access to the business center. They said I could get in anytime with my room key but need a card to get on line and I could buy the card in 30 or 60 min increments - but of course they were out and no one could get them for me. Huh? Out? The largest hotel in Australia can not connect a guest to the internet thru their own business center? Disappointing. Location: It is not in the smack center of everything but its within a 10 min walk, bus or ferry ride to Circular Quay where everything is centered. Darling Harbour is becoming more the entertainment are with lots of restaurants/cafes just behind teh hotel as well as the ferry. The concierge was the best I have ever dealt with - they helped me make an itinerary well ahead of my arrival and helped me make changes when I arrived. They always gave good advice. Several cafes are good just out of the hotels to the left two doors down is good as well as one just about 5 doors up King street. Overall its a good hotel to stay for price/location and the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: Suomessa
Reviews.Content: Good location on Darling Harbour, its restaurants and sights (e.g. aquarium, nature exhibition, maritime museum) with easy access to the central business district. Hotel is an older building, renovated and well maintained. Price is about what you would expect to pay for the area and class of hotel. Rooms on the harbourside have a nice view, and each room has an iron and ironing board, which is one less hassle. The rooms aren't massive, but they are adequate. Breakfast is pricey but nice and the coffee is excellent. Internet is not included in the hotel rate, so add another AUD 25 if you need it. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Keep out, 4 star for nothing”
Reviews.Author: mrz-anderson
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in June this year. Paid 220 AUD per night for 1 bedroom with ocean view. Seriously, I didn't really want to stay at this hotel however, I used redeemed one night from my frequent flyer points, therefore I had no choice. First, the room, it was so small, there was no room to walk and no room to put two ppl's baggage. Second, Ocean view - wow....all I saw was the aquarium and the freeway - and slightly glimpse of the water...very not worth the extra $60aud to upgrade to that...stick with city view. Location - not entirely close to china town, but it was close to the darling habour, therefore, don't eat at the hotel's one and only restaurant. We ate it for buffet breakfast and do no recommend it to anyone. The service wasn't so great either, we waited 20 mins to check-in. My vote was based on the price, location and the rating of this hote, just doesn't match - especially the room just did not meet the 4 star standard, it was so crowded. We knew the location wasn't the very best but we were praying for the room to be spacious and at least have some views. Not worth staying at this hotel for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “The Pefect Place In A Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: BKLYNVEGAS
Reviews.Content: I can not stress enough how this hotel is situated in the perfect location, in the heart of Darling Harbor. It is close to everything. I spent two months researching where to stay and after being in Sydney and seeing all the hotels that I considered, I am thrilled that I decided on the Four Points. Other considerations include the Four Seasons, Stamford & the Shangri La which are all beautiful places but I wanted location. The hotel itself is a bit old but still well maintained. Do get a room with a harbor view, EXCELLANT. I can say that this hotel gave excellant customer service, probably the only place in Sydney. We did have a car because we spent 4 days in the suburbs with friends & family, but when we went to the Four Points (the ideal location to see everything),the car spent another 4 days in the parking lot, unfortunately at $35 Aus a day so that wasn't great. We then went to the Blue Mountains after our 4 days there so we did not want to get rid of the car. (get a GPS system for your car, it's helps ALOT) Winter Time In Australia (we went in August) has the perfect weather, it really is not cold. (I live in the desert) Want to see the typical tourist places? get the combined packages, it's so much more affordable. Go to PADDY'S MARKET on the weekend, it's worth going there to buy gifts, it's so much more affordable there. I found everything that I bought around town,there at PADDY'S MARKET, MUCH CHEAPER> Great hotel, ideal location, great customer service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: tourleaderAuckland
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a fantastic location. We booked a deluxe king harbour view and a twin harbour view. Rooms were very nice, good size, modern decor, comfortable beds, in room safe and nice bathroom. King room had a balcony. The King bed is a super king size and was very comfortable. This hotel is literally at the waters edge at Darling Harbour and is about 100metres max away from the water. The view from the room is fantastic. The harbour is a lovely sight. The service was very good, we used conceirge service, room service and we also had breakfast at the buffet. It was a bit pricy but the buffet was very nice. At Darling harbour you have the Aquarium and Wildllife World which were both worth going to. I was impressed with the Aquarium. The harbour is lined with a lot of restaurants and I would recommend Blue Fish (4 breakfast0, Blackbird, South Steyne floating restaurant, Dock Hotel. You can catch the Monorail into town or take a 10min max walk which takes you to Pitt Street which is the main shopping district. I would definetely stay at this hotel again. It is a very nice hotel and you are treated well by the staff who are also friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: aerostef
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location: just a few steps from Darling Harbour. I arrived early in the morning from the UK and they had a room ready for me at around 9am. The room itself is fairly standard if not a bit dated. I had a non-smoking room, which was a former smoking room (it seem sto happen a lot in hotels these days), so the curtains had that awful smell. If you come from the airport, take the train to Town Hall, from there it's 10 minutes walk downhill to the hotel. Great place to stay if you can find a good rate, and perfect for Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, shame there's no pool!”
Reviews.Author: juicyblue
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last night, as we were attending a concert in the city and didn't want to mission home. It was my first stay in a Sheraton hotel. As we have a few other stays booked at sheraton hotels later this year, i joined the starwood program. If the service we got was a result of that, then it is well worth the 5 min spent filling out the online form! I booked directly through the starwood site. The only request i made was, as it was my partner's birthday, for a room with a view on the higher floors. Not only did we get this, when we got to the room, there was a bottle of champagne and a box of chocolates waiting for us. I thought that was a lovely touch. Room was very clean & bright. Bed was huge and fantastically comfortable. Bathroom was OK, a bit small but again, very clean (and ultimately, it does the job! Unless you're after a spa bath!). View was AMAZING. Straight out over Darling Harbour, across to the casino. We had the buffet breakfast included in our room rate, & it was far & away one of the better hotel buffets i've seen. Huge selection of juices, loads of different foods (the scrambled eggs were my personal favourite....& the blue vein cheese & crackers...so decadent at 0730 in the morning!) Staff were very polite & helpful. Over all a great stay. I have high hopes for our stays in other Sheraton hotels in the USA later this year! Only bad point - Such a shame that they don't have a spa or swimming pool. The hotel is a perfect location for rooftop heated pool!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: blaz1
Reviews.Content: i booked a city view king room, got to the hotel at 10am - they gave us a room straight away & upgraded us to a harbour view - which has absolutely fantastic views of darling harbour! loved our stay - concierge was very helpful & friendly - reception staff were also very nice - & they even gave us a 12.30 pm check out! rooms are very clean & the bed is soooo comfortable! This was our 3rd visit to the hotel and we we havent been dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: julieandliam
Reviews.Content: excellent location room okay food was really expensive and not very good at all staff were helpful and conceirge were very good .the best part of the hotel was its location which was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great location for family tourists”
Reviews.Author: RichRichRich
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Four Points Darling Harbour. This time our young kids were around, and Sydney was the highlight of their trip downunder. Located right on the water, it is extremely convenient for both tourists and business stays - right near the IMAX, Aquarium, restaurants, etc, and only 10 minutes walk from my Sydney office, too. Not as well appointed as many Sydney hotels, but quite serviceable, especially by american standards. I've always found the help here quite good. The restaurant in the lobby is nothing special, but the pub is friendly and comfortable, with typical pub fare.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base to explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: beach_specialists
Reviews.Content: The Four Points by Sheraton Darling Harbour has the ideal location for a first time or return visitor to Sydney. It is a few minutes on foot to the Sydney Aquarium, Sydney Wildlife World, Darling Harbour shops/restaurants/IMAX/museums, Cockle Bay Wharf, Chinatown & the CBD. BOOKING We made our reservation with the hotel direct and they were always efficient and professional in their correspondence. It was all in order on arrival. ARRIVAL/DEPATURE On arriving at Sydney airport we took a taxi to the hotel. It was lunch time and cost around AUD$55 including a toll fee. On departing the hotel to return to the airport for our flight out it was early afternoon and the friendly taxi driver asked us if we wanted to take the fast or slow way, on asking the difference he said 10 minutes extra on the slow. Since we werenâ€™t in a rush we took this option and it cost AUD$31.00. So if one isnâ€™t in a rush on arriving/departing for the extra 5 minutes it ended up being it was a good AUD$20.00 saving. It is also possible to arrive by train direct from the airport terminal and no change of train is required. Ideal if there isnâ€™t a lot of luggage. The train station to alight at is Town Hall and a short 5 minute walk to the hotel. RECEPTION Reception was well staffed and promptly checked us in. We had arrived a few hours before the hotel check in time of 1500 and were given key cards to our room early. Check out is at 1100 and it was extended by a few hours at no additional cost. On their website there is a fee of AUD $15 per hour up until 1800 advertised so it was very lucky we didnâ€™t have this charged as we didnâ€™t know about it until after we had asked to leave the room later for our flight timing. Nothing seemed to be a problem when asking reception and always professional. It was an impressive overall experience with the staff at this hotel. ROOM We stayed in a Harbour View Room with a fantastic view on the Darling Harbour area with floor to ceiling glass. There was a good small mini bar selection and good basic range of amenities provided in the room. Additional ones were available at a call to housekeeping. The bathroom had a shower combined with the bathtub and it was a good standard but wouldnâ€™t deem the bathroom we had luxurious. It was a very comfortable room, nice and clean. The main feature of the room is the view that made us very pleased with our choice. FACILITIES There is a tour desk, business centre, concierge desk and a 24 hour gym. Unfortunately there was no swimming pool. This hotel can afford to not have a pool though as a drawcard due to the perfect location it offers. There is an overpass footbridge connecting to the hotel & then some stairs that serves as a short cut to arrive at the Cockle Bay Wharf/Darling Harbour area. There is a lobby bar, a pub and a restaurant however the immediate area also boasts some great places to go for a drink or have dinner. We only had breakfast at the hotel and dined in the area. AREA The options are endless on things to do in the area of this hotel. And the wonderful thing for visitors is that a car isnâ€™t required. Most can be done on foot or taxis/buses/monorails/ferries and trains as additional options. The ferry stop is a short walk from hotel that goes to the Circular Quay area (the Rocks, Sydney Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge). It is about a 15-20 minute walk down to this area or 3 stops away on the subway. The city centre with the Tower is just 5-10 minutes up towards the QVB/Pitt Street mall and the famous Darling Harbour & Cockle Bay Wharf area with a good selection of bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: setcarp
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, but everything was expensive. The internet was $25au a day. All the shops and cafes you want are right a short walk away. There is the City Laundry a few blocks away and a bunch of bars close by. The Opera house is a long walk away, but it is a very nice walk. the Harbour view is much better than the city view. My room is looking into a parking garage. Housekeeping could not figure out what the Do Not Disturb signs meant until the front desk was notified and only cleaned when the sign was removed. Health club is wonderful. Front desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: TheDobsons
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note to thank the staff at Four Points for an absolutely wonderful stay. The room, view, and service were absolutely amazing. If you are looking to stay in Sydney and want a comfortable, affordable room with superb water views, this is the place. We have family coming over from the UK later in the year, and will be recommending Four Points very strongly to them. Regards Grant & Nic

Reviews.Title: “good time”
Reviews.Author: maureen001
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were a bit disappointed in our room, we asked to be moved and we were moved to a wonderful suite on floor 14 we had walk-in wardrobes massive bathroom clean bedding everyday and plenty of tea/coffee etc, the bar was very good the barman was charming, the lads on the concierge desk were more than helpful and it was in a great position, just about 3 mins walk to the harbour to pick up the ferry, we enjoyed our stay very much and the girls on reception were very helpful as well, would stay again

Reviews.Title: “hotel in superb location.”
Reviews.Author: bremic
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the four points for 4 days in march after a 12 day cruise ,the hotel is in a wonderful location overlooking darling harbour,we had an harbourside view room that gave us a n excellent view of the activities going on in darling harbour which was spectacular at night The hotel was 1st class with a full range of amenities to be had ,the staff were very courteous and helpful.the CBD is within walking distance with plenty of quality restaurants close by would recommend a stay anytime. Brenda and Michael Booth Leeds U.K.

Reviews.Title: “2/4 at the Four Points Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Swig
Reviews.Content: Highlights were service, location, Lowlights were over priced for food and drinks. "City side" rooms are awful and look out onto a busy street - definately try and get the harbour view. Just being a Starwood member doesn't seem to make any difference.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: rcasey
Reviews.Content: We were happy with our five day stay at the Four Points in Sydney. Our bed was very comfortable and we had a lovely view of Darling Harbour, which the hotel upgraded us to without request (probably due to membership in their Starwood program) The Conceirge was very helpful, esp when one of our bags were mis-delivered by the Super Shuttle to another passenger and immediately drove to pick it up herself. The location of the hotel was convenient to everything...and easy walk or ferry ride to everything. Avoid the breakfast buffet...very overpriced for quality of food. There's a cafe across the street that is much better for much less.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but a few little things.....”
Reviews.Author: cholling
Reviews.Content: Our room was large with a huge huge bed. Furniture a bit shabby. Had a City View room unfortunately (our choice due to price!). Took ages to get our bags delivered to the room - and had to call and chase twice. I guess that's what you get with a hotel that is so large. It was an extremely busy hotel. Was really disappointed with the bathroom - really basic toiletries, small bath and rancid shower curtain! The worst thing was that the bath hadn't been cleaned properly and appeared to have specks of blood coloured substance on it and also some hairs in it. The toilet ran constantly once it was flushed and we had to have it fixed twice! I let the duty manager know of our little problems and he gave us a free breakfast in the hotel restaurant.
