That was delicious - can highly recommend it! Went to a lovely restaurant nearby called Eat City - also highly recommend this, the Tasting Menu with wine is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: makawaobadgirl
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the accomodations. The hotel was in my view a 5 star hotel with an excellent location. I had a very pleasant stay. The room very roomy, with all the amenities needed for a comfortable stay. I loved the location, being so close to Darling Harbour and all the attractions, ferries, etc. I would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “great views”
Reviews.Author: frontline
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights at the beginning of February and we had a great time. The view over Darling Harbour was amazing. We found the staff very helpful. We had a breakfast and an evening meal in the restaurant and although this was alittle pricey it was good quality. The location on Darling Harbour is also excellent and affords easy access to the centre. We were also quite happy to walk to the bridge and the Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “great room, great view”
Reviews.Author: peppy5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb 2007. Took a non-Sheraton shuttle bus from the airport for 10 AUD. My wife and I arrived at 8:30 AM and our room was not available yet (reg check-in is at 2:00pm). We were told that we had to wait about two hours for our room to be cleaned, which was really good. We were given keys to the fitness centre and found out they have excellent shower facilities there (individual shower with bathroom, not like a locker room with multiple stalls). We left our suitcases with concierge and took a well awaited shower after our 15 hour journey to Sydney. The fitness centre is excellent on the second floor, it has many treadmills, bikes and a universal gym. There are no free weights there but they do have a rowing machine along with many TVs. We got our room keys early around 10 AM and went up to the 7th floor which is a Starwood Preferred Guest only floor. We became Starwood members only days earlier and itâ€™s a free service. We loved our room as we got upgraded for free (we had requested that) to a beautiful harbour view room for AUS 160 a night with a king size bed. We would like to say that our stay there was excellent; we didnâ€™t eat at the restaurants so we canâ€™t comment on that. We called for a couple of things from our room and they were very good at using our names on the phone and prompt in providing what we wanted. The room has an in-room safe and mini bar. The room was very good although the bathroom was not amazing, a tub that was a bit small but great water pressure. We were provided with a paper in the morning and you can grab some apples in the lobby â€“ not sure if it was only on the Starwood member floor though. The location was great, close to the Sydney Aquarium, Australian National Maritime Museum and Cockle Bay/Darling Harbour. Town Hall train/subway station is a close 10 minute walk where there is great shopping along with a Woolworthâ€™s. If you go toward George Street/King Street, there is a Coles which is comparable to a Woolworthsâ€™s. Also, it was easy to catch a taxi at the front of the hotel, with help from the hotel staff. Concierge was kind and knowledgeable and they provided us with a great free map. We did request late check-out from reception but since they were fully booked they couldnâ€™t give it to us â€“ we did keep our bags at the concierge for a few hours after we checked out, which was a nice free service. We would definitely stay here again if the price was right and the price we paid was definitely right.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT Sheraton quality”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bugged
Reviews.Content: I am an SPG member and expect a certain quality from the hotel chain I most frequently use. This property is definitely not up to the usual Sheraton standard and is massively overpriced. I stayed for 3 nights in February but very nearly did not make it past the first. This was my first stay at this establishment. On arrival I was ignored by the concierge, even though he clearly saw me arrive and then struggle to load heavy suitcases from the taxi onto one of his trolleys that I personally had to retrieve. He didn't offer to assist until all the hard work was done and I was half way to reception. Reception then advised me that I had been upgraded due to high occupancy, but I was allocated exactly the room I had booked and overpaid for. The room was reasonably sized and appointed, but definitely not to Sheraton standards, and was well overdue for a refurbishment. The bathroom was tiny and poorly appointed. The room had just been cleaned and smelt like a chemical factory - it took more than an hour of airing before it was even habitable. Houskeeping advised that the same highly scented cleaning products were used in all rooms, so there would be no benefit in changing. At 10 minutes to 6pm I went to the restaurant to book a table for dinner later that evening, but I (and 2 other couples) were totally ignored by the staff until 6pm, when I presume the restaurant officially opens (however there were no signs to this effect). The Maitre d' came to the desk we were waiting at several times over the 10 minutes but didn't even have the decency to acknowledge those waiting until exactly 6pm. I ordered a Lamb dish from room service the next night, but was delivered what looked like, tasted like, and met the menu description of the beef steak dish. I contacted room service to query this and was forcefully assured that there was no question that I had been delivered the Lamb. The next night I placed exactly the same order and to my surprise (not), I received a totally different meal which looked and tasted like lamb. The above may seem like reasonably trivial matters, but they demonstrate a total disregard for the level of customer service one should expect from an establishment bearing the Sheraton name and charging the tariffs that they do. I will definitely cross this hotel off my Sydney stay list.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and base for exploring Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ozzyvirgin
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with this hotel. We had a Darling Harbour view and the room was comfortable and clean with good beds and bathroom. The location is great for seeing and getting around all of Sydney. We were there for 5 nights in November and found that quite often the pub attached to the hotel was not open the usual pub hours you would expect which was a shame, but probably a little out of season when we went. Staying here, You are right on top of Darling Harbour with all its bars, restaurants and sight seeing. You are within easy walking distance to the Rocks, Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Shopping, Sky Tower, etc. We bought Explorer tickets from the Quay which enabled us to a morning, afternoon and evening cruise, ferries, plus free travel on city and beach (red and blue) bus routes for three days. May seem alot to pay out in one hit (about Â£40 each), but in hindsight if you plan your days well this is definitely the best way to see as much of Sydney as you can. There is a bus stop at the bottom of the steps at the back the hotel. To be honest, we didn't spend an awful amount of time in the hotel, but it was a very nice hotel to come back to you after a day or night out. The concierge were always polite and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, in an Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BillF
Reviews.Content: This hotel overlooks Darling Harbour and is a 10 minute walk to the Sydney Opera House. It is close to everything you want to see. The rooms are well done, staff is very helpful, and rates were competative.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed with the four points”
Reviews.Author: ozzysid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the four points on our tour of oz, for two nights on the start of our hols. and was most impressed with the rooms,staff , and on our final leg we stayed for another two nights this time being upgraded to a bayside view which was beaufiful it has easy access to the harbour and is very nice for a walk ,and plenty of restraunts for every taste

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: keznscud
Reviews.Content: Great location. We booked a Darling Harbour view room and were not disappointed. The view was wonderful. The room was nicely decorated. It was a lot smaller than we had expected and the noise from adjoining room showers and the hall noise was louder than we have experienced in good hotels. The staff were professional...but not friendly. However, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: abbache
Reviews.Content: Usually Starwood is my favorite chain, but this Sheraton is a dud. Hotel staff were average... we had to ask several times for housekeeping to put a sheet on the bed (for some reason, all they kept putting on was a comforter and it wasn't always "clean", and we had to call four times for our mini-bar to be cleared out so we could use the fridge. The concierges were sometimes ok, but many times they kept telling us to ask one of the others that would be on site the next day (why hire concierges that don't know where things are?) and there was on that was less than competant. (Very disappointing.) The location was good... near Darling Harbor, so that was nice. The room was "clean-ish," but I just didn't get the feeling that it was well-kept. If you stay here, stay on the Harbor side, the view is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: eschuetz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The room was modern, clean, and had a great view. Spend the extra few dollars to get the harbour view...it is worth it. The location is great for walking around Darling Harbour and is only a 15 minute walk to the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ALJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and thought the location was excellent. It's 20 minutes walk to the Sydney Opera House and 5-10 minutes walk to where the main shops are. The room we had was lovely with a balcony overlooking Darling Harbour. I would recommend this hotel providing you get a harbour view.

Reviews.Title: “Four points”
Reviews.Author: KD121
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 Nights, Found the price of food was a bit high and don't use the mimi unless u have a credit card!. Nothing against the hotel great location right in Darling Harbour easy access to all sydney, either by ferry or by bus. Great pubs and food outlets near by if u want to eat out. We found the best priced food was in Star City casino across the brigde, all u do is become a member and get a great discount on food well worth doing even if u don't gamble.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel. great location!”
Reviews.Author: shayd
Reviews.Content: hate to be predictable ...but this is in a great location. staff are friendly and efficient although check out queues were a bit long (mostly because of a troublesome man who had no working credit card and yet still assumed he could move on regardless!) a good base to explore this city..my wife and i stayed there as part of a wedding anniversary trip....the porters etc were so nice and we were up graded to a suite which was absolutely beautiful. we were also provided with a botlle of bubbly and chocs.and a card! beautiful touches! id have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for visitors....only drawback ,if it is one, is that the front bar is quite quiet.....but who cares...uve the whole of sydney to explore! we spent 6 nites there...and while that may have been slightly too long for a stay in sydney in our opinion it is certainly a thumps up for this hotel

Reviews.Title: “I feel redundant saying this hotel is in a great location, but it's true!”
Reviews.Author: Care824
Reviews.Content: The Four Points is right in Darling Harbour overlooking the Sydney Aquarium. It is convenient to the public ferry system, and is a longish but do-able walk from Circular Quay and the Rocks. Our room was on the harbour side with excellent views, but this side of the hotel is also next to an expressway, so it can be a little noisy. Internet fees in the business center were maybe a little expensive, but there is an internet cafe across the street. Parking is also expensive (AU$30/day!! as of Sep 2006) but at least the garage allows you to come and go as you please unlike daily parking in typical city garages. Aside from that, the room was at the better end of the comfortable scale as far as hotels go and was very tidy. The staff was friendly and we paid a reasonable price for staying right in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Greta Location”
Reviews.Author: Markie2
Reviews.Content: Took a group of 22 for a business conference in Sydney. Hotel excellent location easy walk to Darling Harbour via foot bridge and easy access to other areas by train or Taxi Worked out bery well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view and comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: travelbug_england
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a harbour view room at this hotel and this had a lovely view of the harbou which was filled with boats as there was a festival on. The bed was one of the most comfortable we have stayed in at a hotel. We found the room service menu slightly more expensive to others that we have used. A newspaper was delivered to the door every morning complimentary. Overall the hotel was above average and every service we used was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy hotel with superb location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Powerpooh
Reviews.Content: We were on honeymoon and stayed in the four points for 4 nights at the end of August. Before we arrrived we realised that our travel agent had booked us a city room so when we got to the hotel we asked about an upgrade. It cost us $30 extra per night for a harbour view. We decided to go for it. The room was immaculate, with a HUGE bed (I didn't think beds came in that size!) lots of cosy cushions, a massive TV, fridge, mini bar, safe, hairdryer, not to mention a fantastic view of Darling Harbour. The maids service was second to none, the room was always well made up. The check in staff were very helpful as were the consierge staff. One member of staff who sticks in my mind as going the extra mile was Tony (he was on the front door). We wanted to go to Bondi Beach and were recommended to take a taxi, however Tony asked if we were feeling adventurous and wanted to save some money. Why not. He told us to get the tube, then change at Bondi Junction and get the public bus to the beach, he even told us how much the fares would be and what platforms the tubes were on. The hotel catters for the business world and there were lots of "suits" about and to be honest sometimes we did feel out of place being the tourist, but we were not treated any differently by the hotel staff. The restaurant prices are steep, but there are loads of nice places to eat at Darling Harbour or if you like steak and ribs there is a Tony Romas a few doors down. The hotel is only about 4 blocks from the Queen Victoria buildings which have the most fabulous array of shops and boutiques (the tube station is also here too). The first few days in Sydney we got on the Ferry boats to take us to cirular quay, but we realised it wasn't that far to walf. All in all its a great hotel. The staff are great, the hotel is clean and when we were checking out we didn't have to pay our suppliment for a harbour view as they upgraded us for free for being on honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It! --Orange County, CA, USA”
Reviews.Author: crazyformo
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation to Australia (Sydney & Melbourne) through Qantas Vacations. We chose this hotel in Sydney because we wanted to be close enough to the city center but also wanted to be right by the harbour. We stayed at the hotel for a week in July. Our flight from Los Angeles arrived early in the morning and we were at the hotel by 8am. They couldn't check us in right away because our room wasn't ready yet so they told us it will be ready at 10am. No problem, we just left our luggage there and we walked down the street and got breakfast at this little deli nearby with reasonable prices for breakfast and sandwiches rather than getting breakfast at the Corn Exchange restaurant at the hotel. After breakfast, we went back to the hotel and lounged around by one of the many sitting areas around the lobby of the hotel and then we checked in at 10am as promised. The room was a good size room and we had two double beds and a sofa bed. The room had plenty of space for 3 people to move around even with 6 luggage laying around the room. The room was nicely equipped with a mini bar, tv, coffee maker, safe, closet, iron, desk, etc. The bathroom was big and had all the amenities we needed (hair dryers, toilletries, international plugs, etc.). The room was clean and housekeeping always kept our room tidy and in order by the time we get back to our hotel later in the day. The view from our room was fantastic! We had a view of the harbor and the bridge, and right across the Maritime Museum. We later realized we can actually also see the sea lion house in the Sydney Acquarium from our hotel room. The room was quiet, we didn't hear noise from our neighbors. The people at the reception area were so friendly and accommodating. The people at the concierge were also very friendly, accommodating and were just so helpful in getting us the information we needed and also some discounts to places, tours, etc. that we weren't aware of. The hotel is so close to the Victoria shopping center, you can just walk up the hill and get there. We would just walk around the corner to get to the harbor and catch a ferry going to The Rocks and the Sydney Opera House. If you're in a group of 3 or 4 people, I suggest to take a cab to get to the Rocks area or even the Sydney Bridge area since taking the ferry (+ walk) to get to that area didn't really save much money, sometimes it actually cost more to pay for single tickets to take the ferry. Downtown is not far at all, even taking a cab isn't as heavy on the wallet either. But there is plenty of good public transport to get you around wherever you need to be (ferry, bus, tram). The tram is just up the hill from the hotel and you can catch that to get you to places as well. There's a little store in front of the hotel where you can get some goodies and snacks and bring them back to your hotel and use the mini fridge to store soda, water, etc. and should help save money from having to use the mini-bar stuff. All in all, we really loved our stay at this hotel and we'd go back and stay there again. My friends and I are quite picky with hotels so we were quite pleased with Four Points Sheraton's location, room, and the overall service of the hotel. Liked: Room, Staff, Location Disliked: Food prices at the hotel restaurant can be steep (but so are most restaurants at any hotel for that matter) Tips: Eat breakfast at a deli nearby the hotel, cheaper! Also, take a trip to Manly Beach if you have time, quite picturesque and the view from the ride on the ferry on the way there is pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great view -”
Reviews.Author: R.Cote
Reviews.Content: We had a Harbour View room wich is the best place to be in that hotel. The room was not very clean when we arrived and I went to the reception to complaint. When we returned from our walk outside, the room had been cleaned and the hotel had put a good bottle of wine on ice in the room to excuse themselves for the situation. It was nice and not expected. Breakfeast buffet is expansive but really good. Lot of business customers and japanse tourists in the hotel. Room are not silent proof and you can hear next room shower from yours. Overall I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Four Points, Average Points”
Reviews.Author: ajtripadvsisor
Reviews.Content: Being close to the city center, the main clientele is business people although when I was here (19 Sept. 2006) there was big Japanese wedding. The recpetionist has a smile when you check in but I have a feeling that they are overworked; every time I passed by the area, there was always a line at recpetion. The bell service is good. Room is just large enough to enjoy it for reading with a beautiful view of the harbor. The rooms are noisy as the walls are not solid enough to block out the noise from your neighbor next door or several doors down. The bathroom is adequate with a tub and a shower. The lobby and the surrounding areas have nice comfortable chairs to use while you browse the internet wirelessly. The coffee shop at the lobby is always busy with people lining up for breakfast. The wait isn't too bad, though. At other times, there is almost always a table readily available.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel for leisure clients”
Reviews.Author: Roberto79
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel at 18.30 on a week night (this August - stayed two nights) and were told that our room was not ready yet (check in time at the hotel is 14.00). We got given some coupons for a drink at the bar and were given a room at 19.30. We had requested and paid a Harbour view (the receptionist was actually on the verge of giving me a city view but I think she noticed I was extremely angry at the time and somehow found one harbour view available). Nice views and a good sized room and an extremely comfortable bed...It has a very corporate look to the whole hotel. We had opted out of breakfast which was a good decision in the end as the queues for the buffet were outrageous! Plenty of breakfast places nearby. We thought the hotel was mainly for corporate clients and did not feel extremely welcoming for leisure guests. I would not recomend this hotel for tourists wanting to spend a few days in Sydney as it has not got a relaxed feel to the hotel and one can get better 4* hotels for the price (eg. Radisson Plaza Sydney, great hotel!).

Reviews.Title: “Big bed, tiny room in this soul-less, ex Japanese owned hotel”
Reviews.Author: olig
Reviews.Content: View from the room was great though. Room was noisy. Ok if you are a heavy sleeper, don't mind hearing the people next door take a shower, run a bath or listen to guests in the corridor etc. I suppose.. Not very close to major public transport - Ok if you don't mind walking, solely using the limited & expensive, touristy monorail or have little luggage or like using taxis. But then, it IS Darling harbour after all! Staff were, how can I put it, without wanting to use an insulting word or being impolite? The term 'surly', feels apt. Despite pre-paying 100% of the non-refundable rate including ALL taxes on the hotel's own website, months before arriving, they tried to sting me when I checked out. I was told that they had made a 'mistake' on the hotel rate & I needed to pay the difference... So be careful! Apparently, according to the receptionist I spoke to, it happens a lot. What seems like a good rate may not be if the hotel receptionists try and wangle more money out of you just as you are leaving. No mention was made of course when I checked-in of their 'mistake'. After a discussion with a manager, I was eventually advised that I would not have to pay for THEIR mistake. The breakfast room (which is actually in the lobby of the hotel) was chaotic with really long queues & over-priced. Better choice & more relaxing to eat at a nearby cafe. So, this was my first (& last) stay at a Four Points Hotel. Maybe I was just unlucky, but I wouldn't stay there again. There are plenty of other places to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Classy with a great location”
Reviews.Author: kennywah
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Four Points July 13-15, 2006 because she had points eligible for a free stay and we just payed for the second day. The hotel was very classy from the moment we stepped onto the property. Our flight from san francisco arrived in sydney around 7:30 am and they were able to check us in right away (normal check in time is in the afternoon). A nice long shower after a 15 hour flight was priceless. We had a double queen and our view was city side but we didn't really miss the harbor view because we were only in our rooms for sleeping and showering. The view only showed the parking garage across the street and a glimpse of Sydney Tower. The hotel is steps away from Darling Harbor which has many bars and restaurants. It is also on the west side of the central business district, well within walking distance of the botanical gardens, opera house, The Rocks, Chinatown, and Darling Harbor. The hotel has a restaurant on the ground floor which looked very nice. Prices were just that, pricey. Buffet lunch was over $30 AUD ($25) per person and dinner was $50 plus a la carte per person. With the amount of restaurants around, you had a much better deal walking around and finding a cuisine that fit you and your pocketbook better. During our 2 week trip, we were in Sydney on two different occasions with the first staying here at the Four Points. The second hotel we stayed at was the Metro Hotel on Pitt (300 Pitt Street). With half the price and only 2 blocks away, I thought the Metro was a better hotel pick in my opinion (read my review of that hotel). Overall, the Four Points is a very fine hotel. Very clean, quiet, and classy amenities and staff. You will not be disappointed. But with the higher price tag, I would choose the Metro Hotel on Pitt based on value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view”
Reviews.Author: tak2
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Sydney a week and Port Douglas . We went to watch our boys in the Saratoga High School Band perform in the Sydney Opera house. It was awesome. The Sheraton is in a great location that is walking distance to the Darling Harbor area. We were really fortunate since I booked the cheapest price through the Sheraton web site which is a city view and twin beds but we got upgraded to a harbor view and a king bed. The view was awesome!! Since it was the winter, maybe it is off season? I joined the free perferred guest program and maybe that helped? FYI, Port Douglas is the place to stay...forget about Cairnes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: North_England
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving we thought that this was just another 4* chain hotel. Nice enough rooms in a nice enough hotel. The location however was perfect. Right next to Darling Harbour with all of the restaurants and bars. Great location for sightseeing and not too far from the bridge. The thing that stands this hotel apart from just another hotel is the service. Upon arrival we had chilled champagne and chocolates waiting for us (it was our honeymoon). This was a great way to unwind after our transfer flight. The next morning we went to concierge to find out information about trips. I don't think we have ever met a more knowledgable concierge in all of our travels. Very helpful and friendly and made you feel really welcome. They booked all of our trips for us. They also found out that we were on our honeymoon and were more than sweet about it. Due to the fact that they had booked our trips they knew all of our comings and goings - so they arranged that on the night we got back from our bridgeclimb (do this at night it is amazing!) to have a selection of desserts sent up to the room waiting for us. Along with this a card signed by all of the concierge staff wishing us a wonderful trip and a happy marriage. It made it a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but better elsewhere for similar $$”
Reviews.Author: bundyone
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nites in a city view twin bedded room. The room was clean and promptly serviced each day. The staff were extremely helpful However, the down side was that the beds were a standard single and not king singles that you find in other 4 to 5 star hotels. the beds were not comfortable (pillows were plentiful and fine). Also, the rooms were a bit on the small size. I have always previously stayed at the Grace Hotel not far away and will probably go back to the grace next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: Dowlo
Reviews.Content: Planned a four week vacation to Australia and found trip advisor to be totally helpful to me, felt like I should share my experience. Hotel is great, great location, really comfortable beds, especially after flight from the UK. Darling Harbour is great for restaurants and bars and hotel is within 2 mins walk. Go to the Blue Mountains in Sydney and use Oz Trails for the trip - superb. Have a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel in business district”
Reviews.Author: SWB2807
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on business. Good quality hotel central to the business district and on the edge of Darlng Harbour with plenty of restaurants and bars. Ask for a harbour view (and insist on it being free - as they will concede eventually) as the view is superb. Good rates including breakfast (which is excellent). Would recommend this to anyone. Location is about 2 streets from the main tourist areas and a 20 minute walk from the old town.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 8 in the morning (after a 24hr flight from the UK) and were allowed to book-in strait away. This meant, after a long hot shower, we had a complete whole day in Sydney at the beginning of our holiday. The hotel is in a good position. Not for the views but for the fact that you are relativelly close to all that Sydney has to offer. The APT tour was going on when we visited and the players staying here included Serena Williams. All-in-all a very clean, comfortable, modern and reasonable priced hotel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: travelingfreak
Reviews.Content: A little late in writing this but friends and I stayed at this hotel for three days in December and thought it was great. Our room was small, but the location made up for it. Being right on the harbor was nice, but it was also an easy walk to most sights and had public transport very near by. If you can find a deal, we thought this was a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Deal for the Money”
Reviews.Author: rosky
Reviews.Content: We normally do not favour the Four Points across the world...but this hotel was great. We chose this hotel because it was a Starwood Property and it was located across the pedestrian bridge from my business meeting at the Novotel (twice the price)..but it was a great deal for the money. We had a room overlooking the Darling Harbour...and the view was great. Because the hotel is located on the city side...it makes it easy to walk everywhere. There are a lot of choices in sydney...but this is an excellent find. We ended up booking on Last Minute and got a room at 1/2 price of any hotel in the area. Not sure if it's new...but the room and hotel looked like it had just been refurbished. We even liked the little Armour Pub located on the premises. They had a walkway which went right onto the main hub of the Darling Harbour...and it was right on the pedestrian bridge for the other side of the harbour...

Reviews.Title: “Superb Concierge”
Reviews.Author: carlos501b
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed at the 4 Points for 7 nights between the 16th of April and the 23rd of April, 2006. Found the hotel excellent in every way. Great location, great service and good room. No complaints, at all. In particular, I'd like to praise the Concierge, Mr. Jeff Place, who was just fantastic. He went out of his way to help us relax and gave us excellent advise on where to go and what to do. Though the entire Concierge staff was very helpful, Jeff was just outstanding. I predict that this guy is going to go places ;-) (no pun intended). We would definitely stay at the 4 Points again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Four Points was just gorgeous. We were able to check in several hours early with no hassles at all. the concierge services were fantastic and went out of their way to ensure we had everything that we needed. the room was clean with great decor and the bed was devine... huge kings size which was like sleeping on a cloud. Eating and drinking at the hotel was a little pricey but think the same could be said of almost any sydney hotel. The location was beyond superb, with its own walkway onto the harbour. Could not have been happier with my choice, especially once I had looked around the harbour and compared this hotel to the others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, hotel poor”
Reviews.Author: AndrewD
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, found hotel to be expensive, tattly to tired, breakfast to be avoided - dreadful and VERY expensive - go to starbucks - or Subway on the harbour a 2 minute walk - and have a better breakfast with a better view and at 20% of the cost! Found the room "City view" onto noisy narrow street - no view - very dark - but size ok - bathroom looked very tired and needed updating. Might consider again for location if deal was right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Not Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Santorina
Reviews.Content: I did alot of research in finding a hotel to stay at since I do our company's travel and accommodation bookings. We were tossing up between 4 Points, Intercontinental and Shangri La and chose 4 Points because of the balcony, locality and reviews from Trip Advisor. The hotel and staff were nice enough but we were disappointed with our suite, which was a Cockle Bay suite with a balcony. As there were 3 of us, one utlised the sofa bed which was very small. The view was lovely but since we stayed at Quay West last time, much preferred the view of the Opera House. Darling Harbour is nice & esp if you have kids but to compare with Circular Quay, would prefer to stay there. We paid more for the suite at 4 Points than for a 2 bedroom at Quay West last year but got an amazing view and huge suite at Q.W. Also the sliding door at 4 Points was so noisy and hard to pull and you didnt have any chairs to be able to sit outside. We were also disappointed as I thought there would have been a nice late night bar with a view as hotels such as Shangri La and Intercontinental had. Although we have a child it was a child free weekend so we were hoping to "live" it up a bit. I also agree with another review on the shower facilities. For what you pay, rooms need a refurbishment. All in all, we were disappointed but for some I know its a great hotel and understand, just depends on what you like and prefer.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Darling Harbour!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Moved to the Four Points after staying at the Intercontinental to join up with a wedding party. I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were very clean and the beds were a nice help to my looming jet lag. I stayed in a harbour side room and suggest that because you will be looking at a building across the street otherwise. If you are traveling with kids you will find this an ideal location. The Aquarium is across the street next to many shops and cafes along the Harbour. If I was staying in Darling Harbour this would be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BayswaterBabe
Reviews.Content: Since we had paid for our room in advance (a cityside standard room), on arrival we were offered a fantastic preferential rate and upgraded to a deluxe room with a harbour view and balcony, sofa etc on the 10th floor. Shortly after we arrived in our room we were given a complementary bottle of champagne and a box of Lindt chocolates which was marvellous. The room was great, spotlessly clean with a very comfortable super king size bed. Not a massive bathroom but decent size, nice decor, large mirrors and good shower. The air conditioning was also good and not noisy as in some other hotels we've stayed in. A free copy of the Sydney Times was also delivered and left outside our room door each morning. Location is great for Darling Harbour (the Sydney Aquarium, National Maritime and Powerhouse museums are based here) which is about 100m away (the hotel has its own access walkway) and is also close to Chinatown and the CBD. There are no buses or trains which go directly past the hotel but we didn't mind walking and walked everywhere. The area felt safe even at 4am. Circular Quay (where the Opera House and most ferries go from) is around a 20 minute walk away (you can get a ferry from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay which takes 5 minutes but they don't run very often). The closest train station would probably be Town Hall which is around a 5-10 minute walk away, Central Station (for the Blue Mountains) was around a 15 minute walk away. The monorail is also very close. I agree that Darling Harbour isn't the best view in comparison to the Opera House but it was wonderful for the price we paid. The hotel has a gym overlooking the harbour (which we didn't use) and a business centre ($10 per hour). We did not eat or drink at the hotel so we couldn't comment on the hotel food. However we had no problem finding plenty of quality restaurants and bars in Darling Harbour and the nearby area. The hotel is busy and is obviously used frequently for business conferences but we did not experience any noise problems at all. All the staff we came into contact with were always friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights from 15th-19th March 2006. We arrived at 8am in the morning and our room was available. All the staff were very friendly and made our stay very welcoming. This is a first class quality hotel with the benefit of a wonderful location overlooking Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “If you like a standard, chain hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tokyo Shirokuma
Reviews.Content: Service at the front desk and concierge were fine and they seem to be hard-working. Nice view of a tourist developed harbor with lots of buildings, not much harbor. This is by no means as grand a view as you would get over the opera house, different location. Many people say it is in a good location, but I disagree. I found it hard to get around as there are no busses stopping nearby or trains, and itâ€™s a bit of a walk to either. Rooms are standard, and the air conditioner vent was dirty and the bathroom had a cracked sink and ceiling. Also, the bathtub is really not good as it has very low water pressure and is equipped with a tiny showerhead in a typical home bath with shower curtain. Very chain feeling and has cheap toiletries. The room does have a iron and ironing board. In general, the hotel is packed out and seems very popular. With these crowds comes noise. You will hear your neighbors as the doors slam up and down the hall. The overall construction of the hotel is cheap. The bed was comfortable. I recommend a hotel out of the city center, in one of the â€œsuburbsâ€�. However, in this same price range and city center location, the Jamison Rydges is far better value for money. The rooms there were far superior to the Four Points.

Reviews.Title: “About right for this price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had 2 rooms here. One was a harbour view room, which contrary to most reviews, did NOT have a great view of darling harbour. It was a more expensive rate, but being only on the 2nd floor, it was less than spectacular to look at a small section of the harbour across a major arterial road leading into Sydney city. The other room was on the top floor and faced the office precinct. This was actually a more intersting view than the previous room. The reason for changing rooms was that broadband is only offered on levels 4+ and that was a feature i required. Broadband was cheaper here then most equivalent hotels in the area at AU$25/day. V.close to a lot of decent restaurants. Good for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great View - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ItalianBob
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to 10th Floor on arrival - superb view over Darling Harbour (which is not huge, but easily big enough). I'm no expert on Sydney but this just might be the very best location in town for a short 3/4 day stay - lots of Bars and Restaurants and voluntary plastic damage. Harbour front is about a 200 yard walk away. Right near MonoRail Station (no noise). Easy short walk over pedestrian bridge to other side of harbour for more Bars, Restaurants and Shops. 15 minute walk to get to Circular Quay, Opera House and that Bridge they never paid for. Circular Quay is where a lot of main harbour tours leave from. If you decide to do the Captain Cook Fine Dining Evening Cruise (bit pricey, but what the heck - lots of Brownie Points) get a window table. Instead of going all the way down to Circular Quay you can join and leave the boat at No 1 Berth at King Street Wharf (about 400 yards from Hotel) There's and old Pub just outside the hotel - from the outside and the photo's it looks great, was going to have a bite and a beer there, but once inside looked jaded and a bit seedy. Overall 4 Pts is a good hotel with helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “give the over priced breakfast a miss and head to.....”
Reviews.Author: fiss
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel over the internet prior to a stay. Our room was on the 7th floor with an excellent view over Darling Harbour, however the balcony was dirty so we did not venture out. Give the breakfast a miss and walk round into Market St. to LIME cafe about 50 yds up from hotel, wonderful food, great service and you pay about half the price of the hotel. This hotel was the most over priced we stayed in during our six week stay however the bed was wonderful just what you are looking for after a 14 hour flight.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at 4 points by Sheraton on Darling Harbor. It was outstanding. We were upgraded to King bed and beautiful harbor view. The staff couldn't have been nicer. We came back through Sydney and stayed again on Australia Day. We did not get an upgrade this time but still had an excellent room without the view. The location is convenient to many nice restaurants and local attractions. It worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: scrummy
Reviews.Content: 4 points has one of the best locations in Sydney. Just around the corner to Darling Harbour (private walkway down) which is best for resteraunts.Just off city centre shopping and convenient for monorail.Views of DH are great. Well recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel on Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: LawyerAbroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this great hotel for 3 nights in mid December 2005. This was our last of 3 sections of our holiday in Sydney, having stayed at the Park Hyatt and the Sebel Pier One earlier (see separate reviews!). Of all 3 hotels we stayed in, we were the most satisifed with this hotel. It's standards were superb, location perfect and service excellent. The entrance is road side, rather than harbour side, and so you don't appreciate where you are until you're inside your room, or walk to Darling Harbour, and then you see how great the location is. Value for money We stayed in a Maritime Studio (which is essentially a deluxe room) on the 15th Floor (the very top floor) on which we got a great deal through Hotel Club.com For comparison, the 3 nights here cost us Â£450 B&B, compared to Â£1050 for 3 nights in a Deluxe Opera View room at the Park Hyatt. Hence why overall (inc value for money) this is a better hotel. The room We had a "Maritime Studio", and whilst I'm not sure of the full range, it seemed equivalent to a Deluxe room. At some other hotels, I've had rooms of this grade described as "junior suites" on account of the room features/balcony. The room was large, with a fanstastic full length wrap round balcony (unique to the maritime studios - other rooms have a smaller balcony, and some just a window), and all glass to the interior - so there were excellent night views to be had across the harbour. The bed was a huge King size bed, and very comfy. There was a separate dressing area and a large bathroom, well supplied with good toiletries etc. The mini bar was well stocked and (compared to many hotels) more moderately priced - we even had a few beers from it. Location If you want the opera house side, you don't want to be at Darling Harbour. DH is a more active and cosmopoitan side of Sydney, even though its not that far away across town. It has a "younger" feel, and there is plenty going on well into the night. Within easy reach of the hotel is the Main Area of Darling Harbour, with its many restaurants and attractions, such as the Aquarium and the Maritime Museum. A little farther is the entertainment complex/casino hotel, Star City, which is worth a look if you like that scene. The hotel itself has a few small shops "built in" as well as being pretty much next to a Monorail Station, which lets you ride around DH in a big loop that also takes in Paddy's Market (a large indoor market, which seems to be dominated by Chinese stall holders!), China town, and some of Sydney's central shopping area. At $3 a trip, its a good deal, though seating is hard to come by when busy. Meals We only had breakfast, but its the usual buffet type and is pretty good. The hotel must cater for a large Japanese clintele as well, as the also serve Miso soup and other oddities for breakfast if you want to try them ! The bar is very friendly and professional, always ready with a Tooheys New after a long walk round town. Service We found all services to be superb, though we heard some argument going on with a reservation mix up as we were checking in, so maybe we were lucky? However, the hotel does have a very "helpful" feel, and the concierge was excellent in helpinmg us make arrangements for airport transfers, booking the Sydney Obsevratory night trip, and even a hire car (which involved a very modest premium for the hotel of something like AUD10). Alternatives There are several hotels in Darling Harbour, though the larger ones seem to be the other side of DH, taking them just a little further away from the centre of Sydney. The other hotels we've stayed at are the Park Hyatt (superb, but pricey), the Sebel Pier One (my opinion - don't bother unless all you want to do is sleep in the room to recover jet lag), and the Quay Grand Suites (an excellent, reasonably priced, all suite hotel next to Circular Quay, if you want to be a the heart of the Quay). Have a great time Michael

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: brcor8
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel located above Darling Harbor (there are many amazing hotels in Syndey, it depends on the location that is important to you). We loved the Four Points, we had a view of the harbour lights in the evening. We had booked the hotel on Priceline but we were treated by the concierge as if we had payed full price - something that I have not found to be the case in other four/five star hotels. Not only was the room outstanding and the view incredible, we were given excellent hotel and sightseeing recommendations. The staff went out of their way to be pleasant and accomodating. Truly a pleasure at the end of an amazing trip to Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cantwaittobethere
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at this hotel and although it is a large hotel used by business people and tourists, we were treated very well by the reception staff. We did not use any of the other facilities in the hotel but our room, which had a harbour view was excellent. The air conditioning was a good send after a long day walking around in the heat and the room was a lovely size and no problems at all to report. Now believe me guys, if there is something to moan about, my hubby will normally find it! The location is fab, just come out of the hotel, turn right and use the stairs at the side of the hotel to get to Darling Harbour. Or come out of the hotel onto the road, turn right onto Market Street and this leads up to the roads which take you to the train station, Tower, shopping, restaurants etc. We managed to walk to the train station from the hotel - took us about 25mins, Paddys Market and just about everywhere. We only used the City hop on hop off buses on the first day and didnt have to use the buses, monorail at all. Do use the train for your Blue Mountain trip, it takes two hours and a ticket for the train and explorer bus is only $37.00 each. If you want more information from our visit, I will be writing a report on the Sydney Forum shortly - my user name is cantwaittobethere and I will give loads of helpful tips on there for all you lucky ones that are going out there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our first 4 nights in Australia. The view of Darling Harbour from the room was amazing. The hotel room was excellent in everyway. The location to transport, the harbour, bars, restaurants and ferries couldn't have been better. A lot of business people use this hotel but tourists are made very welcome by the friendly and courteous staff. I would certainly stay here again on my next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great view!”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaG
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Australia, The Four Points Shearton Darling Harbour in Sydney was our first point of call. We arrived late evening and as we were driving into the city it looked dark and miserable and we were rather concerned as to what we had come to. We pulled up at the Sheraton and checked in to the hotel we had booked a city side room but were offered an upgrade to a harbourside view if we prefered. We took a look at the cityside room and it was looking at a parking lot for an office building so we upgraded to the harbour view. We opened the door and looked out of the huge window to an amazing view of the whole of darling harbour it was really nice definatley worth upgrading. Also it was my partner's birthday and the hotel gave him chocolates and champagne as a gift which we thought was a really nice gesture. The room was pretty modern and spacious with a huge comfortabel bed, the bathroom was not great but clean and functional. The location of the hotel was pretty good for getting around the city, some nice restaurants on darling harbour. The hotel did feel geared towards business people rather than tourists but the staff where pleasant enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Touring Sydney Harbour”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. Paid $165-US. Great location for touring Sydney especially if you are using public transportation. At first glance you think you are in no man's land and then you realize you are just a few steps away from Dahling Harbour. The monorail that circles this area is right around the corner. Its an easy walk to both sides of Cockle Bay where the Maritime Museum and the Sydney Aquarium are located as well as many restaurants. Several good restaurants at nearby King Street Wharf too. We especially enjoyed the Thai one. The room was spotless and the bathroom appeared to have been recently redone. I had a city view room so my room looked out to an office building but I'm sure the harbour side rooms have nicer views. The staff at the concierge desk were especially helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August 2005 on our first visit to Australia. The staff were OK but only a few of them gave you a genuine smile. The 8th floor Harbour View room was excellent with a stunning view across the whole of Darling Harbour. The bed was huge but a bit too soft. The location is brilliant as all the major sites are within walking distance as well as the best shopping areas. There are some top restaurants in Darling Harbour and many others are just minutes away. You really can't go wrong with this location. We will definitely be back one day.

HotelInfo.Name: Four Points by Sheraton Darling Harbour
HotelInfo.Address: 161 Sussex St., Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
